Reviews.Title: “Unless you are staying at the property for a convention I wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is fantastic. The guestrooms are outdated. I would not recommend this property to those who are not there for a convention. The property sits far off from all the "action" of Chicago so if you are into walking to the attractions, this hotel is not that convienient. My experience wasn't horrible that I wouldn't stay there again, I just feel there are better situated properties that are not as outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping, shopping”
Reviews.Author: Leticia G
Reviews.Content: Hotel Services were excellent, in the heart of good food, shopping, shopping, beautiful view to the city, river and invigorating sunrise. Shula's Steak House, inside hotel, was absolutely wonderful, premium steak; hummm I can still savor the meat flavors, tenderness and juices of my steak. Great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “This property is rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: Staffed by a lovely bunch of folks, the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers is coming apart at the seams. The yet to be completed renovations cannot be finished soon enough. If you're sensitive to mold, then do yourself a favour and check your bathroom carefully for mold upon entering your guestroom for the first time. The first guestroom that I was put in had a bad black mold problem in addition to it being in a state of disrepair. The guestroom to which I was subsequently moved also had a mold issue and was similarly less than ideal, but I was too busy to move again. I did let a woman on the reception desk know about the second mold problem upon check out, however. It seems likely that renovated guestrooms are handed out only by special request and even then they are necessarily subject to availability unless you've got some kind of status with Sheraton or you've paid a top rate. Both of the rooms that I saw were dated and a bit tatty. Cleanliness also seems to be a problem. I found a few glaring cleanliness issues during my stay at the hotel, but I discussed only three of them with hotel associates. How hair finds itself smeared on to a bathroom ceiling is beyond me! It could have gotten there by the hand of a guest as easily as it did a dirty housekeeping or maintenance rag, but the point is that it shouldn't be on the ceiling at all. Look, I know that it has to be very difficult to keep guestrooms clean and I take care to leave a couple of bucks for housekeeping cleaners every day, but hair on the ceiling? In my many decades of travelling, that's a first for me. It was a bit of a shock in a hotel of this calibre. If you'll be driving a great deal while in Chicago, then please do know that as of the date of this review and unless otherwise indicated on the meter pay station or by signs posted in the neighbourhood, you can park on the street for free around the hotel from 9:00 p.m. at night until 8:00 a.m. the following morning. For those arriving late and leaving early throughout their stay, this can amount to a significant savings. Empty your car of any valuables and provided it isn't a fancier late model vehicle, it should be safe enough on the streets of Streeterville over night. Street parking is available on the ramp descending from reception or on the streets below the elevated reception level of the hotel, which streets can be accessed from the reception level by a set of stairs at the end of East North Water Street. Parking in this manner saved me anywhere from $60 to $110 during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to see the sights!”
Reviews.Author: DavidAuburn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the River, so it is in a great location to see the sights North and South of the River. We walked everywhere, up the Magnificent Mile to the Hancock Tower, and South to the Art Institute and the Willis (Sears) Tower. We got a great deal from Hotwire, so that made it even better. The part of the hotel we stayed in is a little older, which shows in the bathroom, but it was very clean, and the bedding was very crisp white. The people at the Concierge desk were incredibly helpful and went out of their way to help us. It seems a little outdated that they still charge for wireless, but they did have a bank of public computers downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty fine.”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityMitten
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline to bid on a 4 star hotel for a quick business trip and Sheraton was the result. This is an older outdated hotel so I requested to stay in a room that was part of the renovation (which was granted without issue). I ordered room service (the woman who answered the phone was delightful and helped with my special request). Overall good stay. The only tiny bit of feedback I would give is that valet isn't really "standard valet" when you depart. You have to go down to a lower level parking garage lobby and drive out of the ramp. For the large price you pay you should be able to grab your car out of the front door where you dropped it off. Not a big deal I just should have saved the money and parked in the garage myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GeographyMaster
Reviews.Content: We got a steal of a deal on Hotwire at this hitel. We gambled and took a chance by not knowing which hotel it was going to be. After booking the room, we read the reviews and were a little concerned at what to expect. We spent the day at the Chicago Art Institute and checked into the hotel at 5pm. We were hoping we wouldn't have a problem with the room. We had a pleasant time. We were in room 1843. The room itself was clean. The view was great. It wasn't one of the newly renovated rooms. It could definitly use some updating in the bathroom. It was rusting on the vents and shower bars. It was clean though and the showerhead was nice and strong. There is a wonderful riverwalk behind the hotel and sine the weather was beautiful for a March night in Chicago, we strolled. I recommend you do it also. The staff we encountered was very pleasant. We didn't eat there as the food was way overpriced. The beds were very comfortable. The only issue I had was the bed skirt is bright white, and it was stained and dirty and looked horribly gross. We did find a wonderful little restaurant after walking a mile or so. It was called Tempo. It is on the corner of Chestnut and State. Reasonable, and AWESOME FOOD! All in all I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mold on room service food, guest "services" everytime = "I can't help you, leave me alone". Only grace is bed”
Reviews.Author: stacey212
Reviews.Content: Service here has gone to hell. The guest services was some of the rudest I've encountered in a starwood. Whenever I called for a simple request I was rudely hung up on after the guest services employee said they couldn't do anything for me. My requests were not over the top. For example, I was wondering if I could get a fork sent to my room because I wanted to eat some leftovers. The Sheraton employee was shocked at my request as if I had asked her to give me a sponge bath. Avoid this place if you want to be treated with any respect. I come to Chicago over 20 times a year for business and I won't be back here again. I swear the only saving grace of this place is the bed. Avoid this place unless you have no need for service and just want a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “I really want to like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: summitsvs
Reviews.Content: But they do make it hard! I always have problems when I stay here. Last time they lost a package, this time my room bill was just a mess. It eventually was straightened out, but it seems to be always something. The rooms are great. Comfy beds and clean. I am not a big fan of the move a food or drink item and you get charged. Just stay clear of that entire area and maybe tape any children to a far wall for the duration of your stay! What I really wrote about again is that they finally made the fitness center 24 hour access. Yeah! Internet was refunded in the end (for club members only? meeting attendees only?) Never got a clear answer. Both were badly needed upgrades to keep this hotel competitive with its competition.

Reviews.Title: “What a location...”
Reviews.Author: Wiscmom2
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago on business and our group stayed at the Sheraton. The staff was very nice, beds are "heavenly"! They have their own brand of bedding and I slept wonderful! The lobby is very nice and great location to Navy Pier and some shopping. There was not a fridge in the room for personal use (it is loaded w/ overpriced things to buy). The breakfast buffet is $26 per person... a little high (but you are in Chicago). There is a grocery store down the block w/ a Starbucks - just in case you would like some groceries to get you by. Located right on the river there are awesome views and this is a great location if you want to do stuff in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I frequent Chicago, and this was my first stay at the Sheraton - I was definitely not impressed. We stayed 3 nights, and this was a preferred hotel for the event we were attending. The rooms are ok, not a 4 star. Here is why I was disappointed: 1. We requested and paid for a roll-away bed, and it took several phone calls to have it delivered 2. There was a half empty small bottle of wine in our mini-fridge, obviously sampled by a previous guest. We needed an extra key, so went to the front desk to get the key and tell them about the wine, so it would not be charged to our room. There was a HUGE line at the desk for checking in, with 3 people working. 2 guests of our room, including myself are Starwood Preferred members. So we went to the separate SPG line, which no one else was in at the time. This separate line clearly did not matter. The desk people were taking forever with each person they helped, and would motion for the next guest in the regular line to come forward, completely ignoring us. We waited in the line almost an HOUR, of course trying to get to the desk but being trumped by someone else they would call up. When we finally got to the desk, the attendant seemed very irritated. I kindly explained about the wine, he said he would take care of it. When our final bill came the next morning, there was a $23 charge for the wine. So we still had to call down and have it removed from our bill, fully realizing we had wasted an hour for nothing. 3. The doormen were continuously standing around, never once opening a door for us, even when we were clearly struggling with multiple bags. 4. When we checked out, we had tons of bags to load in the car. I had self parked, so pulled off to the side in the small circle drive, and a doorman if it was ok to park there while we loaded, as there was no signage at all. He was quite rude, didn't say yes or no, only "give me your keys". really?? I should also mention, we booked this room through the spg site, not a 3rd party, and are SPG members. I've had so many great experiences with other Chicago hotels, I will choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location overlooking the river”
Reviews.Author: GregSecord
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location. Overlooks the river and easy walk to Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LKW9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a second time and was impressed again - and delighted that the Hotel has stopped charging for the use of the gym. The location is central and the higher floors have great views - at check in the receptionist asked me if I wanted a twin with a great view instead of my king on a low floor - no competition! The room decor is really looking dated hence only 4 out of 5 stars - the air conditioning isn't very effective either. Ordered American Breakfast in my room - it was delicious and one of the few hotels I have been to that manage to serve warm toast with the in-room breakfasts. All the staff seemed engaged and helpful. Definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back!”
Reviews.Author: Abcdmk
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel through Hotwire and it was supposed to be a 4 star hotel. This hotel is definitely not a 4 star hotel. I was excited to enjoy the nice view and ask for it at my check-in and she said "I put you in a room with a great view"...that turned out to be a garage view!!! Then I called them to change my room and they told me " we are completely booked and we can't change your room" then why did you lie at the check-in, just be honest. The room was very small and congested with old carpets and old bathroom.there were stains and hair all over the bathroom...But after all, the main surprise came to me when I was getting ready to take a shower in the morning. THERE WAS AN OLD SOAP COVER ON THE SHOWER WALL!!!! I tried to call but no one answered my phone, then I went to the front desk and the same lady who checked me in was there. She acted like it's not a big deal, not even an apology. Are you kidding me? The least that a cleaning person could do is to get rid of visible trash and disposables, when there is a soap cover sticking to the wall, who knows what's there that you can't see. I could not convince myself to take a shower there and we left without even taking a shower. I will never ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Randy D
Reviews.Content: We had six rooms and they were all spacious. The staff always takes good care of us. The staff members in the executive lounge on the 33rd floor were fantastic. Friendly and efficient. Location is close to lots many restaurants. Beds were comfortable, the water in the shower was always hot (which is not always the case in other hotels), the elevators were fast, and the service was great everywhere in the hotel. Even the taxi lines moved quickly. I stay in tons of hotels in my travels, but this is the only one that I am this loyal to. I have not found this level of service anywhere else, and the value is the best in town. You will not be disappointed. Randy D

Reviews.Title: “Large, impersonal convention hotel conveniently located in the center of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: newyorkbo
Reviews.Content: I have spend two separate weeks at this property recently, once during the month of January and once during February. This property is quite large though their staffing seems to have been greatly reduced. The concierge desk was never manned. I never saw more than two staffmembers at the front desk. The rooms are quite dated but are of a standard size and adequately maintained. The animal print wallpaper is peeling at spots and the furniture in the rooms is showing more than average wear and tear. The location of this property is just north of the Chicago river and one block east of Michigan Avenue. The loop and the Magnificent Mile are within easy walking distance. The airport is easily accessed by cathing the 65 busline (directly behind the PJ Clarke's restaurant in front of the hotel) which will take you to Milwaukee where you can catch the blue line to O'Hare. Chicago's buses are equipped with visual and auditory indications for each stop. There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance of this hotel. Transportation is excellent with a CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) 7-day pass available for $23. You can purchase this pass at the Blue Line station at O'Hare. Beware: if you are looking for dinner after a day of business meetings you will be hard set to find any restaurants open after 10pm!

Reviews.Title: “Gets my stamp of approval.”
Reviews.Author: Jana S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. great location, great self parking, great accommodations, very good staff,and an excellent view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great restaurant, Small bath(room), Super breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bolleboos
Reviews.Content: Location very good. Price very acceptable. Best breakfast I ever had in the USA ! Friendly staff especially the concierge who made a lot of efforts to help us in booking restaurant(s) downtown. Hotel restaurant of excellent quality with a wide variety of different wines. Bathroom rather small and could use some refurnishment. Room size OK and beds of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, traveling w/ dog”
Reviews.Author: glutenfreeonthego
Reviews.Content: We arrived Valentine's Day mid-afternoon with pup on our second day of a cross-country move to California. Our GPS could not find the actual hotel entrance, but we managed to get around some of the strange one-way and under-building streets to find it. Comfortable, spacious and blessedly quiet room with firm (maybe just a bit too firm) bed, several pillow options, reasonably outfitted fitness center, small area for pet walking just across the street. Front desk, bell and concierge service were so refreshingly cordial and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Quiet. Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kate H
Reviews.Content: The pool and spa cost extra to use so be prepared for the extra $10 charge. Great place to stay. Quiet. Comfortable and convenient. Parking on the property is a bit steeply priced.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: michelle0510
Reviews.Content: The hotel is impeccable. checked in with Lanette and she genuinely cares for our needs. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived but she offered to take our luggage and also (later we found out) she gave us an upgraded room. Breakfast at the restaurant downstairs is a MUST! Best breakfast ever; fresh juice station, bakery station, chefs stands for different tastes.. etc. Exceptional services through out the hotel! The concierge was really helpful (sorry that we don't remember her name but her mother in law lives in Boston),and you even see the general manager adjusting the picture frames in the lobby. What a wonderful experience! Thank you. Michelle and Darren

Reviews.Title: “Sunday night get away”
Reviews.Author: RCSTACK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to get to and an easy walk to the Mag Mile. The beds are SO COMFY and the hotel is well run. The pool is very nice and there is a sauna. Great workout room too! I'd stay here again as a family :)

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: shirebuyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to Michigan Ave shops and good restaurants. It is off the main busy street so easy to park if you bring your car. Staff goes out of their way to be helpful. We always get a good recommendation for a restaurant and get a certificate for either a complimentary appetizer or dessert. The views from any floor are great. Either river or lake view.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Stay and caliber is consistent”
Reviews.Author: lindolaura
Reviews.Content: We stay in Chicago every year for a convention and this was our fourth year in a row choosing the Sheraton Chicago Towers. We have stayed at the Fairmont, the Hyatt and the Hiltons before the Sheraton beats them all in consistently providing us a great stay. Always able to check in early, great beds, rooms, lobby bar and restaurant choices. Also the location is what we like, walking distance to EVERYTHING. We do upgrade to the club level and just for the convience of breakie it is worth it let alone all the other perks it provides.

Reviews.Title: “Super-comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Olivia V
Reviews.Content: The beds in this hotel are very comfy, we still talk about their beds and compare them to any hotel we stay at. The location of the hotel is very good, even in cold, rainy November days, we walked to all the major attractions and shopping districts from the hotel and it's in a secure neighborhood. The parking is very convenient, just underneath the hotel. There are drugstores around the hotel, so you can get water, snacks, shampoo, toothpaste, souvenirs etc. whenever you need.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, solid value but cold and corporate”
Reviews.Author: SusieQpacific
Reviews.Content: Loved spending time in the city...found the people very warm and friendly but not this hotel. Service was ok but formula. Great for corporate I'm sure but not so great for fun time with friends. Location was central and the price was right but I'd go boutique hotel next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great...that is about it...”
Reviews.Author: tcards05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a year or so ago for a wedding. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby/views are wonderful. That is where it stops. The staff is among the worst I have ever experienced and the rooms are awful! The rooms are small and very dated - the bathrooms are nasty and old. I wanted to use a bell cart upon our departure because I was sick of tipping for every little thing (I'm not cheap, but EVERYTHING in this hotel cost something) and the bellman would not let me - I HAD to have a bellman assist us. After three days of pulling out $5 here and $10 there, I was done. My wife, elderly parents and 2 year old son took our own luggage down from our rooms and then had to mess with their stupid parking situation. The bell staff was beyond rude and the front desk acted as if we were a bunch of hicks coming into the big city. We travel to Chicago a couple of times a year, but this is NOT a hotel we will ever stay at again. I don't mind tipping, but when someone is doing something for me because they expect to be tipped, I draw the line. PS this dump is waaaaaaay to expensive for the rooms/service provided - the location is the ONLY thing it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: The people at the Sheraton Chicago were friendly and helpful, especially Suzanne Spring, our concierge. The hotel is very clean and in the center of all that is happening in Chicago. We are SPG members and find the properties always live up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Our compliments for the service received from Suzanne Spring”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: On our way to your hotel for an over night stay so that we could attend our Grand Daughter's gymnastics event on Sunday Morning we ran into a detour on Wacker Street and ended up lost. Not having GPS and being stranded in the middle of downtown Chicago we called your concierge's desk and immediately Suzanne calmed our fears and assured us that she would get us to the hotel safe and sound. She stayed on the phone with us street by street, never once making us feel like we were keeping her from something more important, until we arrived at your hotel for our stay. During our time on the phone with Suzanne we were her only concern and that is why from now on all of our stays in Chicago will be spent at your Sheraton Hotel on Water Street. Again Thanks, Jim and Kathy Taylor

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: morris7180
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we were informed that "self Parking" had no in-out privileges and was $37.00 per day. The valet option did have in-out privileges, so we chose that option, but it cost $51.00 per day. A total of $102.00 to park our car for two days at the hotel. The valet doesn't even bring the car to the front door, you have to go down to the basement to pick up your car. The parking charge was 1/3 the cost of our room which we were not happy about, nor do they tell you that when you book your room. Secondly, being the weekend before Valentine's, my husband thought it would be a special surprise to have flowers in our room. He called the hotel a few days before our arrival and spoke to the concierge who assured him they could take care of that. He was referred to Randolph florist, who also said, they do that all the time. Well upon our arrival, no flowers in the room, spoiling the surprise my husband had planned. The hotel did have the flowers, they offered no apologies or explanation as to what happened with the flower delivery. Thirdly, the hotel offers free wi-fi in the rooms, but we had difficulty on my laptop of getting a signal strong enough to use the wi-fi. We sure were disappointed and upon expressing our disappointment were referred by the concierge to log our feedback on tripadvisor.com. Fourthly, we were attending the Auto Show and the hotel advertised a free shuttle to the convention center. The hours of the shuttle were 8am - 11am and then from 7:30pm - 10pm. These times were not advertised anywhere on the hotel web site, only that there was a free shuttle. Some other travelers waited over 75 minutes for the shuttle, that was supposed to run every 1/2 hour. The hotel was convenient to .various locations within walking distance for food, etc....but a return trip back to Chicago will result to in us staying in a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “While I am here, I'll say this”
Reviews.Author: JasonDurrett
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, we are here right now on the 33 floor. The bed is amazing and the room is clean and spacious BUT and you know there is always a but. I am very disappointed at the club lounge. I am a gold club member for spy and I have stayed in a LOT of Sheraton properties and to have a price of $180 a night on hot-wire they could have had a better breakfast. I have stayed at many whetstone and paid much less for the club floor lounge access and gotten hot breakfast. Traveling to a place you do not know and especially with driving being so difficult in Chicago. It would have been nice. Defineatly not with the upgrade price to the club floor. Very disappointed in this Sheraton club brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Colleen P
Reviews.Content: There are two parts to this review...FIRST THE SERVICE: As we were checking in, a young man named Donnie and a young woman who looks just like the actress, Jennifer Connelly (I say that because I can't recall her name) were assisting us. We mentioned we were staying at the Sheraton for our daughter's birthday. Could we get our adjoining rooms with a nice view? No problem. Done. Donnie and "Jennifer" asked what we had planned and if we needed any help planning our day and night in the city. We didn't, but next thing I know as we are out enjoying Chicago, is that Donnie is calling me on my cell phone to find out my daughter's favorite type of cupcake. That evening we had cupcakes sent to our room for all of us, including a hand signed (by several employees) birthday card for her. We were treated like royalty and it made my daughter's birthday so incredibly special. Service on every account was EXCELLENT. NEXT: THE ROOMS: pretty, but not particularly clean in the bathroom - mold in bathroom vents, gross ring around the base of the toilets at floor level. Felt like it needed to be bleached. Having said that we would be back in a heartbeat as the service was so warm and genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sfischburg
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel for conventions. Right on the river and good meeting space. Front desk staff was excellent, food and beverage staff in banquets and restaurants were OK. Seemed overworked. Not crisp. Room was small but well appointed. One of the few rooms that had almost enough power outlets. Room was clean. Shower was great, lots of pressure.Mattress was comfortable. Great views of Lake Michigan from high floors.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy rooms and Fitness Club; Restaurant service horrible; Housekeeping minimal”
Reviews.Author: KarmenSandy
Reviews.Content: I was here for the ESEA-NCLB Conference and if it weren't for this conference I would never come back to this hotel...I definitely wouldn't pay $179 of my own money for this hotel. The only good thing is the location. The restaurants are over priced and have horrible service...EVEN shulas! I had a corner room that was smaller than most, which wouldn't have bothered me but a light bulb was out, the furniture was dingy and when I opened the mini-fridge it smelled like something died in there. The fitness center was dingy and dusty. This hotel needs an update bad! I will be sending a note to the meeting organizers to concern changing locations.

Reviews.Title: “Geat service, friendly staff and very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: nfbV
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Sheraton the bellman directed us to some more affordable parking that was very close. At check in we mentioned we had a long week with family and were just getting a little retreat. We booked through priceline, so you never know what you're gonna get. The wonderful lady that checked us in upgraded to a king room with an awesome view of the trump building and downtown. The bedding and accommodations were spectacular. We drank and dined in the Schula';s steakhouse that is on property and received remarkable service and the steak tartar and oysters were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Let's Call This a 3.75 Hotel That's Looking Up!”
Reviews.Author: M&ALongGrove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night downtown last Saturday. For many years I worked about 3 blocks away, and I wanted to see how much the area had changed/grown since we moved out of the city. Well, things have changed - more condos, new restaurants. Walking around the block, up and down Ohio St, St.Clair and the "She Streets" - Superior, Huron and Erie - was fun. Lots of interesting places. I remember when this hotel was being built, years ago back in the early '90's. It was quite a spectacular sight back then. It still is! But the time has come for some "freshening up." And I do understand that a complete room renovation will be done by 2014. That's great! And that's why I give the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers a solid 3.75 stars - for now. (It gets a 4-star on the TripAdvisor rating scale.) Here are a few highlights of our stay: We checked-in on Saturday, a little after 3pm, and were warmly greeted by Olga at the front desk. (Nice job representing Sheraton, Olga!) As requested, we got a King Room on a higher floor. Room 1150. It faces north, so I got a good city view, looking down toward my old office building on Ohio St. Things that we noted: the building is still impressive; the lobby is beautiful; the Java Bar is still a "warm classy" place to have a drink and share some conversation; fantastic river view, looking south; Shula's Steak House, right there off the lobby. All really nice. (Note: since we know our way around, the hotel simply served as a one-night "home base," so I don't have anything else to offer about the other hotel features or services.) Now for some room detail: The room was very clean. But it is dated. The carpeting and wall paper - which carries over from the hallway - brought back memories of my 86 year-old mother's harvest gold-color refrigerator, which she got rid of 25 years ago. That refrigerator would have nicely matched the color scheme in this room. The furniture did appear to be newer. And the bed was fantastic. Very comfortable. There was also a nice LG flat-screen HD TV which, I would guess, was about 30 - 32". It was placed on top of the mini bar cabinet. When we walked in, the room was warm. There are 2 heaters in this room. Both were on. (It was in the low-40's outside.) We turned both of the heaters off. The room stayed warm all night. The bathroom was clean and tidy. However, there were only 2 bath towels. We could have used another. (Note: when we initially turned on the bathroom light, the bath fan automatically went on, as it should. However, later in the evening, a very loud and annoying buzzing sound was coming from the fan. Later, the fan didn't come on at all. So, if you don't already know, Sheraton Management, you need to repair/replace the bath fan in 1150.) The only other thing to mention here is that the internet access is $12.95/day in the room/hotel. So, as noted above, given our limited stay, if room 1150 is a good representation of the majority of rooms currently available: you can expect a very clean, well-maintained room that needs to be updated. Still nice. But, it's not a 4 or 5 star room. And that makes this hotel a 4-star hotel, at best, right now. You seasoned travelers will understand this. However, it's still a very nice hotel, given the location, service and other amenities. Just one more thing that surprised me about my old work neighborhood: when we were up in the room, looking down at the street, I noticed a Dominick's Grocery Store a couple blocks away. I though that it would probably be the typical, small city grocery store. So, on the way back to the hotel before dinner, after having a couple drinks at Timothy O'Toole's, a local watering hole, we stopped in to check out the Dominick's. What a surprise! This store is HUGE! And it has absolutely anything and everything that you could ever want from a grocery - it was amazing for a downtown location. So . . . When all you Packers fans come to Chicago to beat the Bears, book a room at the convenient-to-Soldier Field-Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. Then hightail it over to the Dominick's to load-up on your beer and the brats from the vast selection in their deli. You're sure to have a good time. And you can probably buy a portable grill there, too. Ya hey!!

Reviews.Title: “"Beautiful hotel, Great Location w/excellant service"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at various nice hotels being a SPG member. This ranks on of the best I've stayed in for Chicago. The hotel itself is very spacious, has a beautiful decor and all the amenties you will need (i.e a Fed Ex store and restaurants inside). I stayed on the top floor which gave a great view and the club lounge was very nice. The hotel is a great location(about 4 blocks from Navy Pier) and the site seeing trolly stops one block down in between the hotel and the AMC movie theater. There are many shops, entertainment venues and restaurants within walking distance. The thing that impressed me the most was the customer service. I did have to wait for my room at check-in but the reception desk was more than willing to make it worth my wait with "Nelson M." being a pleasure to work with. Instead of making excuses like you find with some properties the focus point was making me and my stay as pleasant as possible. I even left my watch in the window and they sent it back to me the same day I called!

Reviews.Title: “Was very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Autresejour
Reviews.Content: Read mixed reviews on TA after I had a blind booking on Hotwire that turned out to be Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers.Had some apprehension about choice until I arrived.From Reception till Checkout everything was fine.No check-in line(it was a Saturday and no large conventions),the room was clean,comfortable, with updated electronics and amenities.Bed,as stated by others,terrific! Staff,from doormen,concierge,reception,cashier...all professional,polite and friendly.I would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to others based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jennifer529
Reviews.Content: Great location! Booked thru Hotwire and got a great price! Went to Catch 35 for dinner..within walking distance..very good if you like sushi! Bed and linens were very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: BrendanC_4
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Chicago and we stayed at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. We initially had a bit of trouble finding the hotel and none of the locals seemed to know where the hotel was or if it even existed. Nevertheless, we did end up finding it. We arrived early and had to store our luggage. I tipped the guy who stored the luggage but didn't tip the bellman when I picked it up and he kind of game me a "pffffff", which I found pretty unprofessional. The hotel was excellent. It has a great location downtown Chicago and walking distance to many of the places we visited. We had a very nice, clean, spacious room. We had to use the concierge several times for assistance and the lady who served us was outstanding. Can't remember her name but she was an older lady who has worked there several years. She is a gem for this hotel. On a side note, you must try Smoque restaurant. We had to take the subway to get there but it was well worth the trip. Without a doubt the best ribs I have had in my life. We stayed on the Starwood Preferred level and the lounge on that floor is amazing. It has a great view of Chicago and very good snacks in the morning and evening. When we checked out, we had to store luggage again. Again, I tipped one bellman but the one who put one of the bags in the cab didn't get a tip and he slammed the door of the cab so hard he almost took off my leg. The cab driver even turned around and gave the bellman a "What the f?" stare. Pretty unbelievable. I wasn't too happy with these bellman almost sticking their hands out to you everytime you came within two feet of them. I won't let these two incidents with the bellman taint what was otherwise a great stay at the Sheraton. I will stay there again when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 20LovetoVacation00
Reviews.Content: Good Location, easy parking, nice room.....bathroom was a little outdated, but perfectly adequate.....only drawback we found is at 11:30 at night there wasn't a single bar open or food options in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “34th Floor: Upriver view of Trump Tower.....Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: qtrready
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference for four nights. Execellent view on concierge level. Close to everything. People were nice. Not a single complaint. Expensive, but someone else paid

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Hardik V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sheraton , Chicago on the 4th of July weekend. Its a big hotel with good amenities. The best part is the location as its bang in the middle of downtown Chicago. The rooms are fairly good. I had a river facing room on a higher floor so the view was great. I could see the 4th of July fireworks from my room. The hotel has a couple of good restaurants as well. The Chicago Burger Company serves great burgers & also has a sit out area by the river. You can spend a good afternoon with drinks & great burgers by the river. Cabs are always available just outside the hotel. Michican Avenue is walking distance from the hotel. Great hotel for a short stay. Upside - Location - Food Downside - None

Reviews.Title: “Our BEST winter trip to Chicago to date!”
Reviews.Author: MamaBruff
Reviews.Content: Why we chose this hotel: We were going to Chicago to attend the Strictly Sail Show at the Navy Pier. After checking reviews on Trip Advisor (ALWAYS do this first!), we booked our room directly with the Sheraton by phone. It was the "show" hotel, so we were given the "show" rate at booking. (a free shuttle provided by the Show was provided for show attendees also... thank you Strictly Sail!) We were glad that the hotel (Located in the "Streeterville" area, and across the street and south of the NBC building,) was close to the Navy Pier, as well as the restaurants and shopping there downtown. Weather permitting, everything was within walking distance. Upon arrival: We were greeted by a helpful doorman, a beautiful, comfortable lobby, and (with no wait whatsoever) then Isaiah Jones at the reception desk. He was very friendly and helpful, as were the 3 other receptionists we saw there. Isaiah helped find us the best room, even one he would "put his Mom in", facing to the SW over the Chicago River. We were delighted with our room! It was clean and well appointed. The washcloths were missing, however, and a quick call to Darius produced some new washcloths in just a few minutes. After stowing our luggage in the big closet, and freshening up in the spotless bathroom, we watched the sun set through the "canyon" of glass and steel buildings, then headed off to dinner with friends. Bedtime: The King size bed was a slice of heaven, so comfortable! There were 4 pillows to choose from, and a light down coverlet and comforter to keep warm under. The wall heating unit was quiet, and didn't seem to kick in and out all night like some do. We slept with the curtains open, looking out over the city lights, and the rim of the lake. For a couple of small town folks, this was pretty darn magical! Staff: Everyone was friendly and helpful, even directing to nearby restaurants. Caution: Minibar and snack tray supplies are on an automatic scale, and checked daily. Inspect your bill for charges prior to check out. (We were charged for a bottle of wine we didn't drink) Misc: The passive vent in the bathroom worked quite well to exhaust steam and odors. (no exhaust fan) The minifrig was fully stocked, leaving NO ROOM for anything we might want chilled. There was free ice just down the hall, however, and an ice bucket. The coffee maker was of the "pod" type, featuring Starbucks "Kitaamu" (fabulous) coffee. There was tea, also, but no way to heat any water. (Microwave?) Internet WIFI was available for 12.50/day, but we just used our iPhones. Taxis waiting in front of hotel ($10 to the Shedd Aquarium, and $10 from Shedd to Union Station) and bus stop across the corner made easy transportation to areas beyond walking distance. OVERALL: "We'll be back!"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Len B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night prior to attending the Strictly Sail Show at Navy Pier. We found the hotel via the Strictly Sail web site, which had an arrangement with the Sheraton Towers hotel. We upgraded to a 'Deluxe' room, which overlooked the Chicago River facing west. The Club Room was very nice, with a nice selection of snacks in the evening. The staff both in the Club Room and hotel was very polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: diver323
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through SPG.com and were offered an upgrade. The room was fabulous as was the view! It was in a great location. The shuttle to the strictly sail event at navy pier was great although probably didn't run often enough. The club lounge was fabulous. Renee and Connie took good care of our party of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyMichigander
Reviews.Content: Arrive at hotel and wait in line. Finally get to counter and no record of reservation made on Expedia. Nice man at front desk gets us "upgraded room". It has a very nice view of the Trump Tower, but the room is small and cramped with 2 double beds. Don't hotels do 2 queens anymore? NIce HD tv but the furniture is getting worn down. Bathroom small and very basic, not what you would expect from a better rated hotel. Our room had an adjoining door. Noise from room next door was so bad and so scary called security who did promptly respond. Lost about 2-3 hours sleep. Requested room change which we received, but there went our view. I would like to say some nice things about the Sheraton. The breakfast buffet downstairs was very good and had extremely attentive and friendly workers. The crepe maker was great. By Chicago standards, with kids eating free, it was a pretty good deal for breakfast. Time to check out, tv would not bring up account. Off to another line. After about 12 minutes, finally get to the desk. The price of the room and being able to self park were good deals, but we won't be back. There are so many other options in Chicago, I think I'll try some others out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsOlson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night NYE eve (Dec 30th) and enjoyed it. We had a great lake view room on a high floor (can't remember which) and the view of the lake and Navy Pier was great. It is a good hotel for the money and has a good location. Not quite on Michigan Ave, but 1 block east. We were not going to be in our room except to pass out in so we went for a decently priced hotel with good location and not a lot of frills. If we were on a romantic weekend and spending a lot of time in our room, we might have chosen elsewhere. It is great that they have self-parking attached which saved $20 or so. It is just far to drag your bags to the lobby/room, but still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Chicago for a most enjoyable weekend. We had a junior suite, which was very spacious, and this, by far, was the most impeccably clean hotel we have ever stayed at! It also had the most amazingly comfortable king-size mattress and bedding. We had the best nights sleep in a long time. We had dinner at the hotel -- Shula's -- which was a nice treat with great service, but pricey. The hotel is conveniently located just short cab rides away from shopping & Chicago attractions. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reasonable staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ashmdy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers multiple times; most recent was New Year eve, 2012. Being Starwood Platinum preferred guest, I usually get upgraded to one of the good rooms â€“ this time, I insisted to get a room that overlooks Michigan Avenue and river and the hotel front desk agent was really kind enough to give me the room. When I entered the room, I felt I could not have gotten any better place to stay for my New Year eve (Please see the picture attached). Overall, I find this hotel very good and comfortable. Staff is courteous and kind. When I was checking-in, the duty manager came to me and personally asked to reach out if I need anything to have a better stay. For me, the most fascinating factor is the location! I love downtown Chicago and nearby area and this hotels offers excellent access to entire downtown Chicago â€“ I can walk to anywhere I want, whether it is Magnificent mile or south loop or the millennium park or to AMC or to a tones of amazing restaurants. The hotel is right at the river so once I stayed at the hotel during summers and I used run along the river in the evening. All in all, I would stay in this hotel, purely because of its location. I think itâ€™s not fair to praise just the location; the hotel has a nice ambience, comfortable room (though the mattress on the bed could be better â€“ I didn't find it hard enough), hotel serves decent breakfast in the lounge, nice lobby with giant touch screens to find out whatâ€™s happening with the city and your flight. One thing I find quite pleasant with this hotel â€“ everything seems to function so well. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to experiences the elegance of downtown Chicago (Yes, It is elegant!). I will of course go back and stay at this hotel whenever I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and staff”
Reviews.Author: Chuck40Traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend in Chicago and stayed at this hotel. Had a wonderful experience with hotel and staff. Great room. Big size and well apportioned. My only disappointment was the restaurant, Shula's. While the Shula's service was excellent, the actual food didn't match the quality of the price. There are plenty of other steakhouses in Chicago and hotel guests should keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MJCNewYork_NewYork
Reviews.Content: I spent one week for work here, it was great. The staff were very professional and friendly. The rooms are spacious and modern. The lounge is great as well. The conference facilities are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: shellyb007
Reviews.Content: This is a large Sheraton property in the city of Chicago. The room was a nice size and it was pretty easy to navigate the hotel for a conference I was attending. The common hallways were very cold, with cold air blowing around. The individual rooms that are partitioned off for meeting rooms were also difficult to manage the temperature in. The Mayfair room has a very interesting sparkling ceiling piece but it was distracting to be in a room with it when I was there for a meeting.... if it had been a party it would have been lovely. Did not see a lot of options for food in the close vacinity but I was only there for a weekend so we either walked farther or took a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very comfortable for the price”
Reviews.Author: al s
Reviews.Content: I did have the experience of needing the concierge. Marisa D. was the best. So helpful and dedicated to helping me. I will continue to stay at the Sheraton during future visits. The club level had a great breakfast but was a little light on the evening offering. All was clean and fresh. I would recomend the Sheraton. Great staff

Reviews.Title: “A good Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: aforth
Reviews.Content: As far as Sheratons go, this is a pretty good one. We had great views from the 27th floor, and I enjoyed using the pool and gym. The location is very close to the Magnificent Mile, though the area isn't great for restaurants and nightlife. Staff were helpful and responsive to our needs, and we appreciated the many printouts they gave us for finding nearby restaurants or ordering in. The rooms offered free bottled water--something not standard across the board with Sheraton hotels. The complimentary Starbucks coffee is a nice touch. We got free wireless internet for the duration of our 5-night stay because my wife signed up for the Starwood program, but in general I think it is a bit much that apparently full-service business hotels don't automatically offer free internet when so many budget tourist-oriented accommodations do. The hotel did offer free printing, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheCarry-ons
Reviews.Content: We spent the night here between the holidays. First class all the way around. Very good front desk service, nice, big, room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you can get it at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: jeff2120
Reviews.Content: I considered this hotel a bargain at a conference rate of $109 a night, although the Chicago taxes make it more expensive. It is on the river near the lake, within walking distance of the art museum. View was alright but not stunning. The Sheraton is a little further from the nearby restaurants and shopping than other hotels and the hotel has limited late night eating options. We tried to eat at 10:30PM and the only thing open was Shula's and that was by the bar. The food was fine. Downstairs is an expensive deli (wrapped sandwhich, chips, and drink for $13). Pool was fine with marked lanes for lap, locker room clean. Room was clean. My double beds were very comfortable. Bathroom fine, tile floor, shower in good sha pe. Maids friendly. Beware of scamming shoe shine artists around the corner of the hotel. I figured I'd give the guy a few books for very little work and he charged me some rip off price. If you want a shine, ask how much in advance total (not per shoe). Yeah, I was niave, but figured I would warn you. My collegue thought the thing was a riot. My wallet did not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice chain hotel, Superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Riverdawn
Reviews.Content: First, the room itself: I had one of the hotel's regular, standard rooms. I believe it was a king size bed. The room was very large for a standard hotel room, and had lovely views of the river, the lake and the Navy Pier (although presumably this is a "luck of the draw" situation. More importantly, the room was spotlessly clean, quiet, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only downside was the fact that the internet connection (the room offered both wired and wifi) was NOT free (it cost about 13$ per 24 hour period) and even with the wired connection the speed of the internet was rather mediocre. If I pay for internet, it should at least be very fast. However, more important than the room itself, was the staff. Now, normally in these big chain hotels, I neither expect nor have many interactions with the staff, and I generally expect them to be very "by-the-book" - polite, but not flexible. The staff at this hotel really went above and beyond to be both friendly and helpful. One example of this is the fact that I arrived in the hotel for a very very large conference, and the hotel was full to capacity. I arrived in the morning, hours before the normal check-in time, and I was not alone. There were quite a few of us. The courteous and professional front-desk assistant apologized that the room was not ready yet, but said they were working as quickly as possible to get the rooms ready for early check-ins, and took my phone number to call me when the room was ready. I did not expect to hear for several hours, but within 20 minutes my phone rang, and five minutes after that I was safely ensconced in my room. In addition to this, there were numerous other occasions in which the hotel staff really went above and beyond to be both friendly and find fast solutions to difficult problems. It really made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “dirty tired and stained”
Reviews.Author: nanana
Reviews.Content: I must say that this was my husband experience not mine. I would have left after what he found there... I mean, he told me the room was tired, had stained looked furniture, and is badly in need of remodeling. On top of it all, there was an acrid smell in the room... soon enough while unpacking the source of the smell was uncovered. A drawer full of rotten fruits. Does anyone ever clean the room? what exactly is cleaned after a guest left and another is presented to the rooms? Fortunately, the cleaning crew responded to the complaint and quickly act to solve the problem. In all, the staff are helpful, but the hotel infrastructure is in need of improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: LSmithTO
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in this Sheraton. Rooms are old and in a serious need of updating. Wallpaper peeling severely. Our bathroom was dirty and was never properly cleaned the entire 5 night stay. There was a large, prominent cigarette burn on top of the comforter that was never replaced for the whole stay. Location is good and most of the staff were very nice. The one, extremely rude, low class staff member was the older woman with long dark hair working in the Club Lounge. She was nasty and snappy and would only change her tune if you ordered wine from her. She even kept the water and pop in the back so that you would have to "order" it, hence her trying to get tips. The small amount of food put out at night was pathetic, the floors were covered in food and the food was not replenished. On the other hand, the gentleman who worked in the club lounge in the mornings was friendly, professional and hardworking. He managed to keep the area clean and food replenished at all times. He also put the beverages in the beverage fridge so we could help ourselves (as it should be!). Another gripe with the Club Lounge is that for our entire stay neither computer in the lounge worked. There was no sign on either computer saying they were out of service either. Finally, we were told that they had been out of service for a week. Unacceptable. Within a quick walking distance to Fox and Obel which is a gourmet grocery store and take out. Excellent food. First and last time at the Chicago Sheraton but definitely not Chicago which is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: The staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and professional. Our room had a great view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. A great way to spend new years eve!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: ecurranrx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in the crisp winter air view was fantastic!!! We had a room right on the river which was beautiful! Call hotel directly to request the river view the Sheraton main 800number was not sure what I was talking about they only knew city view or lake which is the other side of the hotel and is lake Michigan. View was so beautiful I made my husband leave the curtains open so I could fall asleep looking out the window and got up to see the view in the middle of the night. Area is very close to best resturants and shopping. Would love to go back in the summer and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NancyJamesM
Reviews.Content: Here are the main points: - the staff is EXCELLENT! I don't think I have ever been treated so well anywhere. - the location is perfect. You are 2 blocks from the Navy Pier and 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile. - the only negative in my opinion is the lack of a hot tub/whirlpool

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and awesome view of the Chicago river”
Reviews.Author: Losing
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sheraton were very nice and very accommodating! The suite was very comfortable for our family of 4! Also, the location was great. We walked to Navy Pier and to Michigan Ave. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cumbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference and although full the staff coped well. The location is good and an easy walk to most places including the "L" train stations. We had a high floor overlooking the lake and it was a great view. It was close to the Navy pier so it would be good for families as well as business.

Reviews.Title: “Started out great and then just ok”
Reviews.Author: shekaphale
Reviews.Content: I had booked a regular room from Dec. 30 to Jan. 1 and a club room from Jan. 1 to Jan. 2. The part with the regular room was awesome. The check-in staff was very friendly, had a nice smile. I told her I recently gained gold status on spg, but it was not updated on the website yet, (because my tenth stay was just a day before). So she upgraded me to a great room with an awesome view and even gave me late checkout. Then I checked out of my regular room and went to check into my new club room. At this time, the check-in staff was not friendly at all. They made me wait at the line despite there being representatives available; they didn't even acknowledge me. Then one called me up. He did not smile, nor give me a friendly greeting. I thought the spg website may have updated my gold status by now, but it must not have. He did not give me an upgrade- and my 'club' room was actually worse than my upgraded regular room- it was smaller and less clean. The toiletries were only marginally better. I also did not get late checkout, I can't imagine there would be a lot of people checking in on Monday, Jan. 2, I don't know why he didn't want to give me late checkout. I know that late checkout is not guaranteed with gold status, but if they could give it to me on Jan. 1, they should have on Jan. 2 also. What's worse is that the club room is supposed to come with free breakfast in the club lounge. I asked them the night before what the timings were for the breakfast and they said 6:30 am to 10:30 am. So I went to the lounge at 10:10 am and all the food had already been cleared. There was nothing left but apple juice. I had been a loyal customer to this hotel (had stated there the last 2 new years eves); but after the experience on Jan. 1-2, I will have to think twice before I book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Not”
Reviews.Author: Carol_from_Dallas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights including New Years Eve. Service was hit or miss-valet guys were excellent as were folks at the bar. Look for Ms. Diane Chestnut, she is a doll, her service is impeccable and she is as friendly as can be, loved her. Security for New Years was great, they were vigilant in checking for room cards before giving access to people to the elevators. Were also kind and helpful in reuniting me with a lost item. Room, not spacious, could use updating. Clean. Amazing bed. INCREDIBLE view of the Chicago River. Complaints-charges for everything. And not reasonable charges, outrageous charges. I was shocked by the prices. $3.50 for a snickers bar from the store downstairs? $10 for a PB&J? $12.95 per day PER PERSON for internet access whether wired or wirless? No free parking anywhere? I wish they were a little gentler on their customers with the pricing, would be a great way to earn lifelong customers. Overall, I did enjoy the stay and would recommend, just try to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: myckee
Reviews.Content: The room we had was on the 23rd floor. The view was fantastic. The room was outdated a little. Most of the staff was nice and courteous. Pretty expensive. We stayed and celebrated New Year's Eve at this hotel. If you want wi-fi in your room, you have to pay. It's only free downstairs in the lobby area. A snickers from the fridge in your room costs $5. Even though you're a guest at the hotel, you have to pay for parking. If you want vallet parking, it's $48 bucks each time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Kamal79
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at this Hotel, located in the heart of Downtown Chicago on 12/30/2011 with my wife and our 4-year old daughter to meet some freinds coming from Florida. Big hotel, beatiful lobby and frindly staff. The room was as expected for a 4-star hotel. The weather was cold and we walked few miles in downtown with the kids. Our daughter got little sick at night and vomitted on the bed early in the morning, my wife removed the covers and wa found out the bottom sheets dirty. We mentioned it to the person who did our check out, and she was nice by offering us a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Little Nervous, Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little nervous about this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. Our family stayed there for three nights this past week and had a great experience. This hotel is within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, Grant Park and the Navy Pier; it sits on the river and offers great views of the city. The rooms were impressive with amazingly comfortable beds, and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful and facilities were well maintained. They have two game tables down in the lobby that was like a large I-Pad. My son and I played checkers and chess all night long along with many other families. Very family friendly lobby and hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: heyblueoc
Reviews.Content: Won an excellent bid on Priceline. It took 30 minutes to check in. There were about 15 families in line and 2 people working. We were given a small corner room with one king bed. When we arrived at our room, the temperature was about 85 degrees. We called the front desk and they said someone would be up shortly. After an hour, no one came. I called back and said someone needs to look at this. They said someone would be up shortly. Unfortunately, I had to meet some friends so I told the desk I would be out until late and they could send someone up. I returned to the room around 1 am and the temperature was still above 80.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ops79
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here 12/21/11 - 12/23/11 and we really enjoyed our stay! The front desk staff was very nice and accomodating. The hotel was very busy but it was clean and well kept. Our room was very clean and had a great view of the river and the city. The club lounge was awesome! The service we received from the evening attendant was amazing! I apologize for not remembering his name as he was there both nights; he has a great personality and knows the meaning of hospitality. He stated he was a long time employee there and he seemed to really love his job. We went to Shula's in the evening and met the nicest bartenders, Sean and Jeffrey. They were absolutely great and again, their customer service was excellent. Shula's and the hotel have great employees. I would definately stay here again and will recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: Very Clean and very beautiful. Location is very very good.

Reviews.Title: “Other Hotels that Are Much Nicer and with More Reasonable Staff”
Reviews.Author: FLJ021251
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend with my wife and teenage daughter at this hotel. I had purchased the room with points, plus paying part of the rate. When making the reservation I was told that I could be upgraded to the club level. However, when my wife arrived a few hours before me, the manager refused the upgrade. The first room we were give was next to the elevator, even though my profil specifically request a quiet room away from elevators and ice machines. We were moved to a different standard room down the hallway. I talked with the manager about my concerns, but they seem to fall on indifferent ears. The room was nothing special. In fact, the walls must be paper thin. A group of young girls were in the room next to us and we could hear them laughing and talking until late into the night. I had asked the mother to please them to keep the girls quiet, but since the adults were staying in a different room, the noise continued. The internet service was available only in the lobby, and if you have a teenager, you know how important this access is. The hotel promised a van would be available to take us to Macy's to shopping. The doorman said the van would be there in 15 minutes, but after 45 minutes waiting, we decided to wallk the 1.5 miles. This hotel is in a great location, and I have stayed here before and had an excellent stay. However, this time I found the stay far less than helpful. Perhaps the staff was tired from all of the holiday shoppers. But, on this trip their idea of customer service was far less than I am willing to tolerate. There are many hotels in this area, and most are at a lower rate, with far superior service. Next time I am in Chicago I will just stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “December 20, 2011 Stay”
Reviews.Author: caseeagle
Reviews.Content: We always get a relaxed and warm feeling walking into the inviting and beautiful lobby. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Enjoying the Club Level for evening snacks and morning coffee is an added treat. Except for the time spent clearing up billing discrepancies, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelkuo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel....the service is outstanding and the food is the best in the club level.

Reviews.Title: “In a few words... Very Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Petesyd2204
Reviews.Content: I have spent the last month traveling around Europe and Canada and was truly disappointed with this Sheraton property. On arrival we were treated to hundreds of people attempting to check in for a conference. I am traveling with my elderly mother and so far had no issue with getting twin rooms. Even though we requested a twin room they were unable to accommodate our request due to the conference. The front desk advised there was no option other than a fold out bed. After finally checking in we had to battle the elevator lobby to get to our floor. It took at least 5 minutes to get into an elevator. This has continued every time you want to leave the hotel or return you are bombarded with a wall of people that are Attending the conference. I have had to help my mother on numerous occasions to get in and out of the elevator safely due to other guests who push and shove to get in and out of the elevator. I would have to say the rooms are very tired and dated, not the standard of Sheraton nor upto the price paid. Having stayed in similar rated hotels in Canada and Europe, this hotel is underwhelming. Like other tripadvisor reviews we were treated to hairs throughout the bathroom...not clean at all. I would never recommend this hotel. To this end we decided to check out early and find another hotel that provided a better standard and could accommodate a twin room.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: eli0614
Reviews.Content: Paid extra to be in the "Club Level" which was supposed to be in the top three floors. We were placed in a room that was seven floors from the top, not the end of the world but still kind of disappointing. The "Club Lounge" was nothing special, snacks were basically a bowl of chips and some salsa with a cooler of Sprite and Coke. The pool and locker rooms were overrun with old towels and just very, very messy. Overall not a bad experience, quiet room and the staff was nice. View was nothing special as we were on the back side of the hotel so we couldn't see the river or the city. A few blocks to Michigan Ave which isn't too bad but there are plenty of hotels right on Mich Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: lmmatthews
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend with my kids to do some shopping and sightseeing. Booked my reservation via priceline and then called the hotel directly to inquire about requesting a room with two double beds as I know priceline can't guarantee a certain room type. Was promptly told by the operator that I was booked in a king room and there was nothing they could do since the hotel was sold out. Ok fine, I know sometimes that happens with priceline.... However, when I went to check in, I inquired again about the two double beds and the girl at the desk said there were several rooms with doubles available and even asked what floor I preferred. Made me feel like the first person I talked to didn't even bother to check. We had a room on the 17th floor. It wasn't a river view room, but the view was ok nonetheless. What I did notice immediately was that the room looked very outdated and a bit dingy. The window treatments and wallpaper were particularly in need of an update. The bed and bed linens were nice though. Very clean, and they were all white, including the comforter, so that's a plus. The beds were also quite comfortable. Once we got settled, we ordered brownie sundaes from room service. They arrived promptly, but the brownies were stale tasting and there was hardly any ice cream with them. For $40 for 3 sundaes, I would've expected something delicious. The hotel also does have a large fitness center and a pool, which we didn't utilize, but I'm sure my kids would have loved it if we had the time, and many downtown Chicago hotels don't have pools. Overall, our stay here was nice. The location was excellent and very convenient to Michigan ave shopping and navy pier. The hotel was listed by priceline as a 4 star, which puts it in the category with the Four Seasons and the Ritz.... I would give it more like 2.5 stars in comparison to those properties. The accomodations were adequate for the purpose of our trip, but if you're looking for something upscale, this isn't the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Commendation for employee Brian Scruggs”
Reviews.Author: Samuell194040
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home for a wonderful weekend at Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. We are Gold Starwood owners and always enjoy this hotel. However, this weekend's experience was superior in every way. Upon check-in there was a problem with our reservation but Brian Scruggs, who was assisting with the problem, proved to be an outstanding representative for the hotel. He calmly took care of the issue and quickly resolved the problem and we were most grateful as this was a very special family weekend in the city. He is professional, efficient and personable. Brian is a credit to the organization. We and our children and grandchildren were housed on the Club Floor and enjoyed our room and our stay immensely. All the staff, from housekeepers to servers were outsanding. We'll look forward to future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite views from our room”
Reviews.Author: torla42
Reviews.Content: Chicago offers a lot of stellar views . . . The view from the west side, straight up the river . . . Marina Towers . . . trump monstrosity . . . Wrigley, Tribune, NBC, just beautiful! Friendly staff on check in. A delightful tonight stay. NOW this is our favorite Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations... Exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: Kenn B
Reviews.Content: I had a very complex reservation to make that included various approvals, special considerations and personal needs to be met. After talking to a couple of contemporary hotels in the area, I had resolved to not getting to book the four rooms our company needed this weekend. Working with Sheraton was not only a pleasure, but almost a natural extension of our company. With the various special needs that needed to be met, it was a very difficult situation. Sheraton handled everything... and did it effortlessly (or at least it LOOKED that way to me, the customer). Given the specific hoops that needed to be jumped through, I was asking for nearly concierge service. I got it in Sheraton of Chicago. On that very rare occasion when you find five-star service at a three-star price... STICK with THEM! And if you stick with Sheraton... I'll likely see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service - Poor excuse for a business-grade hotel”
Reviews.Author: kriskar
Reviews.Content: Was there recently for one night for a conference. Tried to check-in at 5:30pm (the published check-in was 3pm), they said my room wasn't ready, where as others coming after me were assigned rooms. Was given a dummy door key card and asked to chill in the lounge on the 32nd floor and that they would call on may cell as soon as the room was ready. I chilled there until 8pm, no call, so went out for dinner. Came back at 9:30pm and asked if my room was ready. The gal said of course yes and give me a key. When asked why no one called me, she just shrugged. No, my troubles did not end there. I went to the room and opened the door only to find someone else in the room. Came back to the lobby, then they apologized and gave me another room. I said I was not going to walk-in on somebody else again, so they sent someone with me to open the new room. For all my "trouble" they reduced my bill by about 40%. It was definitely not worth the trouble they put me thru. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not great for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: zipzip1977
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with lots of facilities. The only major issue is that Internet access in the rooms is horrific even though it's wired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Location and Concierge Staff! Need to offer free wireless in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ivywriter
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers was great. I was there to attend the CASE V Conference and it's a great location, adjacent to all of the restaurants and shopping on the magnificent mile. The only drawback is that there is no free wireless in the rooms. You have to pay like $12 per day if you want it. There is wireless in the lobby and cafe areas but I suggest they add it to the rooms for as much as it costs to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had a great location. The concierge (Robert Ramos) was very helpful in picking out restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, great location, nice lobby, outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: BryonyFD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my mother-in-law to Chicago for the weekend (December 9th-11th) to celebrate her 60th Birthday. The pros: great location, just a block off of the Magnificent Mile, at the south end. Also close to Smith and Wollensky's restaurant where we had dinner to celebrate. The shuttle to Macy's was great.....Luis, the driver was very accomodating. He even provided his cell number when we needed to be picked up. Bedding is very nice and the lobby area is beautiful. Now for the cons: #1. Upon checking in our reservation was mishandled. We made a reservation for one room, 2 beds on the club level. When we checked in, the only room available was with a King bed or they could give us a double, then switch rooms the following night. No way!!! We took a room on the 30th floor (floors 33 and 34 are club level), but still had club access. #2. Rooms are outdated, tile in bathroom is dirty and cracked. #3. The club level was one of the poorest I have been in to. Renae that works there in the evening is great however! Club level access was oversold, leading to a long line for breakfast...a Hampton/Holiday Inn breakfast is better. Not enough tables, not cleaned enough, fingerprints and grime on the glass door. Towards the end of our "breakfast" a card was placed at our table for us to fill out with our names, room number and # of guests. The card said that 3rd and 4th guests are an additional charge. But we paid for 3 people to stay in our "club level" room. Also, alcoholic beverages were an additional charge...most other club lounges (Ritz Carlton) provide them complimentary. #4. When we returned to our room Saturday evening at 6PM to prepare for our dinner reservation, we found that housekeeping had not cleaned our room. We called and housekeeper came to clean our room, but it was very inconvenient. Hard to relax with someone running the vacum around you! #5. When my husband went to the front desk to explain our dismay, the manager accused my husband of lying to him. I will avoid boring you with all of the details, but they ended up giving us a credit of a whopping $75-but we were checking out the next morning and were forced to use it on overpriced, gift shop crap. Overall, I definately would not recommned this hotel. Service is horrible (except for Renae on the club level and Luis running the shuttle). I have stayed at a Sheraton once previous (Milwaukee) and it was great! However, I high doubt we will ever stay in one again! My husband and I will be contacting corporate about these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Exzellent”
Reviews.Author: Tessa-MF
Reviews.Content: Mein einwÃ¶chiger Aufenthalt im Sheraton erfÃ¼llte alle Erwartungen. Von meinem Eckzimmer hatte ich einen wunderbaren Blick auf den FluÃŸ und die umliegenden GebÃ¤ude. Im groÃŸen komfortablen Bett schlief man wie auf einer Wolke! Das Badezimmer ist normaler Hotelstandard. Sehr angenehm habe ich auch das Pub unten am FluÃŸ in Erinnerung, wo es herrliche Veggie-Burger mit sehr feinen Pommes gab! Die Bedienung war immer freundlich. Obwohl ich schon Ã¶fter in Chicago war, habe ich es noch nie so genossen, wie im Sheraton! WÃ¼rde jederzeit wieder sehr gerne in dieses Hotel kommen.

Reviews.Title: “What ever happened to pleasant customer service, at least a smile?”
Reviews.Author: FranchiseM
Reviews.Content: It was very disappointing experience. We had expected better being an SPG member. When we walked into the room, it smelled like smoky bar. We'll can't really fault the hotel but instead of offering us a room, they offered to ionize for about 40 minutes. Having a child with us, we insisted on a different room. There was some confusion with the bellman and the front desk, and when the bellman came he was very unpleasant. He ragged about it and was in a hurry, and barked out directions to us to follow. We took a "nice" tour of the back of house and frieght elevators. We did not feel like guests. We went to the Java bar and our server was not very happy also, does anyone smile at this hotel? We are really sorry to have bothered these people on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A great property at a great value”
Reviews.Author: Carla B
