Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during a relocation transition for a new job. My time at the Sheraton Chicago was a wonderful experience and made a naturally stressful process easier and smooth. The staff are friendly, accomodating and service-oriented from start to finish. I was often greeted by name when I placed a call or request for service. The facilty is well-appointed and full of modern conveniences such as easy access wi-fi, a coffee bar, fitness facilty and a well-stocked club level with food and beverages for breakfast and happy hour. The property is conveniently located near many of the other major hotels and Michigan Avenue shopping with unmistakable views of the river and lake. If you have the opportunity, choose to stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel & Towers. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stays With Great Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Jon Deaux
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers which has served as the host hotel for a meeting for several years. The hotel is located overlooking the Chicago River and Lake Michigan, and offers a classic view of the Michigan Avenue Bridge over the Chicago River and Wrigley Building. The hotel is within easy walking distance of shopping on Michigan Avenue and plenty of restaurants within walking distance or a short cab ride away. Although we have stayed at other nearby hotels within walking distance to our meeting in the past, we have opted to stay at the Sheraton the past several years because of the great service we have received. Even more meaningful is that we see so many of the same hotel staff members at the hotel who remember us from our previous visits and warmly greet us every year. The rooms we have stayed in have all been clean, spacious, with ample bathroom space, and more importantly, extremely comfortable beds. Chicago is one of our favorite cities to visit, and the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers is one of our favorite hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: medsalesguy
Reviews.Content: This is a good full service hotel near the convention center and in the heart of down town. It has plenty of meeting rooms for even the largest of business events. The property has three eating establishments, including a coffee shop, casual restraurant, and the steakhouse Shulas. Full gym,sauna, and pool are included.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but bed comfortable”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: I wound up staying here during one of those convention weeks in Chicago where hotels feel the love and jack the price up to stick it to everyone who needs a room. The Sheraton was actually cheaper than the Embassy Suites across the street. Check in was swift and lobby was spacious and looked modern. I was on the preferred guest floor. The room was extremely dated and reminded me of a motel type property. When I opened the room door and turned the small hallway light on, it still did not illumunate the room itself and I had to scrounge around in the dark looking for a lamp. The closet doors didn't open fully because they run into the bed. The minibar is well stocked but the potato chips were past their prime. The fixtures in the bathroom look they come from the 70's and the bathtub tile was not fully cleaned. Saving grace was the bed - it was very comfortable and room service was prompt and tasty with a Rueben sandwich. Considering I was in the $400 range for this room, the value absolutely was not there. In any other market, this room would have been worth $130 at best.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Chicago "Avoid this one"”
Reviews.Author: DRuben1330
Reviews.Content: Truly a tattered run down facility that you should avoid . Rooms are small, dirty, and in no way represents the web sites representations. Staff is poorly trained and a very big disappointment. At best it is a 3 star facility ands with so many options in Chicago, "please" avoid this one. I had no choice to stay here as a client booked the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Mjkeene
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights over thanksgiving holiday wweekend. The location is good, great service and friendly employees. We had a slow valet experience but were compensated by complementary breakfast. Overall it was a great vacation and we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Ben W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 months - great hotel, good club lounge on the top floor, convenient location for everything in the CBD, great staff Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Basic business hotel; nothing special”
Reviews.Author: familyinnh
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay on business. First room was big but backed up to the elevators so you could hear the "ding, ding" and elevator message as it arrived at the floor as well as the woosh when it passed. Second room was better. Clean,updated rooms; good bed. I'd rate it 3 1/2 if I could. The rate included internet, but I didn't get to try it. Breakfast was a pricy buffet that was good but slow -- the set up was not exactly self service buffet, so you had to ask for things like toast and eggs. I guess they are going for a bit more personal touch, but it seems to backfire. It's just a slow buffet. Might want to order off the menu. Just an okay business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mctom
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay within the year, both for conferences. The hotel is conveniently located to the Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile and many great restaurants. It sits on the river and offers great views of the city. The beds are amazingly comfortable, the rooms are clean, the staff was always freindly and helpful and facilities are well maintained. The gym is small, but had a nice variety of equipment and was frequently used by many guests during my stay. The conference facilities were very nice and seemed well organized. The front desk for check-in and check-out got quite crowded and they could have used another staff member or two to help. I was surprised to find that the Chicago Burger restaurant inside the hotel is considered seasonal and was closed. We did enjoy the Lizzie McNeill's pub next door (along the river) for quick bites and a more leisurely beer than sitting in the crowded hotel bar. High praise to the concierge staff...they always had great recommendations and even provided written walking directions to many nearby places.

Reviews.Title: “Why do we have to pay top dollar room rate and then pay for wifi on top?”
Reviews.Author: andyove
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days last week for a trade show. Standard Sheraton fare, big clean rooms, attentive staff, expensive bar. Ideal for access to downtown. But come on, on paying a $229 nightly rate there was a $12.95 daily additional charge for using the wifi, we are there on business, it should be included. Total $78 to use the wifi, at least Dick Turpin wore a mask to rob his victims.

Reviews.Title: “Very good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: Great setup for conventions. Location was convenience for other meetings, shopping, dining and sightseeing. For great dining, I would recommend go outside of the hotel - many are reachable by walking or short cabride. Rooms are clean and staff are professional.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rcholtz821
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Sheraton Hotel & Towers in Chicago every chance we get. They are always very accommodating to your needs. We stay at this hotel at least twice a years and every stay is as enjoyable as the last. It is in a great location of Chicago with easy walking distance to everything imaginable. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Jem M
Reviews.Content: Our response as we entered the lobby, 'Wow' this is a beautiful hotel, ! My husband and I spend 5 nights enjoying the wonderful view onto Lake Michigan and sitting in the Club Lounge, captivated by the Chicago buildings creating a fairyland of lights each evening . The location is very central to everything, easy walk to the business and main shopping areas. The beds were so comfy and cloud like. This all contributed to 2 Aussies falling in love with Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patti0
Reviews.Content: Just spend 3 days at a conference at the Sheridan Chicago Hotel. Rooms have been renovated and offer a lovely view of the Chicago River and Lake Michigan. Hotel is just a few blocks off Michigan Avenue, so it's an easy walk to all the great restaurants and shops that Chicago has to offer. You are within a short walk to Michael Jordan's new steak restautant on Michigan Avenue which was worth checking out. Front desk staff is very friendly and did accomodate an early arrival which is always welcome. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Cris C
Reviews.Content: This place is great. It's a hotel that is great for those in conferences with all the amenities nearby. The staff is the most friendly and they speak to everyone each morning. They are always willing to help and offer a smile. The front desk attendant Aiyetoro Pearson was especially helpful. I even asked for the manager to compliment her. The rooms were kept very nice and always stocked. The bar was lively and the conference staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Grand facility, well appointed, small room.”
Reviews.Author: Motor1
Reviews.Content: The entrance and lobby are impressive. The hotel is one of the major players for the convention scene in Chicago. It is in a great location; walking distance to the Navy Pier, Miracle Mile and it is located in the downtown area. A short cab ride to the convention center. There are plenty of services inside the hotel, and the staff is well trained toward customer service. The valet staff is all business, but they are good at looking out for the guests' interests, especially in their dealings with the cabbies. When traveling to Chicago, check here as a top option. While there are other outstanding hotels, Sheraton is a solid pick and reasonable priced by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Mixing Business with Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: 602Sami
Reviews.Content: I had only visited Chicago one other time and it was for an intensive Strategic Planning Session over 2 days and I never could even leave the hotel. This trip was to speak at a conference for Associate Degree Nursing Faculty from around the country-NOADN. Upon arriveal, I was greeted very warmly as we arrived in Chicago later than expected due to weather delays from Houston and in Chicago. The good news-we arrived safely but a little hungry. We were met very cheerfully at the desk and registered very quickly. We asked about something simple to eat outside the hotel within walking distance and were given the name of PJ Clarkes. it was faboulous and more than we could have expected so late. Friendly service, etc. I do not remember who registered us but she was very cheerful, friendly as well as informative about our choices and accomodations-this was about 10pm on November 3, 2011. Our room was nice, a few wrinkles with drawers staying open like the room was leaning some-but definitely comfortable, We slept well and I awoke early and found a local deli for a bagel and cream cheese. I enjoyed coffee in the room-very tasty. After a busy morning, We had lunch hosted by the conference and it was an amazing array of fresh fruit, soupd and lunch delicacies. The conference opened nicely and then were needed to find somewhere for dinner. Well, this was our first encounter with Demetrius. He was so pleasant and thoughtful. He suggested several options for dinner and then after making a decision assisted us with reservations and then to our surpise-as the food was delicious and priced within reason-had a dessert brought to our table-compliments of the Hotel from our wonderful Concierge-Demetrius. Over the next 2 days-Room 1812-was cleaned and tidied so nicely. The young woman-so sorry about not remembering her name-though I thanked her personally. She went beyond catering to our needs with an extra towel-she lined up my roommates shoes, just lots of attention to detail and checked on us a couple of times over our stay. We even noticed a difference when we had a different lady-though not bad, but the attention to detail. I actually witnessed our lovely assistant singing as she worked in another room. She really seemed to enjoy her work and what a wonderful sight. At the end of the conference on Sunday we were able to freshen up and take in the sights. We went to the Concierge for suggestions and once again-Demetrius was there to help us plan for the next two days as we were not leaving only Monday evening. His suggestions and scheduling for our experiences were well timed and perfect for level of adventure. You have a great staff in general but I would say even at checkout on Sunday night as we had to creat an expense account for our College and put the rooms on our travel card-everything was well done! I thank you for such a wonderful treat as I was a stranger to Chicago, but made to feel welcome and directed so nicely at every juncture. It seems customer service is important to you as an organization as it is to me as I grew up in retail and then have been a nurse for 28 years. Thank you so much for making the stay of native Texans so pleasant and welcoming. Our other guests were in 1251.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: LaRonda C
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of meeting a dynamic group of professionals dedicated to making my stay amazing. From the time Rachel McLin checked me in till my departure, my stay at the Sheraton was great. I have to acknolwedge Albert Jones and Robert Ramos at the concierge desk for exceeding my expectations of service. If you are hosting a business function or taking a break from the hustle and bustle, consider staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But they lost my package”
Reviews.Author: summitsvs
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. The staff is outstanding and the hotel is neat and clean. They did lose a package that was never found but verified delivered. I was out of luck on that one as the staff called and were at a loss on what to do. They have a nice fitness center that does not open early enough in the morning for early birds. Shulas, the restaurant downstairs is really good with great vibe. Pricey but does have a happy hour. Rooms were clean and updated. Usual amenities, no free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place when attending a convention onsite”
Reviews.Author: bkdAlbany_Ny
Reviews.Content: Really good room, Starbucks coffee with liquid creamer, very clean and great service. Didn't get charged for the bottled water I drank. Bed great and the furnishings were quite nice. Internet was pay except in lobby-very bad form for women traveling -boo! Had a really nice stay here. Area has great breakfast options-cafe at the hotel I heard was very expensive. "Yokes" was good and so was a market called Fox and Obel. Walk into the market and head all the way to the back-there is a food bar-great oatmeal etc. Short walk to the Navy Pier-very nice and comprehensive stain glass exhibit in doors. Right on the water which was lovely on a beautiful fall morning. Very clean area, with pleasant parks and pathway. Walked to the observatory from hotel-2.25 miles-mostly exhibits for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly lit rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lkm995
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights for a medical convention at McCormick Centre. Our room was large with very poor lighting, on top of the dark brown colour carpet, making the whole scene looking very tired and dated. Bathroom is average size, totally unattractive. The bed however is very comfortable. Restaurant LB is like a public cafeteria. Hotel location is good but not excellent, it is at least a 7-minutes walk to Michigan Avenue. The service is rock solid, concierge is knowledgeable and most helpful. This is typical of a Sheraton across the US, very standard, most reliable, grandish-looking lobby and public area. Unfortunately the rooms are cheap and shabby looking, lacks flair without a hint of luxury, reminiscent of those in the 1980s.

Reviews.Title: “Great service-oriented hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fun1wpb
Reviews.Content: One of the things that can be frustrating about attending a conference is that you don't get to choose the hotel. This time, though, the conference organizers were spot on when they chose the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. Not only is it set up perfectly for conferences but its personal service for guests is great, too! Check-in: I was fearful at first when I walked into the lobby and saw a long line of at least 20 people/small groups ahead of me. I glanced at my watch wondering how long it would take to actually see my room. Imagine my surprise when ten minutes later I was in the elevator with room key in hand. The hotel management was clever enough to have plenty of check-in staff on hand for the conference, and check-in was quick, efficient, and friendly. I didn't feel rushed at all, yet they handled everything professionally and quickly and got me on my way. Kudos for that! The room: I booked a club room (top 2 floors) that have some special amenities--including access to the club lounge (continental breakfast in the morning, access to bottled water/soda throughout the day; snacks in the evening). The room is at the very end of a hall--configured a bit weirdly--it's a king size bed (my request) and as a corner room, there are some weird angles. Perfectly functional however. Everything was clean, in its place. The AC/Heat controls work well--which is great because I've been able to switch between warm/cool based on how I feel. (It's so annoying to get into a room and realize that the AC or Heat doesn't work properly. Not a problem here, though!) The bed is comfortable. Plenty of towels in the bathroom. Staff: I haven't really needed anything as everything has been perfect. The staff I've passed in the hallway and seen in the elevators have been friendly and personable. I have little doubt that they'd be able to help me out with anything if I asked for help. To me, one of the signs of a great hotel is that I don't need to ask for anything--because everything works properly, the room is clean, and I have everything I need is provided. Fitness Center: Good selection of cardio equipment, free weights, and some machines. A bit cramped--had to move over a few times when working with free weights because there wasn't enough space for 2-3 people to work out in the area at the same time. However, totally usable gym. Internet access: Excellent. Started right up quickly with strong wi-fi signal. Cost is $12.95 for 24 hours (fee is waived on club level). What one thing would I change? The in-closet safe is too small for a laptop computer. Great size for putting away a wallet or credit cards or passport/important papers, but not large enough to hold my MacBook. Recently I stayed at a hotel (W in Midtown Atlanta) that had a safe in the closet that not only was large enough for my laptop and phone, but even had an electrical outlet inside the safe so that you could plug in chargers and charge up devices while out of the room. Now that was awesome--and a trend I hope other hotels soon follow!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business venue”
Reviews.Author: prnewman
Reviews.Content: The decorations, food and staff were excellent. I attended a business evening function and was very impressed with the amenities. (Go for the mashed potato/sweet potato bar!)

Reviews.Title: “It always feels like coming back home...”
Reviews.Author: mindywhiz
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers when we come to Chicago, which is usually twice a year. We stay there so often that my now 7 year old knows how to get from Union Station to Sheraton Towers on her own. :) I love the Sheraton Sleepers, the most comfortable bed that anyone could need. I do think there could be a slight upgrade to some of the tiling and such in a few of the bathrooms, but other than that, I have no complaints. I always arrive with everything I could need taken care of, and if for some reason it is not, there are arrangements made to make sure I am comfortable. The staff always welcomes us back, asks how school is going for my daughter, personal touches are always there. We will definitely be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not top tier”
Reviews.Author: DoubleJ1313
Reviews.Content: The service is solid and it is a large, grand hotel, but there is something lacking. The rooms are slightly drab and the lighting isn't great, but they are quite comfortable. No complaints, but it wouldn't be my top choice for hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia H
Reviews.Content: I was at your hotel from Oct 22 - Oct 26 attending the NFDA Convention. I travel frequently on business, but I have to say my experience at this hotel was the best I have ever received. The staff, from the minute I walked into the door until the moment I left, was extremely knowledgeable, efficient, friendly, courteous, went above and beyond what was anticipated, etc. I wish I had everyone's name that was so helpful, but unfortunately I do not--and it would be a large list!

Reviews.Title: “Check in”
Reviews.Author: Ho T
Reviews.Content: When we checked in this morning,11/04/11, the hotel could not find one of our two reservations. Somewhere, someone had messed up our reservations. Rachel Mclin, the front dest lady, who was very nice and patient, went out of her way to figure out what the problems were and finally found us a room with the same group rate. She said she would never let us walk out of the hotel without a room. Thank you, Rachel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jane m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend In Chicago for our Anniversary and stayed at The Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. What an AWESOME place to stay! The staff and hotel were exceptional. Our room was the most beautiful room I have ever stayed in. The food was superb. They make you feel like royalty there! Also the location was perfect. We were close to everything in downtown Chicago. It was our first stay in a Sheraton Hotel but it will definitely not be our last. This is THE place to stay in downtown Chicago. The worst part was having to check out and go home!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER Going back!”
Reviews.Author: maggiem27
Reviews.Content: Let me start first by saying that the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers used to be one of my favorite hotels to stay at while in Chicago. I have good memories from prior stays. All of that changed the minute I stepped into the hotel for this stay. I came in for a spine conference at Mc Cormick Place, and this hotel was one of the 'preferred providers' to choose from. My check-in took almost an hour! The girl at the desk asked me for payment for all 4 nights. I informed her that my company had made arrangements with the hotel ahead of time to use their credit card for everything, including incidentals (My office mgr is very anal about these things and she had even called earlier in the day and was told everything was fine). I explained to the girl that my company had made arrangements for me (and I should add that 1 night had been paid for up front as a deposit when making my reservation). Of course there was nothing notated on my reservation! I asked her to go and check for a fax or other communication. When she returned, I was told no, nothing found. A night manager then came over, and he informed me nothing could be done for me, and I would have to pay for my stay. I then pointed out that 1 night was already paid for, and that I would give them my Chas debit card for the 100.00 incidentals, and we would straighten everything out in the morning. There were several people waiting in line to check in and overheard everything. It was very humiliating to say the least. The next morning around 5:30a.m., I looked at my phone and saw a text message from my bank stating that my account was overdrawn! I logged onto my acct. and discovered that the Hotel had charged my card for the ENTIRE stay, and incidentals, so over 900.00 had been taken from me! I contacted my office manager as I was in panic mode, and she was livid. She confirmed she had spent alot of time making sure everything was set for my stay. She contacted the hotel and spoke with the front desk manager, and she couldn't understand or explain what had happened. After alot of prompting from my office, the hotel contacted my bank and asked them to remove the charges asap so I would have access to my money! For my troubles, I was awarded 10,000 spg points (big deal!). My room was dirty, and outdated. It is past time to renovate the rooms at this hotel! Very outdated bathrooms with old, dirty tile; hair in the bathtub, and the tub itself was chipped and stained. The room was dusty, the phone hadn't been cleaned in a very long time (eww!), the drawers were filthy and had several unidentified things in them; the curtains were missing hooks and hanging down; the air conditioner did not work properly and we sweated our first night. Also absolutely no place to plug in your computer or phone charger! A big pet peeve of mine! We asked for a mini fridge to put our water in and were charged 25.00 for that luxury. The internet is 12.95 a day, and is very very slow. Don't waste your money on room service. The food is terrible, and each time it came up ice cold, or items were missing that were ordered and charged for. Almost 80.00 for breakfast for 2 people?! Seriously?!! The 2nd morning I woke up to find that ONCE AGAIN, my card had been charged for the entire stay, and my account was again overdrawn! I called my office and they noted that the charge on their American Express card had been reversed! Here we go again!!! I call the front desk manager, and she tells me it is my bank's fault and there is nothing she can do! It was all I could do to not go downstairs in person and have an epic meltdown at that desk! My office called and also got nowhere quick. We ended up contacting Sheraton's corporate office to get someone to help us. I am so disappointed, pissed off, fed up, and worn out over this! I will NEVER give this hotel a penny of my business again! I am also planning on letting the head of the conference know my experiences, as well as everyone I know! Save yourself the grief and go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Happy G
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Not only are the rooms clean and the beds are comfortable. This hotel also offers a club lounge. For a mere amount of $$ they offer you access to their club lounge which is 3 levels of even more comfort. You also get continental breakfast and appetizers (they are delicious). This also saved us time and money from having to go out for breakfast. The setting is also comfortable. They provide televisions and comfortable sofas and chairs. The best part of our stay were the amazing people known as concierge. Wow do they know their stuff. They were amazing and helpful. Paula, Albert and Marisa thank you all for a great time. Paula went above and beyond her job and always made sure we had coupons with us. When she wasn't there she made sure Albert took care of us and boy did he. I am pleasantly surprised to see there are people who still have passion for their job and care about others. Thank you again for making our stay wonderful! We are going to try and come again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago Experience”
Reviews.Author: hospitableme
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Chicago, and I had made some requests prior to arrival (early check-in, high flr, view). All of these requests were easily accomodated. We were greeted by a trainee who obviously had already looked at our requests and voiced them to us ( I believe her name was Cynthia). We loved the river view that we had. The restaurant staff was amazing! We came ten min before lunch ended and they still treated us so nice. The next morning during breakfast, we were welcomed back. It was very impressive that they remembered us. Keep in mind, we were there while they had a large convention or something going on. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel, but those few interactions were wonderful. It is also in a good location if you like walking to the Mag mile and Mil Park. We did have to cab it to the nearest train station, but it was not much.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Facility!”
Reviews.Author: LEWIS S
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly, courteous and great over all. Accommodations are beautiful, comfortable and the view of the river was outstanding. Have stayed here both on business and with my wife and always enjoy the same wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the chicago marathon. Very beautiful and friendly staff. Willl definitely return .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel in the heart of Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night recently on business. The hotel is very nice and modern and the rooms have wonderful views of the city or Lake Michigan. The staff was very friendly and helpful and located a missing package for me very quickly. The hotel is in a great location, a short 20 minute to anywhere in the Loop and about 10 minutes to the Magnificient Mile. The Club Lounge, if you have access, is fantastic as well. It is 2 floors so there's plenty of room and was a great place for an evening drink/snack as well as breakfast in the morning. Would absolutely stay here again the next time Chicago calls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at check-in”
Reviews.Author: Gregglburt
Reviews.Content: While we were not crazy about the hotel in general last week (kind of old and tired), I have to say that one young lady at the Starwood check-in was outstanding. Aiyetoro Pearson went out of her way to make sure we got the best room possible, and when there weren't any good ones available when we checked in, she organized an upgrade and move the next morning. They took care of everything and we ended up in a really nice room. I know it's her job, but her attitude and determination were fantastic, in a world where us frequent travelors typically face grumpy old nags. Thanks Aiyetoro.

Reviews.Title: “Just superb”
Reviews.Author: Tony P
Reviews.Content: Two nights on the 32nd floor of the Sheraton towers -- I wish all hotels were like this! Everything was there, all good quality, incredibly comfortable bed. The breakfast in the club lounge was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Super-Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel14
Reviews.Content: From the doormen to the front desk to the club lounge and finally housekeeping, everyone we encountered at our recent stay went out of their way to be friendly and welcoming. We stay at this location often, not because it's particularly plush (it's a Sheraton, not a Ritz) but because we feel so welcomed and at ease. No small accomplishment for a hotel so huge and busy. We also stay because this property is very well-positioned. It's within walking distance of most of downtown Chicago's tourist spots - - two blocks east of Michigan Ave, two blocks west of Navy Pier. Rooms on the river side offer amazing views. The fitness center looks out onto the river as well. The club lounge is huge, with panoramic views of the city and offers happy hour and breakfast service. We rarely bother with a hotel restaurant anywhere, so any negative reviews of Shula's don't mean much. It's Chicago - - there are many excellent restaurants within blocks of the hotel. As Starwood Platinum members, we stay at many Sheratons, Westins, and Ws in the US and abroad. In our experience, the staff at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers is one of the best at making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay.”
Reviews.Author: like2travel033
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the price I got by booking through AAA. It was $150 less than other hotels surrounding it. That said, you get what you pay for. There is not much to do at the hotel and I would not recommend this hotel if you are planning to spend a lot of time in your room. The room was relatively clean, but the furnishings need some updating. The tiles in the bathroom floor were cracked, the shower curtain was stained yellow and the towel rack was halfway broken. Also, we were told we would have a mini-bar fridge in our room. There wasn't one there. We were told we could request a complimentary fridge. We did and was told it would be $25. Once that was straightened out, that it was supposed to be complimentary, we waited over an hour for the fridge to show up. Meanwhile, we had food sitting out that needed to be refrigerated. To me, that was unacceptable. There is no excuse why it should have taken that long. The next day, we requested a microwave and we were told they did not have microwaves for use. I was shocked! I think it is idiotic to have a fridge but no microwave to heat the food up in! We did not see where there was wireless internet in the rooms. The internet we did notice was wired and there was a cost. Um, hello, welcome to the millenium! All in all, the location of the hotel is good and the price through AAA was good. I would not pay more than $200/night for this hotel. Next time, we will probably try the Embassy Suites that was across the street.

Reviews.Title: “mostly fine”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller038
Reviews.Content: The hotel was mostly good. The room is quite spacious and clean. I had a room on a high floor facing the river, so I really enjoyed the view. The stay would have been perfect, except for the house-keeping -- she kept using her key to come into my room even though I had the privacy sign (or "peace and quiet" sign as they call it) out on the door knob. I was still sleeping, and she woke me up 3 times by coming in. I told her to go away, but then only 20 minutes later, she called me and woke me up again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: sjdetrick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location downtown. It's within walking distance to everything. Not much to offer at the hotel itself besides an extremely expensive steakhouse and a bar that lacked luster. The bar was extremely busy and there was only one cocktail waitress who was unfriendly and never once asked if we needed anything. Rooms were clean, but slightly small. Beds were comfortable. Overall, it wasn't a great value for the price. However, they aren't too many "values" when looking for a place to stay in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and overall while it wasn't the worst experience, it wasn't the best either. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is good with wonderful views and our room had a great view of the river. But the rooms was small and ordinary. They put us in some sort of suite the first night and the bed was essentially a pull down sofa bed so we had to switch rooms the second night. With a convention there, the hotel was booked and limited on space and rooms. We paid a premium rate for our room and I wasn't at all impressed. The onsight resturant was horrible - over priced and the food wasn't very good. There are great resturants within walking distance and I'd suggest eating out. Housekeeping was horrible. I think the hotel has the potential to improve. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again and my husband thought less of it than I did and isn't interested in staying at any other Sheraton any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ric H
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Sheraton. The front desk rep (Brian) accommodated my room type request and even found one with the most amazing view of the river and of the skyline, all because the person in front of me took so long to check in. Everyone from housekeeping to engineering to security went out of their way to acknowledge you and say hello or ask if you were enjoying your stay or needed any assistance. You hardly ever see that anywhere these days and a lot of hotel operators don't seem to understand how far that goes and the impression it makes on a guest. This was the last stop for me on a trip through the Midwest and most of the other hotels I stayed at it was hard to even get most of the staff to acknowledge your existence. Spot On Sheraton Chicago. It really made me fell very welcomed when walking around the hotel. I will definitely make this my go-to hotel when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: eager_NYtraveler
Reviews.Content: Attended large professional meeting here. Meeting facilities were fine. Hotel and room clean. Service was professional and friendly. Dining options in-hotel were very limited: basically Shula Steakhouse or room service. (Chicago Burger "in hotel" was shut down.) A bit of a walk to best shopping and restaurant rows; other hotels have more convenient locations. Slow Internet. Would not choose for a personal stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: monamieandme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a-okay.. We spent 3 nights here and to what i can recall, the room is average-sized (similar to the rooms at double-tree). What i like about its location is that it's walking distance to one of the attractions in our checklist ( Chicago's First Lady-- River Cruise), but it's a few blocks away from magnificent mile..1 mile approx, bummer. I guess my only complain is that they charge so much on valet service. Alternative: less expensive parking at the service apartment next door.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly understaffed, unhappy staff...”
Reviews.Author: DNA-Scientist
Reviews.Content: I paid over $2,000 for two rooms, 3 nights each to stay here with my family and my sister. Whereas the lobby, location and rooms are great, the hotel is terribly understaffed for the very large amount of guests they have. Staff is mostly a bunch of untrained, rude people. Examples: first, I asked for connecting rooms at check in and "sir, I am unable to find one". Ok, I understand, they may be at full capacity. Second: paid the $49/day for valet parking...called for my car, waited 25 minutes; got my car only after asking several times for it. I had tickets for 5 for the Mary Poppins musical and almost did not make it. When I got back at 11:30pm, there were NO VALET, but a sign that said to go to the front desk...ok, I went and the attendant on duty said with all the best attitude from south Chicago: sir, I need the keys.. they are in the car, I said... to which she responds..sir, I need the keys.. Well, so much for valet parking. On Friday night we wanted to ask about tickets for the musical and the Concierge was no were to be seen. We waited for about 10 min and someone from the hotel walked by and told us he was on a bathroom break. I understand having diarrhea, but only one concierge in a hotel with hundreds of rooms? Worst of all: how many attendants in the front desk for this huge hotel? two. So, lines are long, service is bad, all the employees are in a bad mood. I would say I can swallow this for one night but not for longer than that. Won't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Host”
Reviews.Author: GreattriptoChicago
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a three day business trip and was very impressed with the facilities and staff. Welcoming, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “clo102253”
Reviews.Author: sc0416
Reviews.Content: We spent a recent Saturday night and enjoyed it tremendously. Hotel is in a great location and the staff is top notch. Rooms are very nice and have a great view of the city. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in all the details”
Reviews.Author: Carol C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely busy during our stay but that did not diminish the excellent service we received. Everyone at the front desk was so friendly! We had to leave our bags since we arrived very early and the room was not ready and they were so patient as we got out everything we would need for the day. The room was lovely - the bed amazing! This is a small thing but means a lot to me - having the shower scrunchy. The location is wonderful, an easy walk to Michigan Avenue. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Maria Diaz”
Reviews.Author: Sunset T
Reviews.Content: Maria Diaz is one of the most helpful and polite hotel desk employees I am ever encountered. Not only did she take a bad situation (my company's fault) and make it right, but she continually looked for positive solutions to encountered problems. Maria never stopped smiling and maintained a sympathetic attitude during the whole ordeal. Top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KCFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this hotel. The staff was very helpful, the room was clean, well decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel's location, directly on the river, allows great views and a beautiful location for events. I would recommend anyone to stay here for a great Chicago experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay, just some thoughts of caution.”
Reviews.Author: daddysizzle
Reviews.Content: Just finished my stay at the Sheraton. It is very nice place. Their staff were wonderful, rooms are beautiful, everything is just as you would expect it to be. My only caution is for you the business traveler, if the payment is sent ahead of time, confirm it's arrival at time of check in. That will save some headaches. Also, their business service center has recently be contracted out to FEDEX. I can understand this move, FEDEX has business and copy centers all over the country. But I sent a package to the hotel ahead of me so it would be available when I arrived and so I did not have to carry it on the plane. I sent it by FEDEX. In picking up the package at the hotel, the FEDEX people told me there was an additional $10 hotel handling fee. The hotel never touched the package. This is a big dis-satisifier to customers. It never costs to receive a package from FEDEX after you have paid to have it shipped. The hotel needs to revisit the practices of their new contraced service provider.

Reviews.Title: “Management turned around what could have been bad stay!”
Reviews.Author: haydn220
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I along with my teenage daughter arrived after half day of travel and was greeted by a less than friendly receptionist (Lynette, or similar name) who was taking care of SPG preferred guests no less! My name was on the reservation and I'm a regular member. In addition, my girlfriend is a platinum member, and although she didn't have her card with her, she did present her ID. No matter, Lynette wanted to make a point of not upgrading us to club level. She tried to appease us by putting us on a higher "club floor," but she purposely gave us a view of the parking lot, no health club access, no club lounge access and no internet. When I went back to the desk to hopefully change rooms, she tried to interrupt while I was talking with someone else. THANKFULLY, management trainee Nelson Massini saved the day! He apologized for the inconvenience and gave us a wonderful room with a view and amenities. He was extremely professional, courteous and knowledgeable; just what customers appreciate at a higher-end hotel. Had Nelson not stepped in, my girlfriend and I would probably not be staying at any Sheraton in the near future; that is how offensive the other woman's behavior was to us. Once again, thank you to Nelson for making sure we had excellent accommodations for a fantastic girls' wkend in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gneehp
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great and they upgraded me to a corner room suite which had a wonderful view which looked out over the river and the lake. The suite had a king sized bed with an extended living area with a couch, chairs, and coffee table plus it opened to another room with a dining room table, a sitting area and another bathroom. It was in walking distance to the Navy Pier, shopping and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “woul do it again!”
Reviews.Author: Carolstapenhorst
Reviews.Content: Good location (close To baby pÃ­er and Michigan Ave), excelent staff. Got a Great price because of a medical meeting (US$ 300). Wonderfull view from the Room. An excellent bed, like other Sheratons.

Reviews.Title: “Valued guest”
Reviews.Author: yoej
Reviews.Content: Every employee I encountered was very professional and made me feel like my stay there was very important.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: buffy333Florida
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was great, rooms comfortable and very beautiful. Nice view of river. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Only complaint was food and beverage prices! Extremely expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: sporter84
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff. The bed was comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: abby2992
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and have stayed at a lot of Sheratons over the years. The room quality at the Sheraton Chicago is pretty average for Sheraton, at least in the finishes. I managed to get a corner room for my 3 night stay, which was great. In addition to the usual bed and desk set up, there was an extended living area with a couch, chairs, and coffee table. It was a much more enjoyable place to work than the standard cramped writing desk. The view and location is definitely top notch. My room looked out over the river to the lake, which is a wonderful thing to wake up to. The location is convenient to Grant Park and other nice-to-see places, as well as great restaurants and all of the places I need to be for work. The only downside was the in-hotel dining options. The bar didn't serve food and the only open restaurant was the very expensive steak house. This wasn't much of a problem since so many good places were nearby, but would have been convenient after a long day of meetings and events. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'll consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nealdd
Reviews.Content: Great Location to see the city. Beds are great. You have to go downstairs to use the free internet- the connection is slow. The concierge was great - they give out coupons for free desert for some restaurants. The Hotel is busy with conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MajorNYC
Reviews.Content: Convention hotel, smallish rooms, dated and somewhat worn decor. Who ever thought brown was an attractive color for guest rooms? Looks dirty. Staff forgot to replete coffee supplies. High point was comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed by the warmth”
Reviews.Author: VivekNangia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. The stay was very comfortable, no doubt. More than anything else, I was overwhelmed by the warmth and courteousness extended by each and every staff member. Even though their LB Bistro & PÃ¢tisserie would open at 06.30 am in the morning for the breakfast yet the staff would ensure that I am served breakfast at the adjacent coffee shop earlier than that whenever I needed. Mechelle Rollins especially, was very helpful, in ensuring that communications from my family reach me in time (as I was travelling alone and my mobile was giving me some trouble). The staff at the concierge was always very forthcoming with the information that I needed and their small self designed and innovative "chits" with all the relevant information were really handy. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Bulldog82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for a conference. It is downtown Chicago, so nothing is cheap. The property is in good shape and the staff helpful. You are close to the lake and right on the Chicago River. There are plenty of things to do and eat close by. There are a lot hotel properies in the area. Unless you are hooked into Starwood Rewards, I think it is worth checking around for pricing at other hotel properties.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service!”
Reviews.Author: christados
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend his 42nd birthday in Chicago - he loves architecture and I love food so the location was perfect. A friend of mine who lives in Chicago recommended the Sheraton. Prior to checking in we contacted the concierge to ask for recommendations and we got Paula who absolutely thought of everything... from an Architectural Cruise to the perfect dinner for my husband's birthday insuring a window table so we can watch the Navy Pier Fire Works. Connie in the Concierge's lounge was amazing always willing to go the extra step and I was most impressed with the Front Desk I contacted them for extra towels, they arrived about 4 minutes later and if that was not impressive enough my message light on the phone was on a minute after that to insure the items requested were received! I have to be honest I booked the hotel for its location and great pricing so the luxury aspect and the emphasis on service was a nice welcomed surprised. Another nice touch I have to mention is that we decided to go to a baseball game - of course Magnificent Paula got arranged for the tickets and again another nice surprise on game day she had directions ready for us as and provided us with an umbrella for the day since there was rain in the forecast. NOW THIS IS WHAT I CALL ANTICIPATING MY NEEDS. The Rooms are very very nice and pristinely maintained but is the people and the service they provide I will go back for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1auband
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights during September, 2011. Although there was a big food festival going on in Chicago that weekend and the hotel was very busy, I thought they did a great job. The room was clean, the bed was really comfortable, and there was a beautiful view overlooking the river and the downtown area. The room rate was competitive and overall, I was very pleased with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing customer service”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel. The hotel was packed - long line - and there was only 1 inexperienced agent at check-in (another one was working only part of the time). Agent was very rude, and I had to escalate to a manager who was more helpful. My room was average, but it had a great view of the river. The breakfast in the club lounge is very good, but expensive ($20, I think, it also includes appetizers at night, but I didn't stay for that). The nightly rate was high for being outside of the financial district. Staff seemed incompetent - couldn't perform simple tasks (I asked for an email with my bill and that was not sent). The rate would really have to be good for me to try this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed I've ever slept in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andidroid
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night Sept 9th during overnight stay in Chicago.Hotel well apppointed for all the touristy things and shopping. Staff were very pleasant and helpful.Despite reading some reviews on here the bedrooms were big, clean and comfortable, and the best Ive ever slept in! Although we never had a lake view room, for an overnight stay it was spot-on, and good selection of HD tvchannels.On return later in the month stayed at the Hyatt Regency, but wish I hadn't! Would definately return and would recommend without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SumieJ
Reviews.Content: We visited for a "Girl's weekend" from Thursday to Sunday and had a wonderful room with an amazing view! (The bathroom was a little dated with no fan.) We enjoyed the club level amenities with friendly, helpful staff and the meals were very tasty. The entire staff was great in that everyone made sure our questions were answered. I would highly recommend this hotel due to the location, price, and service.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: laagent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The lobby is nice however the rooms are just average. There is nothing special about the rooms....there was a dingy smell in my room. The bathroom had good lighting but it was old and could definitely stand to be remodeled. The restaurant that i ate breakfast at inside the hotel was very expensive. This restaurant also appeared to be understaffed. There are not a lot of options for eating inside of the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to others. A better choice may be the Embassy Suites which is very close in distance.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed hotel with excellent services”
Reviews.Author: RWAB
Reviews.Content: Went for one night while visiting Chicago and reception gave us a wonderful room on the upper floors. While rooms are definitely on the smaller side for the price, the king bed was large and very comfortable, a sofa with a view and a really good, strong hot shower. The location is excellent: just outside is the river walk, you can wander out the other doors towards the restaurants on the lower stairs from the lobby and you are suddenly in an architectural wonderland. Lots of food options if you want to eat in, though we found the breakfast expensive and decided to go out instead (it was a nice day so better for this). I expect if you are there for a conference it's convenient, lots of taxis and staff are friendly. Check-out was nearly instant thanks to their TV-checkout system so we didn't have to queue in the morning for this.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to be ON the river with a great view from your room”
Reviews.Author: PatienceWonderful
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just east of Michigan Avenue and ON the river which I consider a great location. I'm assuming most of the rooms and public areas have a river view which can be spectacular at night with the city lights. The hotel is of course clean, upscale with rather large public areas including a bar and adjacent Shula's steak house. The rooms are very nice and probably average size and are showing minor evidence of wear and tear. I had a very short stay here for business and would stay here again if I could get a good rate. Didn't eat here, exercise here etc so can't comment on that. Just LOVE the location and the views! If I came with kids I'd stay at nearby Embassy Suites and save this hotel for business or couples travel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Monster Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gate95
Reviews.Content: Went for a meeting. Very large hotel. There were 30 people in line to check in, with 3 people at the desk. The checkin time is officially 3, but they couldn't get me into a room until 4. Location is fine- I prefer the Westin further up the Magnificent Mile. The room was undated, but signs that its an old hotel: worn out faucets, lots of caulk, 30 year old keycards on the doors. (funny how hotels will never replace 30 year old hallway doors, no matter the extent of other upgrades). The place was reasonably clean and maintained though. The usual nickel and dime here: 12$ internet, 20$ to use the gym, $50 parking if you need it, etc. I somehow don't mind paying the luxury hotels for this, but resent paying Sheraton because I don't think that it offers anything more than a mid-range hotel such as a Hyatt Place (and there you get free breakfast, free internet, etc.) I'm not sure what it is, but despite the ongoing attempts to update the Sheraton's image, I can't find anything to like or connect with. The value proposition is pretty mediocre. I'll be back if these is a meeting or something here, but wouldn't go out of my way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Option”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a massive hotel, I believe the 3rd biggest in Chicago from what the Architecture river tour told us. So if your looking for any charm or personalized service this isn't the place. There's a queuing line at check-in but we're Starwood Preferred Guest(SPG) so we got to bypass it. Another queue greets you at the conciergeâ€¦â€¦we never needed them so that wasn't an issue. The staff is plenty friendly but your just another of the 1000 or so people staying there this week. It's also a convention hub so the lobby and elevators can become quite crowded at a moments notice. On several occasions we waited well over 5 minutes for an elevator. The Location is central to many things you want to see in downtown, however it's quite a walk from any train stop. So going to/from airport on train or a Cub game or anywhere outside the city isn't as convenient. A never ending line of cabs is available 24/7 though and can take you anywhere, just at a higher price than public transport. The hotel bar was nice and you never drink alone with so many people there for the conventions. A Shula's Steakhouse is located in the lobby but with all the good food choices in Chicago we were never tempted to go there. We stayed on the 30th floor which is for SPG members only. Views were beautiful looking down the river and at the new Trump Tower. The rooms were very basic and clean with no frills. Bathroom was dated and had no flare. Carpets were clean. Beds and pillows were to my liking, but they have a weird plastic like middle sheet that was somewhat uncomfortable. Rooms have nice, big HD TV's with plenty of channels, coffee pots with Starbucks coffee, and complimentary newspapers and water. The room was equipped with the smallest safe I've ever seen in a hotel room, not even large enough for a laptop. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton and would stay again. I just nit pick in reviews to give an overall sense of what your going to get.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in the center of everything, good perks for members”
Reviews.Author: Keith N
Reviews.Content: Guys, I've always gone here on business and have been very happy with the staff, the rooms, and the Sheraton club upgrades (they're almost always able to give me a free room upgrade and they make the lounge available as well). My one problem in the past has been that the folks that work at the Club Lounge are sometimes a bit pushy with trying to get you to buy drinks along with the free breakfast and snacks they have during the evening. A few years back, the breakfast there was top notch (bagels, muffins, smoked salmon, fresh fruit etc,); when I was there a year ago, it seemed to have declined a bit (bagels with cream cheese and cold cereal). Not sure what the status is now,

Reviews.Title: “My first stay... with many more to come!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonJM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many properties in the Chicago. Therefore I was debating whether or not I should go with somewhere new. i did due to a small special the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers had. My experience started off great from the time of check-in. A lady by the name of Erika Mallett went over and above the level of customer service I was expecting. I highly believe in great customer service whenever/wherever I spend my money. At the time of check out (3-night stay), I had to ask one of the bellman for Erika's full name. I wanted to make sure I expressed my satisfaction at this property with someone! She was amazing and I look forward to returning to the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers

Reviews.Title: “Great public spaces - quirky rooms and misadventures!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRoamer
Reviews.Content: In town for a business event. The public spaces are great - well laid out, well decorated, well set up. Restaurants (Shula's, Chi-bar) had good food and very good service; ditto the banqueting services. Simultaneous large (200+ people) meetings seemed to run smoothly. An oddity was the absence of a lobby kiosk for printing boarding passes - one had to go downstairs to a cyber cafe, log into a computer as a guest (an option not apparent unless you were told in advance) and go from there. So why not 4 stars for this aging Sheraton? The room experience was a different story, almost like something out of a bad comedy film. I was on the 34th (top) floor with a killer view but getting and being there was fraught with challenges. Checking in at 7:00 p.m. on a weekday, there were 6 people in line and only a single staffer at Reception. Eventually, two other people appeared wearing "Trainee" badges but they had to double-team their work and their inexperience showed - is it unusual for a Chicago hotel to get people checking in at 7 o'clock in the evening? Got upstairs and the room key would not work initially; that cleared but it still wouldn't open the lounge door. The front desk couldn't get the lounge attendant to answer the phone and open the door from inside, so they sent up a bellman with new keys that worked. Once in the room, the closet door required being held open (weighted and angled so it closed immediately unless held open) and the closet was unlit - other colleagues confirmed this was not unique to my room. Ever try to get dressed/undressed while holding the door open with one elbow or your head or your butt? Annoying! The desk drawer stayed open about 2 inches, because the desk was tilted forward and the drawer would not stay shut. Funny to see but not so funny when it came to using the desk. No electrical outlets visible anywhere in the room except the one on the desk that didn't work, and the one down behind the nightstand (accessible after moving the furniture) was full. Ordered room service which arrived promptly, but the rolling table was tilted in two directions - the soup had trouble staying in the bowl (but it was tasty!) and there was no way to fix the wobble when pressing down to cut with the knife vs. lifting the fork from the plate. The bathroom was designed back when no one in America was taller than 5'10" (I am 6'4"), so the shower came to my chest and the top of the mirror to my eyebrows. Using the hair dryer meant going out into the other room. Like I said, this could all have seemed like a bad comic film but I was there for long business days and just wanted a room that "worked" to sleep, bathe, and dress - maybe management should try spending a night in their hotel in order to notice these "little" things? I've had better experiences in other Chicago hotels that are similarly well located near Michigan Ave. and the River, so will probably not be back to the Sheraton Towers soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good staff: Helpful, friendly, always trying to contribute to a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Triaero
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel and Towers is rather typical of a large downtown hotel. Very nice, clean facility but not really anything special. There is an excellent west facing view of the River and Trump Tower. Restaurant and bar prices are high, as is often the case in these places. In this regard, the Sheraton is no different from the Marriotts, Hiltons, etc. This place does stand out because of a very nice and helpful staff. The front desk, the bell men, the concierge, the housekeeping staff are all eager to help you if they can be of service. It looks to me like the management here has done a good job of recruiting the right people and keeping the focus on the customer. One more tip: I often take a cab from O'Hare but the fare has now gotte up to over $60. I took a shuttle from ORD and too ORD on this trip. It was easy, we only stopped at one other hotel and the fare was only $29. The train will get you into the city, avoiding all the stalled freeway traffic, for only $5 but you still have to get from a station to the hotel . . . kind of a hassel. The shuttle was clean easy and a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, just not great”
Reviews.Author: kozamel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference, so I didn't really have a choice in which hotel. I stayed on the 14th floor and had an average view. The room was dated and small (two queens). Bathroom wasn't the cleanest and the sink had a slow drain (I hate when no one checks that stuff in a hotel...). It was nice to sit on the "boardwalk" and watch the people on the river and the location wasn't bad. I spent the weekend in Chicago - but at a different hotel (that cost more than the conf rate) and I was glad I'd booked the other place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: 3boysmomMinnesota
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Sheraton. The location is excellent - right on the river, walking distance to Michigan avenue (Marilyn Monroe statute, shopping, millenium park, Hancock building, etc). We were on a multi-family trip. We have three children ages 7-13. The room was plenty big enough for us - we travel with a small blow up mattress for the third child and there was plenty of room for the mattress and still enough space to get around the room. Check in was a little slow and they messed up the rate on our bill - but when I brought it to their attention, they quickly fixed it for me. If you have varying rates for multiple nights, I would check your bill carefully. We had appetizers and wine at Shulas - very good. If we had just been traveling with adults, I would have liked to try dinner there, but $40 steaks for young kids wasn't happening. My kids were disappointed with the size of the pool and the lack of a hot tub. One other note, and I'm not sure if this is somewhere on their website, but if you try to use the workout facilities, there is a $12 per day charge. I thought this was ridiculous - we just ran outside instead.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jllxD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights earlier this month. The rooms are decently sized and clean, albeit the accomodations are a bit outdated. The safe to keep valuables is operated by a physical key, so you must be careful not to lose it. The entryway light was a bit annoying because it kept blinking before it finally burned out the next day. If I had to give one complaint, it would be that housekeeping did not service our room after we left for the day late morning, even though the service staff was still on our floor when we were leaving. It wasn't a big deal since our stay was so short, but still. The location of the hotel was fantastic though - convenient to Navy Pier and extremely walkable to all that downtown Chicago has to offer. I would stay here again for the value compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ryanboys
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and room was quiet and cool. I was pleasantly surprised by the location and amenities at this hotel. I will plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but expensive Hotel in Chicago, billing issue after checkout”
Reviews.Author: bmorechris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of friends for a bachelor party. We had a number of rooms reserved for us to stay, but they only had one room with double beds, then we had 2 other rooms with rollaway beds. In addition, before I arrived another person from our group had reserved one of the rooms, but it appeared they gave us a fourth room that we were not supposed to have (This was in part our fault, but the checkin desk employee was not very clear on what was happening). The next morning we were able to sort out the room situation, and all seemed to be well. As it happened, I paid for one room the first night and was told that reservation was closed out, and my card would not be charged further. About a week later, I saw the correct charge for the one night on my card, but then the next day I received another charge. I contacted the hotel thinking it was just a mistake, but I was told no, that was a legitimate charge. I had a receipt showing the room was paid and that it was only a one night reservation. It took over 2 hours and 3 calls to get the issue sorted out, and it was only when I pointed out to the accounting manager that it was an unauthorized charge and that they did not have a signature from me authorizing the charge that they changed their tune. As for the hotel, it is very large but quite nice. It is located just north of the Loop close to Lake Michigan. It was the weekend of Lollapalooza and the hotel was totally sold out, which contributed to the issue with getting the proper room type (this was fixed on the second night). I understand Chicago is an expensive city, but it still seemed like the rates were very high for the hotel. The rooms were decently appointed, nothing spectacular but perfectly acceptable. Beds were comfy, extra towels were quickly brought when requested. I would only stay here again if I could get a much lower rate, a very unmemorable hotel stay if not for the billing and booking issues, and those made it memorable for the wrong reason.

Reviews.Title: “Hubby and I”
Reviews.Author: passion313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Chicago for a few days. It was excellent. Tje hotel we stayed at was the Sheraton Hotel and towers. It was elegant and beautiful. The staff was friendly and the hotel was very comfortable. The beds were unbelievably soft and fresh. Great atmosphere. When I go back to Chicago. I will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: srsr99
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked great from outside and as well as in the lobby.When went to check in there was young lady asking which floor did we want higher/lower,we wanted higher and then she made us wait saying they are cleaning the room, we waited and waited she never called back so i again went and asked another lady,she immediately gave a room on 25th floor.It was nice view.But for the money they charged us the room was extremely small,on top of that the television was not working.Anyway we were in a hurry to go out so we didnt care that time.But later in the night the engineer came and said its broken and he cant do anything right now.The problem was they didn't even fix it the next day untill the night.It was a bad experience.They don't even provide tooth brush/paste or body wash.I have to say for the amount of money spent on the hotel it was really not worth at alllll...please look out for some cheaper hotels evnthough they dont have good view,bcoz atleast they would have good service and some basic amenities.....

Reviews.Title: “Great local; phone issues.”
Reviews.Author: bigdogohle
Reviews.Content: Perfect location; short walk to the Navy Pier. Great rooms. The phone in my room would randomly ring; middle of night, early morning, you name it. I told them about it at the desk and was told "yes, we know. there's a glitch in the system". Hmmm, so you knew about it , but????? Otherwise, good place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: OBHF
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located. Very spacious. Lots of stuff nearby. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Courteous staff everywhere; bellman, front desk, concierge, waiters, etc. Easy check in and check out. Concierge was especially helpful on all occasions. Would highly recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Couples Surprise”
Reviews.Author: kim j
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers, the day after our wedding to accomodate a previously scheduled business trip (my bride was less than thrilled). Upon registering at the front desk, Sandra asked how our trip to Chicago was so far. During our conversation we shared that we were just married the day before and were looking forward to a couple of days out of the office before returning home to work. Sandra immediately upgraded our room to a king suite on the concierge level with a beautiful view of the Navy Pier. Later that evening we returned to the room from dinner to find champaign and chocolate covered strawberries! The next day, as we were enjoying the happy hour in the concierge lounge, we met Connie. Connie also went out of her way to make our visit feel special. All of the satff we encountered were courteous and professional. We don't get to Chicago that often, but when we do, we will be staying with our "friends" at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: HoosierOnTheGo23
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sheraton Chicago are so friendly and helpful. I was at the hotel on business during the Lollapalooza festival and as the hotel was extremely busy, the staff continued to smile and offer terrific service. Location is perfect for shopping, sight seeing and within walking distance to most. The rooms are very comfortable and large for downtown Chicago. I would highly recommend the Sheraton and would stay again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “$49 per night for parking, really??? Don't drive in.”
Reviews.Author: janmic1
Reviews.Content: Two main issues: (1) understaffed from the street to the front desk. Unfortunately I had to drive into the city, when I arrived there was an excessively long wait for parking. Then inside, there was a huge queue line with just one clerk working in a big city hotel. Not good (I will say friendly however) (2) I know this is a big city, but, $49 a night to park my car when I'm staying at that hotel? Really?? That's unreasonable and a bit gouging in my opinion. Again, I realize this is Chicago, but, I'm already paying a hefty price for this outdated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: mwilliams1323
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 small girls, stayed here on a Saturday night. For a Sheraton, I guess I expected it to be a little bit nicer than it was. When we first walked in our room I noticed it didn't smell very good. I also found 2 black hairs in the bathtub. I'm the kind of person that gets grossed out by these kinds of things. Everything else was pretty clean, but the carpet could have been vacuumed. The beds and pillows were outstanding! After all, you go to a hotel to get a good night's rest, right? It was perfect for that:) The pool on the 7th floor is really cool too! Overall, a decent place to stay but if i am going to be spending a lot of money to stay overnight in downtown Chicago, I would probably choose something else.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd time back and we will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Runderberg
Reviews.Content: We have found this hotel to have a great location...on the Chicago River and just a couple of blocks to Michigan Avenue. We called guest servces for several requests (my daugher forgot her toothbrush for one) and they were gracious in fulfilling our request and fast in their delivery. We were able to access the Club Lounge for warm food in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The staff in the evening were exceptional-warm, friendly and professional. Great beds!

Reviews.Title: “This is a review of their online booking: Haven't stayed yet.”
Reviews.Author: john1john1
Reviews.Content: The functionality of the search and booking system is good, so they get an extra star. BUT I searched for a room and found one that was priced $196 per night. This room had a note that says "Book Now And Save 20% - Fully Prepaid. Non-refundable..". So I'm thinking $196 - 20% = approx. $160. Cool! NOT! I continue through the process and after booking, it still showed $196. WTH? I called the number, and they tell me that price is already the discounted price! I called twice and both ladies (if that's the correct thing to call them) got really snotty with me! The second 'lady', "We have a legal team and our website is worded in a certain way by law as to not confuse our customers, so it's not our fault that you misinterpreted our website." and blew me off with "if you have any concerns other than the issue you are inquiring about, I'll be glad to assist you." in a snotty voice. Huh? Am I supposed to feel threatened? Plus, how is this a misinterpretation? Price: $196 Note:"Book Now And Save 20% - Fully Prepaid. Non-refundable.." Nothing more straight forward than that, I wouldn't think. Long story short(er), I RE-read all the fine print on their site and nowhere does it say $196 is the price that already includes the -$20, not even in the "Get complete details about this rate, taxes and other charges" link! I don't ever mind being proven wrong, so when I get there, I will ask someone to show me where it says the price already includes the discount because it must be hidden pretty well if it is indeed on their site somewhere. I also have a copy of their entire website, just so I can get a laugh if they've changed it before I get there. :-) I understand some things can be misleading, and it sucks, but based mainly on their attitudes on the phone, no more Sheraton for me after this one! This will be my first Sheraton visit and I chose it because I thought they held themselves to a somewhat higher than average standard, but I guess that makes me wrong about yet another thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Susannah T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week for four nights and had a great time. The hotel was clean and the service was great. The reason I am writing this review is just to let others know the WiFi was horrendous. The main lobby, the "Link" in the lower lobby even in the Club Lounge on the 33rd floor. I was only able to get on once. The concierge said that it had been that way for months and that I could possibly get a reduced rate for service in my room which seemed like a bit of a scam in my opinion. Also found the 2 PC in the lounge and however many in the Links to be quite busy as there were a few conventions going on so while I did use them often had to wait. When wanting to check tour times and set our schedule for the day it did become a bit frustrating.On another note, while I did not attempt to use my cell phone I did hear from a few other guests that they found it difficult to get a signal. All in all this would not deter me from staying here again I just wanted to pass my feedback along.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: KyRealtor
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great staff to make the stay very nice. Located just a block from Michigan Ave and on the river. My room had a view of the river as well as Lake Michigan. Easy walk to the Navy Pier and the Magnificient Mile. Be prepared if you drive that parking in this area is not cheap, $49.00 for Valet and $37.00 to self park for 24 hours. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We're Still talking about the trip and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael_82011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the Sheraton Towers in Chicago and came back again this summer. This year we celebrated our 30th Anniversary and have been back twice this year. Get a room overlooking the river and enjoy the fireworks on Saturday nights in the summer. The hotel is walking distance to Navy Pier, you can watch the sun rise on Lake Michigan and you are steps away from boat tours, water taxi's, restaurants and shopping! Everyone at the hotel is helpful from bell captains, front desk and maids to the dining tips from the concierge. This hotel makes you feel important and appreciated.
