A great place to relax and melt into their big soft beds. A true value and a trip we are still talking about with family and friends back home......and yes we'll be baaaaack !

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: hiba26
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my husband for 2 nights, i liked the hotel it has a large lobby, it was crowded a lot of people was checking in at the time we arrived but we got our room so quick. the room was clean with comfortable bed but it was a little bit small,if you will stay with a child may be the standard room will not be the right choice. the breakfast buffet was expensive with little choices. the location was great & the room has a very beautiful views of Chicago.service was good & the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “people are great”
Reviews.Author: Patrick R
Reviews.Content: Had my wife, daughter, son-in-law and 3 grandchildren in Chicago for fun and site seeing. From the time we checked in until the time we left the people that work at the Sheraton were wonderful. Erin at the front desk the wait staff at breakfast, etc were kind, friendly and more than helpful. The cleanliness of the rooms had a bit to be desired and could use some special attention especially in the bathrooms. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning and it was as good as any I have ever had in Chicago or anywhere else for that matter. Again VERY friendly wait staff and excellent food. I would stay here again mainly because of the wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; fabulous for kids”
Reviews.Author: BelleCase
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Chicago for four nights and loved the location. Our room faced the river and had views of the lake. My boys (4 and 6) enjoyed looking out the window at the big city life, river taxis, and skyscrapers. The hotel was an easy walk to Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier. The indoor swimming pool needs updating, but the boys loved it. The staff (especially concierge) was very helpful. The lobby has neat computer games that kept the kids entertained. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: HeatherK98
Reviews.Content: We have been staying exclusively at the Sheraton for 5 years in Chicago. The location is fabulous-just off Michigan Ave with beautiful river & lake views. The club level amenities are excellent, and the pool is just the right size for young children. The rooms are always spotless and quite spacious. Service is impeccable-starting with the valet when you arrive, the turndown service staff, and the club level lounge waitstaff. We always feel incredibly welcome at the Sheraton and consider it our "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Starwood Options Available, This one needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: Usually I stay at the Westin or the W in Chicago but when both of those were so expensive, I tried this place. I had actually stayed here years ago and sadly, I think the place looks the same. The public areas are fine, spacious, it's really a big hotel, but the rooms are so dated. It's your typical sheraton and doesn't have a ton of personality, but beyond that, it really needs some updating. Especially for the prices they charge, it seems that the furniture, decor, paint and bathrooms should be refreshed. It really just doesn't look like the typical Starwood quality. I did like that they had bottle water free of charge, which sometimes they do for Spg Platinum and other times they don't. The bell guy who gets the cabs is very friendly and in general their staff seemed to be pretty good, but the location is a bit out of the way and I think I'd only consider if there was a great deal and the other Starwoods were too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Travel87
Reviews.Content: What a great end-of-summer getaway! The hotel has great views from any room. Their breakfast buffet is outstanding...unlike anything we've had. The guy that makes the crepes is super! We were able to walk to Millennium Park, Navy Pier & Michigan Ave. Strolling along the river was an unexpected addition to our stay. Our only complaint was the lack of hand-dipped ice cream places without a major walk after a long day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views! Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: electrarella
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton for a conference and I thought the hotel was very nice. Check in was quick and I had a room that had a great view overlooking the river. The room was clean and nicely furnished .The bed was soooo comfortable!! Their beds are so comfortable that on the final invoice it tells you where you can purchase one! I did have a few rowdy's on my floor carrying on at 1am but fortunately it didn't last but a few minutes. There is free computer and internet at the Links cafe on the lower level. There is also a few ISurface game tables in the lounge area next to the bar and one in the cafe. However, breakfast at LB's in the hotel for 2 of us was $46. Yikes! You can sit outside along the river and you can even walk that path in either direction to get to various places. The concierge was very helpful in guiding us as to which tour to take during our down time and also gave us a card for priority seating at a nearby restaurant. This hotel is conveniently located to the Magnificent Mile and other attractions. One of the on-off doubledecker bus stops is right across the street. I recommend that tour as you learn interesting facts about the city and can get on and off at any of the stops you wish. Plus you get a great view riding on top of the bus. I would definitely choose to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: James E
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice romantic weekend stay at the Sheraton Hotel & Towers in Chicago. True to their boasts, it really is ideally located for getting to most of the key attractions in the Windy City. Great views of the lake and a short walk to Navy Pier. Very close to many iconic Chicago buildings, and just a short stroll from the River Walk. Also easy to get to the "L". The hotel was clean and nicely furnished and the staff very accommodating. Awesome front door crew who all knew the best places to go--espeically for dining--and the best times to go and how to get there and so forth. I've always considered the frankness and professionalism of the front door staff to truly be the heart and soul of the service level of any hotel, and the crew at the Sheraton Chicago came through every time. Will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAKM09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area. It is right on the river and very close to the lake, magnificent mile, navy pier, L train stop, etc. You can walk nearly everywhere or take a short cab ride. However...this hotel is very overpriced for the quality of the rooms. My room was located on a non smoking floor but smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. The room decor was very outdated and not welcoming. Guest services was very helpful and the concierge accommodating. The lobby, lounge and restaurant were all good. The burger restaurant on the river was great for a late night snack. There is also an Irish Pub across the street that is GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Predictable”
Reviews.Author: ckasinger
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, mediocre service for a huge hotel. I was charged $300 for boxes I shipped to the hotel three days prior to my arrival for a "handling fee". That's just astronomical. Easy walk to navy pier and Michigan Ave. Certainly a convenient location, however, the restaurant's in the hotel were rarely available.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Bathroom....”
Reviews.Author: MARTINIGURL
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Sheraton for one night cause we were going to see Paul McCartney. (AMAZING CONCERT BY THE WAY) Got a very good price thru Priceline. Check in was a breeze. Lobby area was beautiful and up scale. Was given a corner room which was a bit of a walk but the view was worth it. Room was average size, nothing special. Bed was comfortable. My main complaint is the bathroom. It really needed an overhaul. Very dated and the smell of mold was a bit overwelming. I dont expect this from a 4 star hotel. I got up early so decided to (try) to use the hotel's workout room. I looked it up in the hotel hand book and read about it and the pool. I arrived to the workout room only to be greated by an attendant asking me to sign in and if I had a Starwood card. I told the attendant that I was a member of Starwood so he looked it up on the computer only to tell me that I did not have a high enough membership so there would be a fee to use the gym. My issue is WHY didnt it say in the hotel handbook that there is a fee to use the workout room????? I dont agree with charging a fee to use a SMALL work out room if I am staying in the hotel. I decided to take a nice power walk on the river instead to get my exercise. The hotel is in a GREAT location. All in all.....my stay at the Sheraton was ok....but there are so many choices in the city I dont think I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time staying here, we really enjoy it...the do have some HVAC issues though”
Reviews.Author: cam01209
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoy this hotel because it's so close to everything. Navy Pier and Mag. Mile are within walking distance. On our most recent stay we brought our two kids and we stayed in a King room that had two roll-away beds. It was perfect for us. The room was large, clean and everything worked! Our biggest complaint was with the room temperature inside the social areas. It was absolutely freezing! There were about 20 of us sitting around having drinks and the main topic of discussion was the fact it was incredibly cold. Our server said "it's always like this" and that there was nothing she could do. That was disappointing. Aside from that, the entire staff was friendly and we'll happily stay here again (next time we'll just bring our winter coats).

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: gamedeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in small, double bed room on 25th floor. Great river view, but building curves, so even better views in the lower digit room numbers per floor ( 2507 vs 2541). Went with 2 other families and were able to get rooms all on the same floor, which was a bonus. Did I mention small rooms? A bit cramped with table, chair floor lamp,desk/console & 2 very comfortable DOUBLE beds, not queen. Rooms were in ok condition, decent carpet and wallcoverings, a little boring but ok. REALLY tiny bathroom, shows wear and tear but ok. Hotwire rated this 4 stars but 3.5 is more accurate. Pool, location, and price were the reasons we went for this (BLIND Hotwire) hotel: I would not have paid rack rate. Pool was small, but great for the kids. Parking was listed at $49/nt so found a lower level lot a block away for $28/nt. Never had a problem in the past parking there but this time with lots of rain, dripping from above caused a "glazed donut"looking mineral deposit on the roof and back window of our car. I didn't notice right away so didn't speak to lot attendant about it. Read online that vinegar would remove it and thankfully it stubbornly rubbed off. Easy access to Navy Pier, Michigan Av and water taxis. Took the #146 bus on Mich Av, south to Field Museum and Adler Planatarium---fast and fun. Fun lunch at Dick's Last Resort, overlooking river and great pizza at Giordano's. Terrific breakfasts at West Egg.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, sound hotel”
Reviews.Author: caitni2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and towers for 1 week over New Years 2010/11. Got a hotwire deal that was excellent value. The location was perfect for shopping and sight seeing. The leasure facilities were good and overlooked the river which was nice looking at the snow and ice outside! At busy periods there wasn't much pleasure but early morning was good. The hotel was very clean and well maintained and was big and airy. The beds were super comfortable and the pillows were divine! I cannot imagine that every room did not have a great view. Would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain for the hotwire price of $114”
Reviews.Author: tlrex
Reviews.Content: Big fancy conference type hotel, maybe about 2 blocks from michigan ave -easily walkable to shopping. We stayed in the higher floors, the room was very clean and modern for the most part.no mini fridge but ice machine nearby. The room provided a bottle of water but I didn't touch it since i would imagine they they would charge you $5 for it? Didn't have time for swimming but the indoor lap pool looked decent although the water looked a little merky..there is a pool towel boy/check in desk before you enter so you would think he would have time to check the chemicals once in awhile. Nice outdoor deck looking over the river. TIP** free internet at the internet cafe down in the basement area. A block across from the hotel is a domicks grocery,walgreens,amc theater/game place, Its about a 25 minute walk to the navy pier and millinium park. I would suggest taking a cab to millinium park-Its walkable but had to go through a long under pass and it smelled like urine and it was creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent condition, questionable value and service”
Reviews.Author: white_shoes_white
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night on the 29th floor. Used Starpoints. This was our 3rd stay at this hotel. It's not bad, but we had some service issues this time around -- waited a LONG time for a cell phone charger to be retrieved and brought to the concierge desk. Communication among staff in different departments seemed to be the culprit. The pool is nice. Fitness center looks very nice as well, although we did not use it. Newer equipment. The Starbucks-style cafe downstairs was a bright spot. The PCs with free internet are located here (Sheraton Link) and the printer worked. Nice large 23-24" monitors. The bacon/egg/cheese croissant was tasty, and good value at < $5. Nice to have an option for inexpensive breakfast, because the restaurant on the lower level was priced super-high...seriously, $18 for an omelette?! Our room, 2910, had a nice view of Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. We hoped for a Club Level room since we had to pay extra Starpoints to book our 'upgraded' room but were not successful (we are Starwood Gold but this was a Saturday night in the summer, so not surprising that our request was not granted). Room was in pretty good condition, pretty clean, decent sized, decent beds. No big complaints, no superlatives either. Common areas are very nice. Some cool computerized flat-screen game boards for kids (and adults) to use in the lobby. We did not really see any 'kids activities' per se, nor did we seek them out. Very nice location if being near Navy Pier is important to you. We wanted to try the 'W' hotel instead, but it was booked in spite of spg.com showing it as available. Sheraton pricing was about the same, but the W seems like a higher-grade property. This hotel has not disappointed us in any big way, but it hasn't really given us any compelling reason to consider it for our next Chicago visit. We'll likely shop around and try somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rude front desk people, overall pretty average”
Reviews.Author: thirty-something72
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for a business trip (one for me, one for an opposite sex colleague). My confirmation said "two rooms" but upon check in the woman at the front desk said her info said we only had one room and was insistent that we take one room - despite the fact this was a business trip and we are opposite sex colleagues. The Sheraton front desk staffer made us dig out (with a slow wi-fi connection) the original confirmation - which was a pain and insulting considering we were telling the truth. She was anchored to the idea that we could only have one room and as we got visibly frustrated her colleague, who was standing beside her, took charge of the situation and eventually checked into two rooms... phew. Other than that unfortunate entrance the breakfast was excellent, location very good, but overall a pretty average business hotel. We went for drinks at the Trump and were blown away - it felt like a different world. Next time I'm staying at the Drake...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed at by far!!”
Reviews.Author: sdj52
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel made it by far the nicest vacation my family and I have had in a long time and possibly ever! Every single employee was genuinely thrilled to work there and it showed with how they treated their guests. The price was reasonable for a hotel this nice in this location (downtown Chicago) but what made it stand far above the rest was the hotel staff in every department. I cannot say enough nice things about them all!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION AND LOCATION !!!!”
Reviews.Author: CGuimaraes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located . You are walking distance to the most attractions. For this trip, I was looking for a hotel in a good location and this hotel has it.... I trully recommend this hotel if you have the same interesting. Rooms and service were fine and no complaints at all. Beautiful lobby and bar. You can have fast meals at Fox and Obel and breakfast at Starbucks. We had the main meals at Cheesecake factory restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool and great view”
Reviews.Author: Tonias54
Reviews.Content: the room was in the average with no fridge. The pool was clean and beautiful. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: NCPirate82
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. No complaints or problems at all with the hotel. When back in Chicago, will definitely plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warmer hospitality than at most upscale hotels with lux rooms & views”
Reviews.Author: GammaQuadrant
Reviews.Content: This is a pricey but beautiful hotel in a location convenient to North Michigan Avenue shopping (and El trains or buses to anywhere), with city resources (a big pharmacy, movies, liquor store are only a block away if you want to save on mini-bar costs, see a film, or pick up a forgotten item!) But what struck me most was the really amazing warmth and hospitality of their staff -- every person from the phone operators, reception, bell desk, restaurant, and custodial staff seemed much nicer than in most hotels and FAR nicer than I've encountered before in Chicago. Extremely comfortable bed, very clean and quiet room, gorgeous view out over the Water Street park. Bike rental and riverwalk out the back door of the hotel. Good in-house restaurants, with superb convention services (the most sophisticated set-up for a PowerPoint talk that I've seen anywhere, with really top-notch staff to trouble-shoot any computer glitches). I was presenting at a meeting here, and was highly impressed with the whole place, from a comfort, convenience, and business standpoint. The internet is about $13/day if you are not a VIP (this is a problem in Chicago generally). The "Go!" shuttle can get you to Midway airport or O'Hare for a reasonable price, this hotel does not have an in-house shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, but souless”
Reviews.Author: Lasrman
Reviews.Content: This is located right near the Navy Pier so it is in the center of action. It is efficient quiet, and clean but has little else to recommend it. There is nothing special about the place. I wouldn't choose to stay here unless I happened to get a great deal on the price. No ice machine, no free wireless, no convenient Starbucks or clone in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A mostly pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: SUNandSANDLOVER77
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at this hotel and enjoyed it. I stayed about four or five years ago for my birthday and was really impressed. I felt then that it was well managed and well maintained, which is difficult for a hotel of this size and capacity. This time around, I was also impressed overall (although not very impressed by the rooms, somewhat dated, although nothing major, and they are fine given that you dont spend the bulk of your time in Chicago in the room). The hotel itself seems very well maintained and has a lot of amenities (business center, a few restaurants, bars, great location on the river, pool, parking (although a rip off at $48 when you can go next door, literally, for $26) and nice views. Overall, for the price in Chicago I would rate this hotel pretty well, and it should be noted that I am pretty picky when it comes to hotels! This hotel has a GREAT fitness center overlooking the river! the pool is okay, I never understand why hotels have pools and not hot tubs...this hotel does NOT have a hot tub, that would be a nice addition if they did. Overall the hotel is nice, well kept and staff seemed friendly. The one complaint I have is that on a Sunday morning starting pretty early around 8 or 9 am, the cleaning staff were being particularly loud in our hallway. I thought it was a group of hotel guests and was getting seriously annoyed, but was extremely surprised to find out that it was the cleaning crew that worked for the hotel. That was pretty irritating. The cleaning staff we did encounter were really nice, but might want to be a little more cognizant of the fact that guests want to relax and sleep in on vacation sometimes! Also, the tub in our bathroom did not work, it was stuck on the shower setting, and when I tried to run a bath, the tub spout almost came out of the wall (I meant to tell front desk but did not get a chance) might be time for an upgrade to the rooms Sheraton, otherwise, well done hotel, especially such a large property! Lastly, I must mention, we ate Sunday Brunch in the hotel and it was seriously awesome, the chefs who made our omelets and crepes at the create your own bars were SO enthusiastic and fun, and the food was great, a ton to offer. Almost as good as the breakfast buffets on our honeymoon in Bora Bora, which is a major accolade for those of you who have never been to Bora Bora. Nice work on the buffet. Again have to say the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful here!

Reviews.Title: “Mattress change?”
Reviews.Author: DrJ6
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a double room through Priceline for around $120, which was more than I usually like to pay on a bid, but this was a Saturday night only stay in July so perhaps I should not complain. The hotel sits on the north side of the river and is an easy walk to Michigan Ave. Check in was a breeze and I was very grateful to get into our room well before 3 p.m. The trainee at the front desk was especially nice and seemed genuinely happy to assist us. When it was discovered that the batteries on the TV remote were dead, replacements were brought in short order. The pool on the 7th floor is small but it served its purpose nicely and has a good view of the river and Lake Michigan. I usually avoid room service meals but we had no other practical choice for dinner so I reluctantly made the call. To my surprise, the food arrived earlier than the promised 30 minute wait and was really quite good. In spite of the 18% included gratuity and the $3.75 delivery fee, I though it was a very nice meal. The one big downside to the stay was the bed. I have slept on my share of old mattresses in my time but this one was something I would expect from a backpacker's hotel in Europe. I felt as though I had to cling to the right side of the bed so that I did not go rolling down the left side and onto the floor. Okay, that might be an exaggeration but it was not up to the standards of a major hotel chain. Get me a decent mattress and I'd give the property a 4 star rating. As is, the best I can give is a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situation, but hotel lookinga little "tired"”
Reviews.Author: CalellaDePalafrugell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights whilst at a conference, and for that type of event it is ideal, as it's within easy walking distance of Navy Pier, boat trips on river, Michigen Avenue etc. But it's rather impersonal and I wouldn't choose to stay there for vacation or a weekend break. Beds extremely comfortable and our room on 30th floor was quiet. However, our room, the corridors and pool area all looked rather "tired" and are in need of a re-furb. Breakfast expensive for what it was. Concierge recommended a five-minute walk to an Italian restaurant called Volare, which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: I_like_2_travel008
Reviews.Content: where to begin???? upon arrival having arrived late in the evening (approx 8pm) the room was not ready!!! I thought check in was supposed to be 3pm??? we went to a meeting and came back at midnight to find there still was no room available??? the manager on duty was a blubbering idiot who didn't even know how to take care of the problem claiming there was no room and all of a sudden finding a room??? the next morning we spoke to another manager and at least she was a little better and had the common sense to try and make things right. by offering us access to the lounge which would have been nice except for the fact that the bagels were stale, the food ran out quickly and was not replemished and the women serving there had the audacity to ask for a tip!!! The rooms are very old, run down and shabby. The in house steak restaurant was too pricey and the food was not good The business center lost a number of things that were sent for us and to this day we have never received them. The management did not follow up on anything and even after speaking to a number of people (all supposed to be managers) they never got back to us or tried to make us happy. All in all I will never step foot in that hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Facilities, but decor in the 80's”
Reviews.Author: AndyFWimbledon
Reviews.Content: A large well organised hotel in a good location, service was exceptional, room was spacious and bright and well maintained, breakfast selection was at a very high level, beds and room furniture were good, decor was clean just very dated. On site restaurants were well priced and the service was excellent. Bar area, wide and not very personal and service was a bit hit and miss. Reception and concierge very good. Would use for business again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel using Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: jamaica1974
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but I was VERY disappointed in the service we received. We booked this hotel using Hotwire - I booked a room for 2 adults and 2 children. Upon arriving at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers I was told that the room we were going to receive was a king bed room. I reminded her that we had 4 in our party - and she also confirmed that was on our booking. She continued to inform me that the ONLY room available was a king room - mind you I made our reservations about 3 weeks ahead of time. The woman checking us in continued to tell me that we are never guaranteed a certain type of room when using a third-party reservation system - I did acknowledge that I could not be guaranteed a tower room or poolside, but that I should have a room reserved that would accommodate the number of people on our reservation. I have used Hotwire for several years and booked a lot of hotels and flights this way and have never had an issue. My advice - DO NOT stay here - who know if they will have the right room to accomodate the number of people in your reservation. I'm sure what happened is that they could get more money out of someone who needed that room - who cares about the people that got a good deal - right??

Reviews.Title: “Going back home”
Reviews.Author: Dulajax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were both born and raised in Chicago before we finally settled in Milwaukee. We go back to stay on Michigan Avenue one or two times a year and it always feels like we are coming home. This time we stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. It is a great location on the north side of the Chicago River. It is just a couple minute walk to everything Michigan Avenue has to offer, the lakefront, downtown and Navy Pier. We had a room that had a city view that overlooked the river, the Wrigley Building, Trump tower and the Tribune Building so the view was spectacular day and night. Everyone that we dealt with at the hotel was friendly and helpful. It was very warm while we were there and the air conditioning in the hotel was great. The whole weekend was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mctom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend an on-site conference in late June 2010. The room was very nice, clean, comfortable bed, well stocked supplies and properly maintained. The public areas were clean, spacious and comfortable. The service was helpful and friendly. The pool and gym were quite suitable. Really enjoyed the cold towels after a sweaty workout!! Check-in and check-out were both quick and simple. We were allowed to check in quite early and we utilized the luggage storage on the day of check-out. The location was extremely convenient. An easy walk to Michigan Avenue for dining and shopping along the Magnificent Mile. Close to Millenium Park and Navy Pier and right on the Chicago River. Steps away from the water taxis and sightseeing boats.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Average Service.”
Reviews.Author: vveen
Reviews.Content: After experiencing new & nice room at Sheraton Hotel â€“ Boston the night before, Sheraton Hotel â€“ Chicago is a disappointiment. The room is unquestionably big (or just because my room was located at the very back corner), but it looked dated and tired. When we arrived at our room on midnight and about to get shower, we realized the room didnâ€™t have bathrobe and shower gel! When we called the housekeeping to get us the gel, they said they donâ€™t have shower gel and offered shop bar instead. I found it a bit weird that Sheraton didnâ€™t have shower gel. It took them 15 mins to get us the bathrobe. Weâ€™re glad we didnâ€™t pay the hotel expense out of our pocket because it was a business trip. Apart from those issues, the location of the hotel is surely what I like the most. Itâ€™s a walking distance to Magnificent Mile & Millennium Park while passing a beautiful a charming river. A very nice spot for your morning walk! Nonetheless, Itâ€™s probably a good hotel if you want to travel Chicago in a brief time for a highlight sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again if the price was right”
Reviews.Author: EmilyTheChef
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location. Billing was not handled properly, though fixed with a visit to the front desk to clear things up. Room size was nice (#1834). Room was tidy, but dirty... various splatters and sprays on walls and doors. ick. Cold water faucet turned on by itself if you didn't over-tighten it. Drawers and cabinet doors swung open if you didn't latch them. Not sure if it was the floor that was uneven or the furniture. SUPER COMFY beds with wonderful linens. Delicious Starbucks Coffee filter packs made in a single cup making machine. (not a Keurig type... just a drip coffee maker that you put a tea-bag type coffee pod in. It's an expensive hotel, I probably wouldn't choose to stay there unless it cost under $150 per night. Terrific location. Walk to Navy Pier, Fox & Obel, Volare Restaurant, Michigan Ave, Walgreens, liquor store, bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jguynn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Sheraton. Checking in and out was easy and fast. They even let us check in a bit early. The lady at the counter was friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. Served it's purpose as we weren't in the room very much. Too busy! We checked out the pool, but didn't use it. Again, not enough time. The pool looked nice though. The location of the hotel was great. We walked to the Navy Pier a couple of times. Easy walk to Michigan Ave. shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Decent-ish location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterGulliver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pleasantly situated, right by the river (odd floor numbers had river views on our floor) which has a very nice riverwalk alongside it, but as a base for sightseeing it's slightly out of the way: no subway stop close by, five minute walk (with kids) to the magnificent mile and not close to good dining options. The hotel itself is very nice - the "iPad tables" in the lobby were a hit with the kids but obviously in much demand (they only have two). The hotel pool and sundeck were nice and they were welcoming of kids there. The "Chicago Burger Company" restaurant was overpriced ($8 for a single cheeseburger) and absolutely not worth it. Rooms were fine although the plumbing was extremely noisy. And we had the obligatory inconsiderate 1am "corridor shouters" (ie thoughtless people who come back to their rooms shouting all the way down the corridor, presumably after a drink or two). We got our rooms discounted via hotwire.com - happy under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel with service of Ã  'hotel de charme'”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: Perfect service (Thanks Amanda for all hour help) Friendly staff Nice and clean rooms Great fitness and pool Good location Great lounge We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: millie2745
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and continue having great experiences. The staff is extremely friendly and always ready to help out. It is in a wonderful location, close to Navy Pier and many other attractions. Be sure to try Shula's Steakhouse. It is excellent. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The club level is worth it as well. You can have breakfast, and enjoy the lovely view. This hotel always makes us feel as if we are their only customers!

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: honolulu777
Reviews.Content: We had small things taken out of our room. For the amount of money we paid for this hotel, which didn't even include parking, ($300 + $50), we feel this hotel is not worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Perfect Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: neilich
Reviews.Content: River view of Lake views were spectacular. FAST FAST elevators, excellent restaurants, nice knowledgable staff. Some rooms can see the Fireworks on Navy Pier (Sun/Wed). WONDERFUL location for the hidden gem, the river walk and all of its restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A big and pretty good Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Nikon
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Booked the rooms through Starwood site. The room was big and comfortable and had 2 double beds. View was perfectly OK. Did not try the pool but it looked OK (but maybe a little small). Did not eat breakfast at the Hotel as it was very expensive. The Hotel Bar was a typical Bar for a big business Hotel. Hotel is well located close to Chicago River, Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue. I might stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: Janice81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Sheraton Chicago for 3 nights in December 2010 right before Christmas. It was my first time to Chicago and it was amazing! The hotel also impressed us which really made our stay all the better. I honestly have no complaints about this hotel... we checked in with no problems and had a spacious, clean room. One of the things I really liked about the hotel was the free internet usage available on the lower ground. It came in extremely handy to communicate with friends/family as well as research on tours etc. Location of the hotel is great too. We were right along the Chicago River - though we didn't have a view of the river - our room was still pleasant. It is only a short walk to Michigan Avenue. It's right across the road from a cinema in case you wanted to watch a movie. It's a short distance to Navy Pier and a short walk to Millenium Park. Before traveling to Chicago, I had no idea which hotel to pick location wise - I have no regrets whatsoever in picking Sheraton Chicago! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good amenities; little larger than we usually like”
Reviews.Author: 3ofusMens
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for the first time this week. My friend got a great rate through Hotwire & she had stayed here before. The lobby is very nice; great views because you are on the river. They have interactive (think iPad) game tables that our daughters loved. It is a rather large hotel so to get to some things you need to walk down some pretty long hallways -- mostly to get to the pool/sundeck. But when you get there, the view is pretty, the pool temp was great; plenty of towels -- no complaints. The rooms are pretty standard; smaller than other hotels in the area we have stayed at. Had to climb over the chair by the window to close the shades; adjust room temp. Bathroom, unfortunately, smelled like an ashtray -- no evidence of smoking, but the smell was coming from somewhere. The location is pretty good -- about a 5 min. walk to Navy Pier; little longer to get to Michigan Ave shopping. If you drive, valet parking is $49 for overnight. Like another reviewer said, for the right price we might stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location... very pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: dlh160
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay at this hotel and can't say enough good things about it. Our check-in was quick and we appreciated the river view king room. Our room was a nice size with a loveseat by the window. Our bed was super comfortable and made getting out of bed in the morning difficult. The location of the hotel really sold us. It is within walking distance to Navy Pier, Millenium Park, Michigan Ave shopping and Ohio St. Beach. There is a bowling alley and AMC movie theater a block away. We didn't eat at the restaurants but the menus looked fine. We would definitely stay here again. I just read a review stating that this hotel was dirty and run down and can't believe they stayed in the same hotel we did!

Reviews.Title: “Priceline picked it for us”
Reviews.Author: bidnowbaby
Reviews.Content: $130/night + taxes via Priceline, 06/24 - 06/27 Decent place, not a 4star in my opinion Pros: Great Navy Pier or River view from our 24th floor room Lobby is nice Kids liked tables in lobby that were like big ipads Quick check-in Asked for Navy Pier view and they were glad to accomodate Bellman nice/friendly Comfy beds Grocery (Fox & Obel) nearby for food/drinks as well as drug stores Pool/sundeck area has a great river view Cons: Bathroom needs updating - looks tired/old Bad lighting in bathroom/hallway/closet area (near full length mirror) Not near public transit - long walk to el; 10 min walk to bus on Michigan Pool not appealing - very murky water No free internet Nickel and dime you - $5.95 bottled h20 on bedside table, $49/day parking, etc No make-up mirror General: I wouldn't pick to stay here again. I prefer something closer to Michigan Ave and/or public transit. It's not 4star quality. The lobby is nicer than the rooms. Rooms need to be updated, especially bathrooms as they appear old/tired. But, I'm a priceline shopper for Chicago hotel rooms, so I take my chances!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Louisville-Lindsay
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. The front desk was very accommodating and my corner room on the 28th floor had a nice view of the water. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For better value and service...stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Chippi1
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, but only because we paid ahead and had to stay. Room did not seem clean. Stains on bed linens, old carpet, drab decor, very old bathroom. Overheard guest at front desk check-in one day state that the room she just checked in to had used soap and open shampoo in the tub. Apparently not cleaned. Our bathroom seemed to be from twenty or thirty years ago and badly in need of update to make it more useful and cleaner. Bathroom in our King room had VERY limited shelf space and no vanity. Single, freestanding wallmount sink without vanity and TERRIBLE yellowish lighting made it difficult to do hair and apply makeup. Old, ratty towels completed the experience. In bed area, there was limited space reminiscent of a "larger" room I occupied once in London. So, by typical American hotel standards-tiny. The room had one useable, and accessable electrical outlet outside the bathroom and one inside. Super small, overpriced mini bar fridge was actually warm! Parking was expensive and valet seemed to be the only "easy" option. The top side valet staff was the only personable and hard-working staff in the place. Room service was OK, but typically over priced and hard to accommodate in the small room. And you may require this service, since the only casual dining in the hotel seems to close up early. Alarm clock in our room was complicated, but the one in our travel companion's room was fine. Bathroom lighting has two options, full on or full off, and with the light switch outside the door - sure to wake and confound you in the middle of the night. View from 25th floor was very nice and the bed was comfortable - I'll give it that much. Overall, I was terribly regettful that we did not stay somewhere else. There is no shortage of hotels in Chicago and I'm sure we could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Stacey086
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton was one of the best Sheratons in which I have stayed. It had a few issues (room not ready at check-in time, dresser door broken) but everything was remedied quickly and with a pleasant smile. We just returned from a 5 night stay there'd and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. We had a nice view of the Chicago River and a portion of Lake Michigan and did not even request an upgraded view room. We had requested a slightly larger room because we had my son's wheelchair to store in the room and we were provided with a larger room which was certainly helpful and welcome since there were four of us staying five nights. The best part of the Sheraton was the location. We were walking distance to practically everything in the city - navy pier, Mag mile (Michigan ave), the loop, grant park, millennium park and even the museum area ( about 1.7 miles to them but totally walkable). We even walked to Sears (Willis tower) and John Hancock Building. The breakfast buffet at LB Bistro was probably the best I've ever had too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Close to Michigan Ave and the Loop”
Reviews.Author: TheBayou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new, only about 6-7 years old. I have probably stayed in this hotel at least 15 nights over those years with the most recent stay being this past week. I was in town for business meetings in The Loop and this hotel is perfect for that as it is close enough to the meetings and also close enough to Michigan Ave. and a lot of great restaurants. There is also an AMC movie theater directly across from the hotel. The rooms are what you expect from a Sheraton. They are nice, clean and of a decent size. The lobby is very large and often full of convention goers. The bar/cafe off the lobby is good and is usually packed at night. The hotel restaurant is Shula's steak house which is pretty much like any other steakhouse (expensive but nice for expense accounts and business meetings), except you don't have to leave the hotel to get there. If I could give some advice to the hotel owners it would be to freshen up the hallways. They have not aged well and give off an institutional feel which you don't want when you just arrive at a hotel. Overall: Good hotel in a great location and perfect for any trip to Chicago, whether business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother, They might accidentally overcharge you by $400.”
Reviews.Author: Loulew21
Reviews.Content: We go down to Chicago every year for my boyfriend and my bdays. We choose this hotel based on the price. We found a prepaid package deal directly through the hotel so we didn't have to pay for it while we were down there, sounds like a good idea right? Wrong. The day of check out I received my bill under the door with a zero balance because it was prepaid. A few days later I checked my credit card statement to find another $403 hotel charge from them. When I called to find out why, this incredibly rude lady said she'd have to call me back. She finally called me back saying I'm not sure why you got charged again. She again said she would have to call me back. Hours later she calls me back probably on purpose within 5mins before she left for the day so she didn't have to deal with it. Meanwhile leaving me angry and confused. The next morning I call back to talk to this rude lady again only to say oh I'll have to call you back, I said NO this needs to be fixed now, So what does she do? She says oh well all that needs to be done is I have to reverse the charges. So this lady obviously didn't want to do her job that could have took 5mins to do instead of 2 days and make me never to want to stay there again. So thank you I will defiantly choose another hotel next time maybe where people actually do there job right the first time! Side note if you do choose to stay here, Check in was average the guy didn't give us any info on the hotel ie what was there for food/drink/pool. Just checked us in and gave us the keys. We had to come back and ask about everything later on. The bellman are rude. We stood there wanting to check our bags while the guy ignored us. We had to ask him to hold our 2 bags as it seems like to much for him to do his job. There was one lady that was extremely nice that helped us at the concierge desk. I didn't get her name but she was great! Even found me some tissue paper so I could wrap a friends gift! We did try going in the pool once, it was so cold I was shivering, needless to say we didn't come back! The bed and pillows were great, the room got really hot in the middle of the night and we weren't sure how to change that and it was really late so we didn't bother asking. You could see the lake and navy pier. I was pretty at night! The overall experience wasn't great, it was slightly below average for a big hotel group like the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: richie3030
Reviews.Content: Suzanne Spring at the Concierge Desk will go out of her way to help you. She knows the city, where to eat and what to do. She goes out of her way to make sure your stay is incredible! Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel with Marvelous Location”
Reviews.Author: MangoChetney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights during a convention. Everything worked for me. Enjoyed Shula's steakhouse on premises. Walked two blocks to board the Architectural and Historical Cruise operated by Chicago Line Cruises that the Concierge worked on very hard to find me a seat. Room and internet worked perfectly. Walked minutes to the main shopping street - Nordi's on Michigan Ave. Lobby bar served a terrific Manhattan but offered very limited food selection. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay-Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Julieandtom1616
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The location was fantastic. Our room over looked the river and faced Lake Michigan. Check in/check out was swift and easy...The hotel had everything and there was no reason to leave the hotel...when we did leave, everything we wanted to do was in walking distance. Great hotel, especially the "little extras" provided. Thanks D.H-B :) Tom and Julie

Reviews.Title: “it was fine. some positives, some negatives....”
Reviews.Author: Yankeebaseball
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about this sheraton, but overall i'd recommend it and might stay here again myself if the price was right. First off, i'd say it is a so-so sheraton as far as sheratons are concerned. I've stayed in nicer sheratons, and I've stayed in worse. This one is a huge convention center hotel, and is a little older, and so it's a little worn down. The bathrooms for example look a little older and show a little dirt in the edges of the floor and shower tiles etc., but other than that everything was clean and acceptable enough, so that's all I care about there. Some of the other negatives were that the phone by the bed didn't work, nor did the mini-fridge (all the beverages inside were practically room temperature). Also, the first morning I spilled a little bit of coffee in bed, which left a little bit of a stain on the pillow case. They evidently don't routinely change the pillow cases, because i had that same stained pillowcase with me the next two nights. (though I was very willing to overlook this because, frankly, having free coffee/coffee makers in each room is invaluable to me!) Also, once or twice we had a little bit of a line waiting for elevator, as like I said, this is a big convention hotel which can pack in a lot of people. I didn't eat at their restaurants, but have heard they are pricey. (I can't confirm that, but can confirm a rail gin and tonic will run you $11 at the hotel bar! yikes! But that's not a big deal for me, because you don't come to chicago to eat at a hotel restaurant or drink at a hotel bar - there's too much going on elsewhere in the city, and so shame on you anyway for not getting out and finding something better anyway.) The biggest negative for me personally was that the hotel is a bit further from the El line than I initially thought it was, looking at the map. It was a full 20+ minute walk to get to the El Red Line, and even further to get to the Blue line (which you need going to and from O'Hare.) This obviously isn't a big deal, but it means you have to budget your time accordingly or take a cab each time you want to use the El. On the upside, this Sheraton had a number of good things going for it too. We had a really great view from our hotel room - we were on the 21st floor and could see both the lake to the left and the river cutting through the city to the right. They also have a great outdoor lounge area/deck on the 7th floor and a nice indoor pool and health club right there too. The hotel is also centrally located, right between the Loop and River North, and so while I would prefer a similar location on the river closer to the El, this is probably the next best thing, since you could walk over to the Navy Pier in less than 30 minutes, or across the river into the Loop in less than 30 minutes, or up to Streeterville or the Mag Mile in less than 30 minutes, etc. Plus you never have to wait for a cab, everytime we just walked out the hotel frontdoor and was able to jump immediately inside a waiting cab. Also, the staff was great. The concierge desk was very helpful, and the bell hops were the best, going above and beyond the call of duty (even helping to get a food delivery order up to our room when we weren't able to be there in time to meet the driver) - the whole staff was great. So my bottom line is, I would definitely stay here again if I got a good price, but otherwise would look for a hotel closer to the El.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay but very nice”
Reviews.Author: jerseyaruba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick Chicago weekend. Nice hotel extremely nice staff. Very helpful. Great view of the lake and river. 2 blocks to Navy Pier and 2 blocks to the magnificent mile. Staff was very nice and you felt they genuinely wanted to help you and make sure you had a great time and stay Would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “redemption”
Reviews.Author: JulesfromIowa
Reviews.Content: This very busy hotel has redeemed itself in my eyes. Parking was more efficient this time, the rooms were spotless, staff was attentive and the views were awesome. The best part of the stay this time around was breakfast. While on the expensive side, the 3-station full breakfast buffet was outstanding. The pasty chef offers some of the best breakfast pastries and breads I have had since Paris. The hotel was totally sold out and luggage lined the hallways near "left luggage,: But the only waiting we did was for a taxi. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located 4-star property in need of modernisation”
Reviews.Author: sonnywaheed
Reviews.Content: Is it me, or is there something wrong with chicago hotels? For some reason, even the most solid of hotel brands just seem to drop the ball when it comes to Chicago. The hilton (overlooking grant park, is less a hotel and more an oversized shabby motel, and let;s not get started on the Hard Rock). But enough about them, onto the Sheraton! Located just a few block for Chicago's shopping mecca (the Magnificent Mile) on one side and Navy Pier and dthe lake on the other, this is a nicely located property. Add to that, the the property is on a small 'dead end' road (only used to access the hotel), it's also wonderfully quiet for a city centre property. That said, for a 4 star property, it's let down by some very dated design and an odd layout (with such hard to find signage, that you're always asking for directions). The Good: - the bed was decent, both in size and firmness. - The room was a very decent size and appropriately appointed (hooray, an iron and ironing board in the closet, desk, louge chair etc.) - The food was pretty good too. it was average 'bistro' fair, burgers, steaks, pasta etc. but tasted good and well presented. - interactive touchscreen tables in the lobby where you can play computerised games of chess or draughts (checkers). Great fun. The Not So Good - The hotel Lobby was unusually dark and looked rather dated - The bathroom could have come from any motel; it was functional but no 'design' had gone in to making it comfortable or welcoming - 70' marble effect counter tops, brown tiling, lino flooring; felt rather shabby - although the bedroom was appropriately appointed and had a comfotable bed, it was not an inviting room and looked like you'd stepped back into the 70s (sorry, I keep harking on about the dated quality of the hotel) - No Wifi in the hotel rooms, thought there was ethernet connectivity (useless if, like me, you now rely on an iPad when travelling) - Free Wifi in the lobby areas was great, except the signal was only strong on the floors below (coffee shop) and above (conference centre); so sitting in the lobby, you had to really struggle to get a connection. - Signage was poor; there's a lovely coffee shop on the floor below the lobby, a great burger restaurant on the floor below that a nice little 'hotel shop', oddly located in the entrance to the 'conference' area etc. Some nice concessions, but you'd be hard pushed to realise this stuff was there. Summary This is by no means a bad hotel, but for a 4-star property in a major US city, it really needs to lift itself up. I'd stay there again, but only if I was getting a really good deal

Reviews.Title: “We will be back ----”
Reviews.Author: TeaTrip
Reviews.Content: Great location. Worth the extra for the club level upgrade. Nice breakfast/happy hour and fantastic views. Plenty of choices to eat within the hotel and local area. Easy access to several tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalRE007
Reviews.Content: Was here for a graduation. Good location. The hotel is central to a number of sites. Much better value than other hotels in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Average”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2TwinsPlusOne
Reviews.Content: I normally use Tripadvisor as a valuable and honest resource and have yet to be disappointed. Unfortunately I had to stay at this hotel due to a conference. I must say I was a bit disappointed. I really didn't expect very much and I got just that. Most of the employees I encountered were not very friendly nor hospitable. Certainly not an atmosphere of "above and beyond". More like "I'm here to collect a paycheck". There were two exceptions... Lanelle or Lanette (sorry-not exactly sure which) was very friendly and seemed genuinely invested. She cared if I enjoyed my stay. She is a housekeeper. Sandra at the front desk made an effort and accommodates my special request, which was refreshing in comparison. The rooms are dated and dingy which would have been easier to overlook had the staff been more pleasant. Great location and views. All in all, a little more concentration on true guest service and hospitality would have made a difference. Which is my point... This hotel does not stand out. No DIFFERENCE. Given another chance, I would use TA to find location, view, better rooms AND hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: jennifermkeck
Reviews.Content: The service at this Sheraton was incredible. Chief Experience Officer Danita was great, and allowed us to check in a few hours early. Even though it was incredibly busy, we only waited about 3 minutes to check in, and the staff were more than accommodating. They even allowed us to leave our bags at the hotel after checkout the next morning while we walked around the city. The only thing that wasn't 5 star were the bathrooms - the paint job was not great, and there were some areas of the walls that were peeling. Also, it is kind of strange to have to pay to use their wireless internet. Other than that - great!We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: pra59
Reviews.Content: Right on the river a short distance from Michigan Ave. Great amenities with several restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kristen3218
Reviews.Content: Very affordable for location and amenities. Within walking distance to Navy Pier. After late night in Chicago, got room service, which was delicious and easy. Use underground parkade across from NBC Tower, is about half the price of the parkade beneathe the Sharaton. Room was clean and comfortable. Would definately stay here again because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “EMBARASSMENT”
Reviews.Author: Paige52
Reviews.Content: Front Desk manager not willing to admit mistake: Manager leaves nasty message regarding declined credit card. According to bank, hotel was entering invalid expiration date, which is why charges were being declined. When customer tried to explain this to front desk manager, manager kept insisting customer provide another form of payment. Customer told manager there was nothing wrong with card, and requested rude manager submit the charges again with the correct expiration date, manager disappears in back for 10/15 minutes, finally returns stating charges have been authorized. Should not have gone this far, when customer is spending their hard earned moneyâ€¦.listen!! The military may not bring the money that the general public brings, however, the money is just as green and spends just as well. How many other guest has this happened to, who did not question the matter? The hotel is wonderful, the overall staff is great, magnificent/outstanding. However, one over zealous employee ruined my last few days there. In a hotel of this caliber, this should never be allowed to happen!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: soxfan05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Chicago to celebrate an anniversary and planned a long weekend May 20-23. Before the trip, I received an e-mail from Danita, the chief experience officer at Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers asking if there was anything she could do to make our visit more comfortable. I e-mailed her saying that it was our anniversary and could she arrange for a room on of the highest floors overlooking Lake Michigan and also recommend the name of a local florist. She immediately wrote back saying she could accomodate my request and when we arrived the room was on the highest floor, the 34th with an terrific view of Lake Michigan. Also she sent up a delicious plate of dipped strawberries with a large bottle of Evian water. I contacted the florist she recommended and the flowers were excellent. Also, when we checked in, the front desk clerk, upon learning we were there to celebrate our anniversary, gave us breakfast coupons for full breakfasts each of the three days of our stay. I've stayed in many hotels over the years and this one was excellent as was the service!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overrated”
Reviews.Author: blevine3
Reviews.Content: This is not what I call a 4-star hotel. My room's furniture was old and shabby. The thermostat was ancient and clumsy. The lunchtime dining room was closed by 2 pm. My only remaining choice was a poor fast-food burger joint in the basement with food served on paper plates, styrofoam cups, and plastic utensils. I tried reaching room service twice that evening to have dinner served in the room. Both times I sat on voice mail for an interminable period.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend visit - but packed with conventioneers!”
Reviews.Author: marmtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend to go to a Cubs game and visit family and friends. We were very pleased on arrival - front desk staff couldnâ€™t have been nicer, noting we were SPG members and thanking us for our stay even though we booked a low rate through Hotwire and werenâ€™t in the SPG system for this stay. Our room was ready when we arrived on a Friday morning at 10am, so we were happy to be able to drop our things, do a little work, and freshen up before the game. The room overlooked the city with a sliver of Navy Pier visible in the distance, though the weather was so foggy we hardly saw it all weekend. Rooms with two double beds were comfortable enough, though a hotel of this quality should really have two-queen rooms instead. Bathroom was old with standard fixtures â€“ didnâ€™t feel like a four-star hotel bathroom, honestly â€“ but was clean. Room overall was fine but there seemed to be a layer of dust on everything â€“ housekeeping could definitely be more thorough. â€œSweet Sleeperâ€� beds were as comfortable as advertised and we all slept very well. Big-screen flat screen TV was great, but the clock-radio was old-style with no iPod dock. There was a party going on in the room next door to us on one of the nights and we heard some noise but it definitely could have been worse. There were several conventions in the hotel while we were there, so the huge lobby was always hopping. There are a couple of â€˜game tablesâ€™ with built-in video games â€“ including old school games like checkers â€“ that were declared the highlight of the place by the youngest member of the party. We didnâ€™t even notice the internet cafÃ© on the bottom floor until our last day when we were permitted to print our boarding passes there for free â€“ looked like a good place if you needed to jump online for a few minutes but I donâ€™t know what the fee is. In-room internet was $12.95/day, I think, so we used the hotspot in our smartphone instead. Overall, totally fine for a weekend stay, and would probably be great for a convention. Weâ€™ve stayed at other hotels in the neighborhood that are more suited for families but had problems finding a good rate for this weekend, so the Sheraton did just fine. We didn't rent a car until the last day when we left to visit people in the suburbs and go to the airport because at $49/night, parking was much too much. It's just a few blocks from public transportation which was just fine. The hotel is just a few blocks from our favorite breakfast spot West Egg Cafe, and we visited Sue the Dinosaur at the Field Museum while we were there, too.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a great location and a beautiful view this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: kateChicagoSuburbs
Reviews.Content: My adult daughters and I make a annual trip into the city to enjoy our beautiful city and spend time with each other. Although there are many hotels to choose from, I seem to always come back to the Sheraton. We love that it is within walking distance to Michigan Avenue shopping, Navy Pier, Millennium Park and the Art Institute. This year we were participating in a walk at Diversey Harbor. We were concerned about being back in time for check-out but the hotel graciously granted us a late check-out which worked out perfectly for us. *****Other noteworthy amenities---our amazing view and an extremely comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth it”
Reviews.Author: macstars24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. It looks fine. I was actually surprised a hotel of their size would not have 24 hour room service. The front desk staff are not really helpful, kind of snobbish, and really could not care about the guests. A walk in reservation ended up being really frustrating and us having to actually call on the phone to make the reservation, in front of the front desk rep. We would have stayed elsewhere if it weren't for the fact our friends were staying there - a popular world musician from Ghana. I was able to find hotels for way less at nicer properties. We actually tried to stay another night, on a Sunday and our rate more than doubled, and the desk staff again were dismissive, unhelpful and unwilling to help. I understand, its convention season, but they didn't even use that as a reason. We moved to a better property and finished the rest of our stay. I actually wrote a letter to Sheraton, and got a response back from the service team saying they would have the hotel contact me. I'm still waiting. I don't anticipate hearing anything. There are tons of 1,000 room hotels in the city that provide excellent service around the clock from all departments. I would recommend staying there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: akrontraveler325
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton over Easter weekend with family. Hotel has a beautiful lobby. The room was perfectly acceptable and the beds were super comfortable! The bathroom could have used some improvements, but there were no major issues. Watch out for the $5 bottles of water that are left in your room. They also charge for internet access in your room - I just went to the lobby to take advantage of the free wifi. The hotel has several on-site restaurants, a couple of which were closed "unexpectedly" for the duration of our stay. I would have liked to try them out. Overall, it was a nice stay, but did not exceed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: anchmer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for one night as a result of Hotwire. The location is somewhat central, but just a few blocks away from being as central as many other hotels in Chicago. The lobby and public area of the building is very nice - not as overwhelming as the Hyatt across the river. The room was acceptable - firm mattress, Starbucks coffee, cable TV. The bathroom was somewhat out of date, and you could hear people in the hallways and ajoined rooms. When I left there wasn't anyone to help me hail a taxi - I had to do that myself. Overall it was perfectly acceptable, but nothing special. I would stay here again if the price was right, but would perfer to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Airpower2008
Reviews.Content: 5/8/11...Lobby service was good, but that's about it. Room service menu is weak. Housekeeping services were below avg. (water left in ice bucket multiple days, paint chipping off ceiling light in bathroom, bathroom with dim lighting, carpet not vacummed, ETC). Pillows are too soft or too hard (tried them both). Below standards compared to other city based Sheraton's. The 28th floor is overdue for reinovation. Other guests on other floors mentioned the same experiences. Avoid this one. There are many hotels in Chicago and Sheraton does not seem to want to compete.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Gem in the Heart fo Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gamgirl31
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel. Neat pool area with a balcony around the corner for tanning. They had some nice high end spa offerings as well. We were close to everything we wanted to go to or at least within walking distance. We ate at Chicago Burger company and sat in the outside seating are right by the river. Great food. We had a nice size room but sleeping our family of 5 was a little challenging since they would not bring us an extra cot.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and warm experience”
Reviews.Author: nettework
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival at midnight from a long tedious day of travel, I was greeted by registration staff who honored my request by giving me a fantastic corner room with a city/lake view. From that initial experience I felt welcomed, respected and valued as a customer. I then had the pleasure of becoming acquainted with a housekeeping person who was responsible for maintaining my room for two days over the weekend by providing the best housekeeping services (along with those service providers who followed her). However, she stood out because she paid attention to some of the room details that most travelers take for granted. There were remnants of grout on my and some of the other 20th floor bathroom floors - apparently not cleaned up by workers as a result of recent tub/shower work. This person took the time to clean and remove the residue from the floors - an act that made me regard her highly and appreciate her attention to care. Quality service and personable staff interactions really matter to me. In addition to the outstanding service of these two exceptional women, LB's Cafe's friendly staff, and other pleasant and professional hotel personnel who I encountered during conference dining and receptions, I can honestly report that I had a great time, in spite of the weather, and will continue to support and recommend Sheraton Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Compliments to Your Staff”
Reviews.Author: mrcskids
Reviews.Content: Danita Harth Chief Experience Officer (CEO) Thanks for the e-mail. I had intended on contacting the Sheraton regarding my stay. Upon arriving in Chicago for the firefighters conference I was made aware of the fact that I did not a reservation for your hotel. This is something that have never happen with me. I been attending these conference for over twenty (20) years with the last twelve (12) as the regional Sargent-at-arms. Needless to say I needed to be at the conference. I spoke with the manager on duty, Maria I believe. She saw to it that I was accommodated and was able to attend the conference. The reason I am writing it to let you know how grateful I am for her assistance. I am a person that complains when something is not taken care of. At this time I would like to let you know that your staff should be given a compliment. Carl G. Cunningham Life is wonderful, enjoy each day to the fullest!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WOO_HOO_lets_travel
Reviews.Content: I found some of the staff not very knowledgeable of the area and tourist places and asking for walking directions to them. They would always offer a taxi and look at me wired when I would ask for walking instructions or how to get to train station. The front desk manager was really not knowledgeable at all. I asked her about my invoice from the stay she really she didnâ€™t seem to care that we were there and kind of gave us some answer that we still do not understand. We also asked her where the Drake hotel was, which we were told was a famous hotel in Chicago, she did not know and kind talked her way out of showing us. She had a computer and could have looked it up on the internet where it was located. Sunday our room never got cleaned. The maid came at 4 pm to clean; however, we were already in our room from the day. We advised her to come back in one hour as we would out of our room attending the Chicago and Vancouver hockey game and the maid said I would be off at that time

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: TripleLee3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came into the city to celebrate his birthday. We received an email from their CEO (Chief Experience Officer) a few days beforehand. I mentioned it was for a birthday celebration. She was wonderful and upgraded our room to a suite without asking! They also had chocolate dipped strawberries and a card signed by the staff (whom we never met before) in our room. My husband was very touched. And don't get me started on those beds. They are HEAVENLY!! We would have stolen our mattress set and taken it home if we could fit it on the train.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sianilaa
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance to some top attractions such as Michigan Ave and the John Hancock Centre. Lovely comfortable, clean rooms. Friendly and helpful staff - I was given a free upgrade to a suite! The breakfast buffet in the LB bistro was AMAZING. I could not really fault this hotel to be honest!

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Visit”
Reviews.Author: Law0407
Reviews.Content: After having a wonderful experience at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers in December of 2010, my wife and I visited the hotel again in April. Again, we were very impressed with the staff's attentiveness and the level of service. We stayed in a "Chicago suite", which connects two bedrooms and one living room in between. Since we were travelling with friends, this was an absolutely perfect set-up giving each couple a private bedroom along with a mutual living area to socialize. Our particular suite was located on a club level floor. We took advantage of both the evening appetizer service and the morning breakfast and were again impressed at the quality and diversity of the food in the club lounge. These floors are evidently very popular, as the lounge was busy during both our visits, but the staff does an excellent job keeping things well-stocked and clean. The location of this hotel can't be beat - it's within a healthy walking distance from many major attractions and just off of Michigan Ave. After another positive experience at the Sheraton, we will definitely return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Lamp5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sherton Hotel and Tower over Valentine's Day this year. We were in town for his birthday/romantic getaway and the hotel upgraded us to Club Level when we mentioned that! The room was a corner room so it had 2 windows with separate views of the city. Navy Pier is really pretty at night! We loved the room, the Club Level Lounge was great because we were able to grab a great breakfast and snacks and even a midnight snack as they had cookies out late at night! :) The bed was SO comfortable, the room was very clean, and room service was promptly around each morning. We would definetely stay again as it was close enough to walk everywhere. The concierge was helpful too in guiding us where we wanted to go and letting us know about little shortcuts to get too and from.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: lynn0101
Reviews.Content: Usual Sheraton comfortable beds and everything you would normally find at this class hotel. Lcoation was great but itt is worth rating as I felt the staff were exceptional. They just went above and beyond - staff throughout - reservation staff were incredibly friendly and full of hints on the city (and this is when I was booking), guest services so friendly, ...... I stay at hotels often for business but this one just really was one class above all because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen_1418
Reviews.Content: The beds were nice, but the rest of the room was average. There's a week wifi signal in the lobby and the internet cafe, otherwise they charge $13 a day for wired internet in the room. $20 per stay to use the small fitness center, which doesn't have enough room or enough machines. The pool is free, but there's no hot tub. The cheapest breakfast in the bistro was $16 for 2 eggs, 1 meat, potatoes, and toast. Premade Sandwiches are $9.50. Parking is $35 a day. The conference facilities are spread over 4 floors, with escalators to get between floors.

Reviews.Title: “The Epitome of Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler83
Reviews.Content: The only person I would suggest this hotel to is a business travel looking for absolutely no frills. The front desk staff are slow. The bellmen and luggage storage folks are rude, inconsiderate and carry a sense of entitlement for gratuity, as if they deserve no less than $5 for luggage, making rude noises at anything less. Room service was cold, dry, rushed, and only half delivered, sans any condiments. The gym is miserably small for such a large hotel, no cardio machines are ever available between 6 and 8 am, not to mention tucked away in the back of the sales office, making your treck slightly uncomfortable. There is nothing near this hotel, save the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean hotel, nice bed.”
Reviews.Author: daisyi295
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went over the weekend and I called ahead to ask for a nice room high with a view. We arrived an hour early, our room was ready and it was a suite on the top floor with concierege priveleges! There were free hourderves in the evening and continental breakfast in the morning, need only leave a tip to the hostess. We didn't use the pool or go to any restaurants on site, but all looked pretty nice. Walked to Navy Pier and Millenium Park! Hint-if you only want to pay 26 dollars a day for parking, rather than the higher price the hotel charges-go to the parking garage under the hotel on the corner! First time in Chicago for us both and the Magnificent Mile is just a block over from the hotel. Also, if going to the zoo, good idea to get a day pass for the train/bus and it takes you right there! Had the Chicago Dog from America's Dog on Navy Pier, Deep dish pizza from Lou Malnottis and Geno's east, and the Al's #1 Italian Beef---(by far my favorite of the bunch-it was dipped in au jus-yummy).

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Advisor415
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Walking distance to Movies, Bowling, Parks, just across from NBC and nearby a grocery store; a pretty convenient location -Reservations said check-in was a 3pm, but checked me in anyway when I arrived much earlier at noon -Large hotel, so probably always vacancy -Large, nice lobby area with plenty of seating -Restaurants had potential, but I didn't try them -Bed and bedding was a B+ -Convenient and affordable for work travel Cons: -Once upstairs out of lobby, halls and rooms really need a remodel -Terrible sounding and slow plumbing - both toilet and shower -Even worse sounding plumbing when the neighbor flushes -Shower poured out of tub spout and hardly out shower head -Wallpaper peeling and vents rusted -When I arrived, neighbor had old room service outside of their room in hall. I left for several hours and when I returned later in the afternoon it was still there -No amenities beyond a flat screen TV, 1990's hairdryer, iron, and coffee maker (if you consider those amenities) -Thin walls/door. Anytime a neighbor left their room it sound like they slammed their door and you could hear their conversations clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay Was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mncarguy1
