Reviews.Content: Just got back from our weekend in Chicago. We stayed two nights and had no issues. All of our small requests were fulfilled (early check-in, room with a view on a higher floor). Great location, staff was friendly and room was clean. To make this a fair review the only minor complaints would be hotel bar was just ok and breakfast was tasty but a little pricey. Overall would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bobbasic
Reviews.Content: If you take a trip to Chicago, definitely consider staying here. I have stayed in various hotels throughout Chicago over 2 years and this was my favorite hotel because of the staff, location, and overall value. Below are the highlights: Staff -- Extremely helpful and knowledgeable. It's been a year since I regularly stayed in this hotel and the doorman remembered who I was. The front desk staff was efficient and courteous. We were flying in to meet family and friends so I just found Danita's email and asked for her help. She was amazing and professional throughout the entire process. In a hotel with a thousand rooms she provided bed and breakfast quality attention. Location -- Perfect location to easily get around Chicago. Walking distance to some of our favorite restaurants (Volare, Quartino, West Egg Cafe, Yolk), Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, and even a free shuttle bus to a casino! Rooms/Facility -- The beds were very comfortable and even better than I remember. They had just replaced them when I was leaving. The bars and restaurants in the hotel are convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: sekai888
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased in choosing the right hotel for a 5-day conference/trade exhibit. Right at the moment where the doorman welcomes my stay till the bellboy who placed my 2 luggage in the room I can very well say I did the right decision. I had put on request for an early check in at 11:00am ( usually check in is 3pm onwards). I did rang the night before but was told it was impossible to have an early check in since they have a fully booked occupancy but WILL TRY THEIR BEST TO ACCOMODATE ME. Anyhow - I did try my luck the following morning and alas - my KING SIZE bed room was ready - speaking of service. I don't always believe on ' we will try our best' thing not until this experience with Sheraton Chicago. Choosing amongst the numerous good hotels in Chicago is not easy. The location is also pretty privy as it is not really along Michigan Ave but still a pleasant walking distance to the main M Ave. I have no complain overall. Will be recommending this highly to my colleague and mates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pokemom
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about this hotel. They let us check in early when we arrived at 8am. The concierge gave us a premium pass to get in at YOLK restaurant. The bedding was so soft and comfortable. BE AWARE they do charge for any and all extras (even things that may not be considered extra at other hotels, like internet, the fitness room and a bottle of water sitting invitingly on the end table.) We knew this going in though, so were prepared. There is a Walgreens and movie theater across the street, and it is within walking distance to many things (we walked everywhere in my report, but it was a lot of walking.) From our window we could watch them dye the river green for St. Pats Day. A bonus we did not expect. Such fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nleflore
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to visit Chicago for a day to get away, so we made reservations prior using our priority points for a 1 king deluxe room. When we got to the hotel we were told that the only room they had available was an accessible room. Then the girl told us the rooms are first come first served. I didn't use my priority points to stay in an accessible room and neither one of us are handicapped. I could have easily booked at another hotel in the downtown area and used my points there and got a nicer room if they would have contacted me to tell me thats all they had available and were honest.. Then we didn't get any sleep because the walls were paper thin with a family next door that could not control their kids from screaming and slamming doors. We could also hear the people using the toilet and running water. The next morning I talked with another representative about my experience when we checked out and the story he gave us was we checked in to early and that room was the only one available (remind you... we didn't get there till late Saturday night), so how did we check in before 3pm???? That made me think they gave our room to someone else and tried to cover it up.... We were just straight lied to and I am reporting this issue because that was really wrong and not fair for us to use our points on an accessible room....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mauigal06
Reviews.Content: General feeling of neglect from the moment you arrive â€“ a doorman too busy texting to help with luggage or even open the front door. However, I arrived late at night and simply wanted a bed â€“ hoping things would improve in the daylight. I was not on a â€œclubâ€� floor and was staying for business. The good: location, within walking distance of all the major attractions; helpful concierge desk. The bad: The room was simply dirty - three inches of dirt on the carpet edges; mould and rust stains in the plugged drain tub; dust over every surface in the room. Facelift required: squeaky fan in bathroom, peeling wallpaper, rust stains, cheap and impossible to straighten lampshades, holes in curtains, no in-room wireless internet, no provision for recycling. The ugly: Hair on the ceiling of the bathroom, unknown stains on the bedding, poor soundproofing and old doors that slam constantly as people move in and out of rooms, housekeeping staff who loudly knock at 10:30 am on every door on the floor to make sure people are checking out at 11:00 giving no consideration to quiet for those who are not, 30 minutes promised by in-room dining = 65 minutes and cold. Overall disappointing hotel - look elsewhere for better options.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: readams50
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Sheraton. My favorable impressions began when I called the night befor our arrival. The weather report for travel between home and Chicago included a travel advisory. I called to ask if I could cancel the morning we were to arrive in the event snow prvented us from reaching Chicago. The staff person was very helpful and said in the event of weather it would not be a problem. The second event of note was,while attending conferences my wife was shopping in the area. A shallow coat of snow had covered the sidewalks and streets. She stepped in a snow filled chuck hole tripped and fell. My wife returned to our room. A staff person was in our room cleaning . Seeing my wife covered with slush and a bruised and bleeding knee. She offered to get her help and took a hand cloth from her cart to help her clean her knee. The hotel the building is wonderful but the workers make it very special.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: mulligan44
Reviews.Content: All I can say is avoid this place at all costs. From the reservations assistant (who took 45 minutes to book a room) to check out (they billed my card for 750 dollars) and getting a refund (numerous voicemails and emails no one returned my call). AVOID AVOID AVOID a truely hideous experieince I will never stay at a Starwood resort again, and given I stay in a hotel 4 or 5 days a week this is a big statement!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: oldwatertower
Reviews.Content: This first class hotel commanding stunning architectural views over the city and lake was a perfect, relaxing place to stay and made our visit to Chicago. Conveniently located just a step-away from the busy city hubbub and situated beside the waterway within a short walking distance of shops, galleries, museums, etc. Friendly staff at every level and a very comfortable, well-appointed room with coffee always available. We chose a tariff to include breakfast and would highly recommend this option which also included delicious complimentary evening hors d'oeuvres, what a bonus! Excellent hotel and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: CK1717
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four days and it was a wonderful trip. Our room had an amazing view of the Chicago River and the bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel. We were fortunate enough to be able to get a Club Level room and I strongly suggest anyone staying there to do they same if they are able too. The mini bar in the room is expensive, $4 for a candy bar or can of soda, but if you are staying at the Club Level, you get complimentary soda and bottled water through out the day. Also, you get complimentary snacks during the evening, and breakfast in the morning. The hotel normally charges around $12.95 for internet, but this is also free for Club Level guests. If you can afford the extra $ to upgrade to Club Level, it is definitely worth it. Also if you park at the self parking garage located underneath the hotel, you will save about $15 per day.My husband and I had a wonderful time and we will definitely stay there they next time we are in Chicago..

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kavlee89
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Feb for a gymnastics competition. We normally stay at the Marriott but decided to try the Sheraton instead. What a disappointment. When we checked into our first room, we were taken aback at how dirty it was. Sure it looked like the maid had been there but there was stuff on the carpet and garbage under the beds. Upon looking in the bathroom there was still some hair in the tub!!! I did call the front desk to complain. To their credit they moved us to a different room. This room was better but I wouldn't call it really clean....I would call it acceptable. This hotel really needs a face lift done to their rooms and improve their cleaning staff. We are Starwood members but sadly I can say we will not be returning to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline, and they had it listed as a four-star hotel. In my opinion, it is not. The rooms are along the line of a holiday inn express -- nothing special. My TV was not working correctly and I must have pressed a button that registered a 'miscellaneous charge (adult movie)' for $17. I told the front desk about it and they didn't really care. Also, I took a shower in about 4 inches of standing water each day because the drain was so slow. I heard other travelers complaining about their rooms, too. It's also not particularly close to any sort of nightlife. There's a few grocery stores and one restaurant within walking distance, but other then that, expect to cab it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to hold a business reception”
Reviews.Author: karenking84
Reviews.Content: Our business recented had a holiday party for our employees at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. This is the second year we hosted a reception and then a night stay for our employees and their families. The evening started at the Chi Bar for drinks and starters. The Chi Bar has an absolute great locaton with views of the river and the lake. From the scheduling and planning to the day of the event all the employees of the Sheraton provided us with excellent professional service. Two months later and I am still getting compliments from my staff on what a great time they had at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: meganbeth4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and my son (14 yrs. old) last February for 2 nights. Great location, value and view. We were able to quickly get into town, get a taxi and sightsee and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary Ruined due to overcharges”
Reviews.Author: cindyg18
Reviews.Content: If you are lower to middle class and looking to have a good weekend don't come here!!! They put charges on our debit card that we did not authorize which put a damper on our good times we could have had if we had our money accessible. The only explanation being, it is our policy. They did not offer to make our stay any better in any way. We spent the last of our time in the room with not enough money to do the things we wanted. I actually cried I was so upset and miserable! The maids were the only ones with any compassion! The only good thing to say about the whole experience is the beds are quite comfortable and the 1 meal we had at Don Shula's was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “this was the best hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: chefskott
Reviews.Content: there were so many helpful people at this location. We came her in the middle of valentine weekend and got a room no problem and were treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service is Still Alive and Well in this World”
Reviews.Author: Devodev
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business with my spouse and we were thoroughly satisfied with the service we received. The location was excellent with many activities in walking distance (and the temperature was in single digits during our stay). There were even various restaurants in the hotel so if necessary, travelers would not have to leave the hotel. Everyone from the receptionist to the valet treated us wonderfully and I'd definitely stay there again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: casualtraveleroregon
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is very nice but after that the place really needs a face lift. The halls and rooms seem really old and run down. Our toilet would run at various times during the night the first night. I had to play with it a number of times to get it to stop. My biggest and complaint however is that after our room was cleaned our room was left open. We had left our room around 11:00am and didn't return until after 9:00pm that night. We returned to find the security lock had been left in the door so it was open the entire time and anyone could have entered the room. I called guest services and all they said was" I'm sorry that happened. Let us know if there is anything missing. I will pass this along to the manager." Luckily nothing was missing but that is beside the point in my opinion. I figured the manager would at least call to follow up, but NO, not a word. I stopped at the front desk the next evening and asked to speak with the manager. She indicated that security should have been involved and come to take a report, etc. I said nothing like that happened, it was if the person I spoke to first didn't even care and that is what I told the manager. It was almost as if this type of thing happened frequently. She offered to give me a credit for breakfast...biggie...we were leaving the next morning by 5:30am....no time for breakfast. I told her I wouldn't be able to recommend this hotel to anyone. She didn't really seem to care. I'm sure she figured my recommendation wouldn't matter in the scheme of things. She did finally agree to credit my account $50. Still the feeling that they don't care is still there. Just beware if you stay that your items may not be secure!

Reviews.Title: “watch for these little tips”
Reviews.Author: hubspapuis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the older side compared to the nearby hotels. The bathroom is just average nothing out of the ordinary Be ready to pay close to $13/ day for Internet connection in your room. Parking is $49/ night

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: katyano
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Sheraton the end of January 2011 for two nights. It was busy with the football game taking place that weekend. Room was nice, sufficient, clean. Nothing extraordinary but comfortable with great views. Lobby was very pretty with nice lounging and sitting areas. Super location, wonderful views from some areas and of course depending on the season. A very large hotel with nice amenities. Would definitely recommend this Sheraton if you get it for the right price and want a large hotel, elegant lobby and spaces, comfortable but a little better than average room, convenience and amenities within a hotel. Staff was very cordial and pleasant even when busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay... Dark Room”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night. The line at check in was long and slow. They did eventually bring in another desk clerk which made a huge difference. The woman at check in was very pleasant and gave us a king room on the 31st floor. The lobby is very nice. There are plenty of comfortable chairs and a lounge off to the left side. There is a table with touch screen checkers. I saw several people playing during my stay. The room was very nice. The bed was very comfortable with soft sheets and a down comforter. It was also very quiet. We were near the elevators but never heard anyone. We had a nice view of the Chicago River and could see Lake Michigan in the distance. The drawback of the room is very poor lighting. The bathroom was very dark. I turned the light on in the hall and it didn't help at all. There is a makeup mirror in the bathroom but it attached very high on the wall and does not tilt down. I am 5'7 and had crane my neck to really see myself. Whoever designed that must have been at least 6' tall. The toiletries in the bathroom were nothing special. The shampoo, conditioner soap and lotion did not really have a scent to them. They reminded me of something you would find in a Holiday Inn Express. I thought that because this is a higher end hotel that the products would be really nice. Not so. We were very glad that we did not drive to Chicago. Parking is $49.00 per night. How ridiculous. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bris00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, I have never stayed in such a dirty hotel before. We had to change rooms 3 times and still could not find a clean room. The bathroom smelt like urine that had been in a toilet for weeks, the basin and counter tops were covered in hair. The bedding had dirty marks and black hairs between the sheets... The rooms was extremely dusty and we cringed in the room. I would honestly rather sleep on a park bench before staying at this hotel again. The staff were very apologetic when we complained, but that did not help the fact that this is an old, worn out and filthy hotel. I would not recommend this to anyone who has any standards when it comes to comfort and cleanliness...

Reviews.Title: “Worn, Dated and Dirty Hotel past its heyday”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times for a conference. Each year it gets worse. This year, the room was filthy. There was a dirty napkin in the made bed, the shower had hair in it. Every day there were housekeeping problems (no soap, missing towels, etc.). The rooms are worn and dated (from the 90's) and this place is in desperate need of better service and remodeling. If this wasn't the only place to stay for thisannual conference, I would stay elsewhere. Note: Banquet food was good, but temperature control in meeting rooms was a problem -bring a sweater.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, big water views, convenient to conventions at Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the comfortable spacious room and clean bathroom. Quiet, high floor, wide open view of the water and the pier. Location was a huge plus: short cab ride less than 5 minutes to my work/convention needs at Navy Pier, also convenient to Michigan Avenue shopping (without having to contend with the traffic and crowds), and good areas nearby for restaurants. Lots of cabs coming by and I never had to wait long. Lacked in-room free internet with Vegas prices of $12 per 24 hours which was not nice for a business trip requiring lots of emailing and etc. in morning and evening. Had to sit downstairs in the hallway near their coffee shop to get online without a charge. In-room safe was laughably small and would not fit a laptop or a large camera.

Reviews.Title: “Standard big-city Sheraton with great lounge”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4th of July weekend. This is a fairly standard big-city Sheraton. The suite we were upgraded to as Platinum members was one of the largest I've had. It was literally big enough to get lost in. Breakfast at the club lounge was good, but especially good were the fresh-baked cookies in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: kimboslice90
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't have had my Christmas any other way! It was a very romantic setting. Our room had a view of the river ending at the lake and spectacular city views. Every staff member that we encountered was very friendly and informative! We went to P.J. Clark's for dinner as they were the only restaurant open on Christmas and I enjoyed it very much. Their soaps smell delicious :) I have nothing else to say except that I will be repeat business!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service from Beginning to End on New Years”
Reviews.Author: pattyatips
Reviews.Content: This hotels service is among the worst I have ever experienced. When I booked our room, I booked a double for my husband, myself and our two teenage children on the club level. We booked a room with a river or lake view and it stated this on the confirmation as well as the fact that there were four people. When we checked in they did not have a room with two doubles, only a king, so now my very tall teenagers were to be on rollouts. OK......we will deal with this. Then we check into the room and there is no view at all except for the top of the building next to us. When my husband went down to change rooms, Dave, the front desk manager told us "we have nothing else, that is the only room available for you." When my husband further explained that we had a confirmed reservation he stated, "sir, I have 25 other people in the same situation." No apology, no offer of anything else, nothing at all. It was New Years Eve so I understand the hotel was busy, but as Seinfeld says, "you can take the reservation, you just can't keep the reservation." We had also called several days prior to ensure that the pool would be open new years eve so that the kids had somewhere to be and we were assured it would be. When we checked in, we were then informed that the pool closed at 8PM as did the club lounge, which we were also told would be open. So now were here in the city with no place for the teenagers to be other than the room since there is nothing in the area for anyone under 21 after 9PM. The final straw was upon checkout. We are Starwood Gold members and had received a 50% room coupon in the mail which we intended to use and informed them of this when we booked the reservation. When we checked out, there was not the 50% discount but the full rack rate. Once again, our front desk friend Dave came and told me "take it up with Starwood, there is nothing I can do". Basically he informed me that Starwood jacks up the rates (in this case to well over $500/night) and then takes the 50% discount so now I'm around $240 or so for the night. I could have gotten a better deal just booking on the hotel website as our friends that stayed the same night paid $189/night. The hotel itself is decent, albeit a bit worn, and in a good location. Other than that, there are plenty of other hotels in the area that offer a much higher level of service for the same money. I would not recommend the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good location”
Reviews.Author: g4480
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a great rate at this hotel through priceline. The location was excellent. The rooms were as expected for a hotel of this level. The bed was very comfortable. No Wifi in the rooms but at least it was available for free near the lobby in a computer room with a cafe attached. The room had many new computers and a colour printer. Valet parking is very expensive at $49 which we took when we found out that self parking is still pricey at $38. Overall, a good experience considering the fantastic rate.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Sheraton Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Endymion90
Reviews.Content: Room was your standard well-equipped room, apparently clean but there was quite a layer of dust inside the lampshades on the spiral light bulbs and black dirt or bugs piled up in the light fixture over the bathtub. Very dim light bulbs. The hotel is in a quiet location, away from the noise of Michigan Avenue traffic. However, I was on a noisy floor full of kids in band uniforms who were going to be in the Thanksgiving Day parade, and they loitered in the hall and were going in and out of rooms, slamming the doors constantly. Also, the heating system was rather noisy. Great south view of the Chicago River and downtown buildings. Handsome, spacious lobby. Inspected the bed and the rest of the room throughly for bedbugs. None to be found. Housekeeping knocked on my door twice the morning I was to check out to find out what time I was leaving. Couldn't understand why there was so much door slamming in the morning. Needless and annoying. This is a convention hotel that caters to large groups, so expect crowds and lines at the desk and the elevators. Front entrance of hotel is often jammed with cars, cabs, buses.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect”
Reviews.Author: shamah
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have housekeeping service at 12pm and when we returned to the room we saw that no one cleaned it. It was very dissapointing because we were 3 people staying in the same room and room was a real mess. Later that night, our toilet stopped flushing and we tried to reach guest services like 5 times. No one picked up the phone. We tried to fixed it ourselves. In addition, it was kind of weird to see no one at front desk when we were wandering around. I think there should be at least one person all the time at the front desk in a big hotel like this one. The lady who checked us out was really slow, and didn't seem that she knows what she is doing, so we didn't take the risk of paying by credit card because we splitted the charges. We just paid cash. Besides, for some reason she had no name tag. But I should add that bellman Mr. Adnan and the Mexican housekeeper that brought us towels that night were very friendly. All in all, I can say that the rooms, the view and general condition of the hotel is good but service should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Law0407
Reviews.Content: My wife and I treated my parents to a weekend in Chicago at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. All four of us were very impressed with our stay. Despite staying on an exceptionally busy weekend, the hotel remained quiet and our sleep was undisturbed. Several of us commented on the quality of the mattresses as well. Also, the rooms were a pleasant size compared with similar Chicago hotels. We really enjoyed the amenities the club floor had to offer. The lounge provided exceptional views of the city and was a nice size. Also, despite being exceptionally busy forboth breakfast and evening appetizers, the staff remained courteous and kept the food and beverages well-stocked. The hotel's location is perfect for those wishing to experience a Michigan Avenue shopping. Several "El" stations, musesums, and parks are also a short walk away. My wife and I are frequent Chicago visitors and will definitely be staying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful winter weekend experience”
Reviews.Author: danhChicago
Reviews.Content: every year our family comes to chicago to enjoy the city during the holidays. Our destination is the winterfest in Daley plaza. even though we live just north in wilmette,we stay in the city as we love it. we stayed at the sheraton hotel and towers and had a truly wonderful experience. though it was very crowded, the staff took the time to make sure we had a great stay. everything from the time the staff took to upgrade our room, to the team member at the pool who got our 7 year old goggles, made our trip great. we got back after dinner with our friends and just relaxed in the lobby. the table top chess game was a great surprise as we all played. we are looking to come back to the city, and now we have a great place to stay. as a starwood member, I have stayed at many properties around the country, including chicago, and even though it is so close to home, it is one of my favorites. we look forward to going back soon dan hastings

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle of the corn field, Illinois
Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: dustyzz75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a very good time. The room was well done and the bed was very comfortable. Addiontal bonus, at least for us, the pillows were very squishy, can't stand thick/firm pillows. So there's that. The location is on the north side of the river and the south end of the Michigan Avenue area. The hotel is definitely within walking distance to all the shopping and restaurants. If you drive, park in the Oden Plaza garage as it is connected to the hotel. Yes, the rate is $35 for 24 hours, but you aren't going to find anything close for cheaper. We didn't use the pool but we heard it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and location for the price”
Reviews.Author: betonic
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline for a super price so I went into this with very low expectations. When we arrived we were pleased to be assigned a king sized non-smoking room. The front desk clerk offered us several different locations and allowed us to choose. We ended up on a lower floor but at the very corner of the building. The room was small but I expect that from a "city" hotel. The bathroom was clean but could definetly use an upgrade. The bed was very comfortable and that's the most important thing to us. For the price we paid I would stay here again but if I were paying their regular rates I would try some of the other Chicago hotels first. One thing to keep in mind when booking is that the overnight parking is $49!!

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: kevin041
Reviews.Content: from the first time you arrive and meet staff, you are made to feel at home, fast check in, no questions required all services provided, we stayed in club rooms, nice breakfast, free soft drinks during day, good simple supper from 6pm till 8pm, great staff, rooms clean great location, great rooms, comfy beds, what more do you want ? free computers in link cafe in basement, which our youngest appreciated, safe enviroment ,also which is important , all in all a ecellent long weekend away, four nights, would have stayed the week if time permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: geert_hespel
Reviews.Content: As SPG member we like to travel with this hotels, mostly nice, clean and with a big comfort and very good beds. But this time it was a disapointment, old fashioned rooms that need renewal, not the normal kindness and service,... We asked a kingsize bed and did not get it, the bathroom was old and no bath, the electricity needed replacement,... And last but not least, our dinner in Shula's steak house was very expensive and not so good as other diners in Chicago (like in the fantastic CitÃ© restaurant). You best choose anothyer hotel in Chicago for this price !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jlynnrules
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton for Thanksgiving weekend with our 4 young kids. The rooms were great and the staff was very accommodating. I highly recommend this hotel for a family wanting to visit Chicago. It is within walking distance to shopping and the Navy Pier and has a wonderful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent Minibar Charge - Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AndresR_9
Reviews.Content: My experience while at the Sheraton was uneventful; I stayed here while on business for two nights. The location is convenient, the beds were clean, and the front desk agents were courteous - normally qualities of a decent hotel. It wasn't until I went to do my expense report that I was hit with a $40 charge after I had received my invoice at the hotel. When I called the Sheraton's accounting group, I was told that it was a minibar charge. Seeing as how I never even opened the minibar's door, I requested a credit for the charges. After a week's worth of calls and emails, I finally received word I would be credited (Darlene in the Accounting department was extremely helpful) the $40 but only as a customer service courtesy because there were items missing from the inventory. After seeing several customer complaints online about phony minibar charges, I suggest management looks into its cleaning staff or the way they track what's used from their minibar, because it definitely leaves a bad taste in the customer's mouth when they're wrongly charged for items that weren't consumed. Be very wary of staying here; I had a much more pleasant experience at the James Hotel not far from the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Chicago Towers”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelHonolulu
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying here because I thought the location was too far from Michigan Ave then other available hotels. I ended up staying here because we got a good deal through the conference we attended. I am so happy we stayed here; our stay was for 5 days and the service was fantastic from the doorman to the cleaning staff. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the location was perfect. There is a theater, a Walgreens, and many restraunts right outside the main entance. The location ended up being perfect, the shopping on Michigan Ave. was easy to get to, even in the cold. I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great River Views especially during St. Patricks Day”
Reviews.Author: VijayKrishna
Reviews.Content: I went in March 2010. It was very cold and I loved the temperature controlled swimming pool and the sauna in this hotel. The rooms were quite clean and were serviced daily. There were restaurants and a bar. Other than that, it is pretty close to the Michigan Avenue, where you can do all the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy, clean, friendly visit”
Reviews.Author: T_Onick_10
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of finding a deal on a stay at the Sheraton Chicago a block from the Magnificent Mile and tried it for the first time. It was a great visit - it's a very, very nice hotel, and very clean with incredibly comfortable beds, but the best part about the stay was that the staff at the hotel were very helpful and pleasant throughout. We had no problems getting very easy directions to all manner of destinations in the Chicago area, and we found that everyone seemed to be in a good mood - chirpy and witty and sweet from all angles. As a regular traveller, I know that a grumpy or cold staff can rub off on a trip's experiences, and I know that a good staff can improve a trip both logistically and atmospherically. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and classy”
Reviews.Author: choosy10Dover_DE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely clean, feels very safe and is a great location for seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Retro 70's room with questionable service”
Reviews.Author: markbunga
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here..checked in last night, and I normally would wait for my review but this place is really disappointing. First off, I am a Sheraton gold member. Not that I think that is a big deal, but the room I received was retro 70's, with cheetah wallpaper in the bathroom. The king bed was as hard as a rock, and my attempts to get a better room were scoffed off. What can I say, they should at least make clear whether you are paying for a "towers" room (which was what we were led on to receive), or a regular room. In some Sheratons, a towers room is a nice room ala hilton or w. W was fantastic by the way. This room was like a holiday inn. Too expensive for a very sub par room and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Accomodations and Location!”
Reviews.Author: purplejoy63
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers last weekend. We wanted a location that would be within walking distance to Navy Pier so we could enjoy two days at a sculpture show. A few days before our arrival, I received an e-mail confirmation along with the name of a "Chief Experience Officer" who offered to answer any questions I had before our visit. She was extremely helpful with questions I had regarding parking and luggage storage. Our accomodations were very comfortable, and we had a beautiful view of the river. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the comforters were luxurious. All of the employees at the Sheraton were extremely friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the delicious buffet brunch we had on Saturday morning at the LB Bistro. The food was absolutely perfect, the chefs and wait staff were incredibly helpful, and we left the restaurant very satisfied! My meal included an apple pecan crepe with caramel sauce and fresh whipped cream, delicious crisp bacon, fresh fruits, orange juice, fresh squeezed watermelon juice, a peach-ginger smoothie (yum!), and oatmeal creme brulee. There were too many other delicious selections that I didn't have room for (such as omelettes, pancakes, eggs cooked to order, and an amazing selection of baked items - to name just a few!). Friendly service, beautiful and clean accomodations, excellent location! When I'm planning another overnight trip in the Navy Pier area, I know where I'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent service and great location....”
Reviews.Author: Runderberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with our teenage daughters for college visits. The hotel is in a great location...on the river with many rooms with a lake view. Short walk to Michigan Avenue and the Navy Pier. The hotel staff were very friendly and the concierge extremely knowlegable and helpful. Every one we came in contact with asked if they could do anything to make our stay better. We had access to the club lounge which was great for breakfast and evening snacks. A highlight was the warm cookies served to us by the very outgoing and gracious Rene in the Club Lounge. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For a four star hotel, this hotel was a letdown.”
Reviews.Author: gmdavis79
Reviews.Content: With rumors of bedbugs flying amongst travelers (which we did NOT find any at this hotel), I tore that room apart looking for anything and everything. The mattresses were dirty and covered with hair, there were no fitted sheets for the mattresses (which I expect at a 4-star hotel) the bathrooms were outdated, the bathtub did not drain during showers and left me standing in shin-deep water. The lobby is beautiful, but the rooms are very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: beccarette
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with my room at this hotel. The lobby was very nice, but the hallways and rooms were dated and worn. There was a mirror in my room that was broken, and the other furniture and finishings in the room were worn and not as nice as I would have expected for the price. I know the location is right in the city, so you pay for that, but I have stayed at hotels at this price point in Manhattan that are much nicer. This was my first time in Chicago, so I cannot compare it to other options. I did wish I had decided to go with the Marriott down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, lovely views, courteous service and a swimming pool too”
Reviews.Author: mosmommy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located along the river, the view was lovely and the room very quiet. The hotel while heavily book was still well serviced. The staff was courteous and the room very clean. Our daughter loved the swimming pool which is a rarity at hotels downtown and a real treat for the little ones in cold weather. There was a lovely chef in the breakfast restaurant who offered to make our 3 year old mickey mouse pancakes and she was over the moon, it was a nice touch and we really appreciated the extra effort.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: lzzc
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location. It's walking distance to Michigan Ave., navy pier, etc. However the service left a lot to be desired. It took 30 minutes to check in. The first night, my friend and I got a room that had one pull down murphy bed and one sofa bed. Needless to say, the beds were awful in terms of sleep quality. We complained a couple of times and the next night we had a room with two double beds. It took about 3 tries to get our room changed though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and service!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn00
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Chicago Hotel has been one of my favorite hotels in downtown Chicago for several years. When it was time to book our weekend getaway my husband was not surprised that I wanted to stay there for our 10th anniversary weekend. It is ideally located in the Streeterville area right off Michigan Avenue and the service is fabulous. I wanted to surprise my husband with a small version of our wedding cake. I contacted Danita Harth, Director of Rooms and Chief Entertainment Officer, at the Sheraton and asked if they could store the cake overnight and deliver it to our room at 9 PM Saturday night while we were at dinner. She indicated to drop the cake off to her and she would handle it from there. My husband said it was the best surprise I ever did for him. Everything went perfect thanks to the staff at the Sheraton. We had also stopped by the concierge desk to check on the estimated cost of a taxi ride to the restaurant I had chosen to celebrate our anniversary dinner and the concierge provided us with a gift card for the restaurant that covered the cost of our taxi ride. We will definitely be back for another visit to the Sheraton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: dslater826
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my wife here on a business trip of hers, we loved the hotel. The rooms were nice & clean, great matresses. Our view of the Chicago River from the 19th floor was awesome. The lobby is impressive & there are lots of great places within walking distance - Magnificent Mile shopping, the Art Institute of Chicago, Millenium Park, Navy Pier, etc. The only thing preventing a 5-star rating is that the bathrooms were unspectacular - - kind of old & outdated, but no big deal. As always, the room service was outrageous - $35 for a huge french toast breakfast just for myself (which was delicious). Everything was very clean, concierge was great, central location, defintely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Terrible”
Reviews.Author: johnfox1
Reviews.Content: We checked in on the 20th October. I was supposed to have an upgraded room. The room was dark. Three 40 w fluorescent bulbs. Only two worked. Phone not working. Wallpaper falling off the walls and ceiling of the bathroom/ Poor quality towels one with a hole in it. Inadequate number of towels for two guests. After several calls, they sent up another lamp (broken switch, could only be operated by removing it from the socket. They brought more towels. Said they would move us the next day as there were no vacancies of rooms on a high floor with a king bed. (Booked three months ahead. Did move us. Room marginally better. Still inadequate light and the wallpaper was only just beginning to peel. Towels just as bad but more of them. Hotel apologized and took off one room night of our 4 night stay. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The management needs to refurbish this hotel if they want to continue in business. I am a frequent user of Starwood but this is the worst property I have been in for some time

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to be right Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: BlueHeronOakland_MI
Reviews.Content: The hotel had all the right features, including an outstanding consierge desk who provided concise walking instructions for any where you wanted to go. Family friendly, "big city" feel with wonderful beds which was right by the water. Parking is super expensive - but convenient!

Reviews.Title: “This is one great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAMCalgary
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a conference...stayed at this well located hotel. The bed was soooooooooo comfortable and really conducive for a good sleep. We had bagged lunches at our conference and these were nicely presented in Sheraton gift bags. The food was fresh and tasty and really well done for a prepackaged bagged lunch. I was really impressed with the quality of the sandwiches. The hotel staff were very friendly and the concierge extremely knowlegable and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location especially with Chicago Go card 3-day pass.”
Reviews.Author: evilninja
Reviews.Content: 2nd time in chicago ever, and the first time, we actually stayed on the magnificient mile's Westin Hotel, which was fantastic. This time around, stayed off (1 street off Michigan Ave) at the Sheraton Towers, and sort of think it's a little better location. Do get the chicago Go card at smartdestinations.com and the 3 day pass was what was best for me. There is a Greyline tour bus that has a stop right across the hotel, so used that service to shuttle us around the city! Great tour as well ! Westin was on the mile, but I felt this was better located (bottom of the mile). Tons of bars to walk to, and the Red line train wasn't too far either (about 1/2 mile I think). Great view of the Navy Pier as well !

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, great food, super rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sushalpin
Reviews.Content: So far my favorite stay in Chicago. I found everything about this hotel to be above average (even for Sheratons). With all the great food around Chicago, anyone staying here is blessed with some fantastic options right in the hotel. The river walk is steps away from the hotel and there are so many great attractions close by. One great hotel in a great city!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite SPG hotel & one of favorites among all brands in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: boys2enough
Reviews.Content: We live in the Chicago suburbs and we frequently stay in downtown Chicago over the weekend, taking advantage of various hotel deals and loyalty program points. We have stayed at W by the lake, Four Points and Sheraton Chicago (the hotel being reviewed) and hands down, this is the best one. (We have not checked out the Westins because they do not have swimming pools & we have two boys so...) I feel compelled to write a review for Sheraton because I have read some negative reviews by, surprisingly, SPG Platinum members (on TripAdvisor and this "other" website where all the frequent flyers kvetch, you know which website I am referring to...) One person complained so much about the hotel, starting from the bed being awful which caused one other member to say that their company was in the process to move 5 travelers away from the hotel. I have stayed in a lot of SPG hotels, and the beds in this Sheraton are the same as the other Sheratons and are just as comfortable as those in the other SPG hotels, including Westins. (In case you are wondering: we have Tempurpedic at home so yes we have been spoiled...) So I am motivated to restore some justice, I guess. Location: BEST location ever unless you need to stay in the heart of happening Chicago where if you step right out, there is a trendy bar. The hotel is by the river, so you get the view. If you come out of the hotel from the very bottom in the back, there is the riverside walkway: you can head either towards the Mag Mile, cross the bridge and head towards the Millennium Park, Grant Park (& the Art Institute), or Navy Pier. It is always a nice walk by the river in any of these directions. (Please note: I have never stayed in Chicago in the dead of winter, so yes, the experience would be I assume totally different if you are freezing to death. But that is Chicago in the winter...) Convenience: If you have small kids, you'd appreciate the Dominics grocery story and Walgreens just down the street from the hotel. If you crave something fancy, Fox and Obel is not that far away either. And there is a well-stocked wine (liquor) store near by also. The room is nicely-sized. By no means large but the four of us did not feel the urge to murder each other in a room with 2 double beds. i.e. not cramped or claustrophobic. The room was always clean when we stayed there. We have never had any problem with house keeping. The swimming pool/gym area is well appointed. I do NOT work out so I cannot comment on the machines. But whenever I walked by, the area looked clean and well-equipped and in general nice. My family really enjoyed the swimming pool area. Again, it was always clean and there were plenty of clean towels to go around (as opposed to Four Points which is a different story...) NO hot tub would be my only complaint about this hotel. There however is a sauna. But you cannot drink while keeping an eye on the kids in the sauna. Just sayin.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Stanley Lee!”
Reviews.Author: Good2BMe61
Reviews.Content: Mr. Lee and his staff assisted me in locating my cell phone that I left in a cab. In a matter of 30 minutes he located the cab driver and my phone was returned. The staff was very accommodating, the hotel beautiful with a wonderful location on the river and the view of the lake, food very good and the atmosphere is wide open and comfortable anywhere in the hotel and Michigan Avenue is a block away! Thank you Stanley, and thank you Chicago Sheraton! Joyce Vargo Illinois Resident

Reviews.Title: “Great location and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumsb
Reviews.Content: One block from the lake, nightlife, shopping and restaurants. What more can you ask for? Quiet and elegant. Free wifi at coffee shop in basement.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Business or Fun; Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here with the family in two connecting rooms. This hotel is very big, definitely not going to please a boutique fan. Rooms are pretty typical for a Sheraton. Beds and bathroom were a little bit above average for the brand. Club lounge was busy but had decent evening and breakfast options with a couple levels of seating. Everthing about the property was clean in our experience. We had great service both in advance of the stay with some requests, as well as at check-in, during our visit, etc. The location is very good. Easy walk to Navy Pier and Mag Mile, yet also close to the Loop if you have business. We were above the 20th floor, and you still get some city noise. There are a couple grocery store options and a drug store within a block. Pool area is nice with an attendent on duty in the pool/gym area to keep things orderly. Gym was decent sized (given the property size) with good equipment. We were toward the southeast side of the building with views of the river and lake. Navy Pier fireworks were visible from the room. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Thin thin walls”
Reviews.Author: asx12321
Reviews.Content: I was here for business, so I needed to get a good nights sleep at regular hours (12-7). The walls in this place are amazingly thin - I could hear everything that was happening in the room next to me. Also at night, there's quite a few noisy guests walking down the aisles - and I can hear them as well - really disrupted my sleep. Also, the amenities are very poor for a hotel at this price point. No free wifi. No free gym. W T F. The only thing that I liked was the comfortable bed. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: tompquinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers while taking my son and daughter back to school. A week prior we stayed at the W in Chicago on Lakeshore Drive. While both are fine Starwood properties, the W was loud and pretentious. The Sheraton, on the other hand, impresses in its understatement. It is simply a classic hotel, well appointed, and comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly across the board, from the front desk to the cocktail waitress who brought us our well made drinks. This is my hotel of choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: muels41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated to take advantage of all Chicago has to offer. It is two blocks form lake Michigan where you can walk to Navy Pier, enjoy the lakeside bike / walking path for a leisurely walk or a multi-mile run. It is also two blokc from Michigan avenue where you can shop and sightsee all day or have lunch, breakfast or just people watch. The staff at this hotel are some of the best I have seen. I travel fo rbusiness for a living and this place is "TOP NOTCH" accross the board from service to voerall value and experience. My wife and I spen three nights during a weekend in July and to celebrate or 22 Anniversary. What a trip. The room was not ready when we arrived as the hotel was very busy, so they gave us a couple drink tickets to relax until room was ready. Now, I am a frequent preferred guest here and I get treated very well. We were also upgraded to a very nice room. Danit Harth is the Chief Experience Officer and she is Top notch. This hotel is also located on the river which is very nice to stroll along or catch an architectural cruise. Lover this hotel and going back again with my family in late October. I can't wait. Jamie Mueller

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaveSuitcaseWillTrvl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location along the river. Free wi-fi is available in the coffee shop and some portions of the meeting rooms. Walking distance to neighborhood diners and coffee shops as well as the Magnificent Mile. Overall a decent business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: imtheglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: When I entered the room, I was fairly happy with the decor and what looked like a flean, new bed. But, traveler beware as I did an inspection before I put my bags down, and although I did not see signs of bugs in the room, I awoke with a few red welts similar to mosquito bites on my stomach and back. When I was packing my bag, I found one trying to hide in it. Lord knows if there are more I missed...but really, we all know where there's one, there's more. After running around in total panic, and inspecting further, I saw the black remnants of them in the sheets and on the mattress. I think the hotel staff did a reasonable job of surface cleaning, but bed bugs are good avoiders, and an overnight brought them out. Check your bags people...if you don't, you'll bring the darn things home.

Reviews.Title: “The people are amazing, so it helps to ease the blow when you're charged extra for everything.”
Reviews.Author: greenfairy0
Reviews.Content: This hotel really gets the idea of customer service. They are all friendly, helpful and very willing to take the time to answer anything. While the rooms are pretty standard, the beds rock and the location cannot be beat. I am frustrated by the fact that the internet costs about $15 a day and if you want to use the workout facilities you have to pay $12 a day. I feel like these things should just come with a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “VERY poor experience from a Platinum Member”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. I was looking forward to it, as the location and facility appears fantastic. I often stay at Sheraton and Westins, and tend to be satisfied with the brands. This hotel however failed to meet the standards I would expect from event a non-Starwood frequent guest. I checked in around 1pm. The hotel was very busy due to a couple of conferences in the hotel. The rate was exhorbinantly high-$279-however no hotel in Chicago that night was less than $199. I had booked a double room, and asked for a king. No kings available at that point "the hotel is sold out", so I gladly accepted a double on a high floor. The front desk clerk was generally nice and quick, and, as a Platinum member, asked me what Platinum amenity I would like. I was given an option of 500 SPG points or a free movie or a $10 credit on the minibar. I usually take the points, but decided to take the minibar credit instead. When I got to the room it was exhorbantly hot due to the sun shining through the window. I put the AC on high cool, and left for my meetings that afternoon. When I returned about 5:30pm, it was still hot. I dealt with it as long as I could. About 7/7:10 I called guest request for someone to look at it. 75 minutes later I got a call from the operator to see how things were. I told her no one had been there yet, and it was quite hot. Someone came up, changed the filter, and colder faster air began to move. Around 6pm, I decided to get a cool drink with my $10 mini bar credit. I opened the refrigerator and everything was warm. They did state they would credit me the drink I had opened and I asked to switch back to the 500 points. The food choices in this hotel are not very good. Shulas is very expensive and well beyond the average traveler's budget, so I decided to try the burger place. Closed. No other options other than room service, so I went down to Michigan Avenue and had a great dinner at Bandera. The valet service is quite bad. They were never busy, and even when I would call 10-15 minutes down for my car (three occasions), they never started to get my car until I got there and showed my ticket. Then, another 10 minute wait. This was the first time I have NOT tipped a valet. They kept looking at me like they were surprised to see me. For $49/night valet, I expect more attentive service. As a frequent traveler, I'm used to getting rooms in nice condition, often an upgrade, or a good view, etc. This room, while the view of the river was nice, was very worn, walls/baseboards scratched and felt very small. The bathroom is tiny. The internet system in the rooms, as mentioned by others, is DREADFUL. I couldn't get my work system to connect at all wireless or wired, and my personal one took 45 minutes to connect--the internet in the club works well. The Club is nice in appearance, but the food choices are much less than the Hyatt Regency Club. The hors' deuovers were very weak, dessert was a stack of cookies, and breakfast was average at best. No alcohol is served in this club, unlike other chains. When I tried to enter for breakfast, my key would not work--so it was 33 stories back down the lobby. I was over the whole experience by this point, as it got worse and worse. When a few employees, who never used my name or recognized my status, realized I was not happy, the Manager on Duty called at about 9pm. Nice gesture, and I unloaded on her, and she apologized, but anything she could do was too little too late. I let her know I would not be back. The Hyatt has great rooms for even non elites, a better selection of foods and drinks in the club, and MUCH better and consistent service. I am not turned off by Starwood, and will try the Westins when their rates come back to normal. But this one is a big NO.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: triplovinglady
Reviews.Content: We came to the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers for a weekend because it was perfectly located for our participation in the Susan G Komen Race for the Cure in Grant Park. We enjoyed the lovely and sophisticated lobby and super comfortable beds. The staff took extra care in helping us check in without parking our car. When we had to leave unexpectedly due to a medical emergency of a family member, the hotel manager was fantastic in allowing us to alter our reservation without a cancellation charge. We will absolutely go back to the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers for every weekend get-away we plan from now on. What a great place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: 10-Val
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the beds are comfortable. I was booked into this hotel by my company, and during the conference my colleagues and I agreed... we won't be booking there again! Service was bad. Front desk and doormen were not helpful at all, when they were around. Otherwise it was long waits at front desk, and us walking around the corner to get our own taxis. In addition to that, despite our booking being made weeks in advance AND prepaid, some of our team were bumped off the hotel and relocated for one night to another hotel. This is not what you would expect from a 'business hotel' particularly as the travellers were arriving at 10pm, and had to be in conferences the next morning at 8am. The additional time wasted travelling to and from the 'one night replacement' hotel was the last thing they needed, having travelled over 12 hours to get to Chicago! Definitely not worth the high room rates, I'm sure there are other hotels in Chicago that have comfortable beds, too....

Reviews.Title: “Not what I would have chosen”
Reviews.Author: SoniaLaStrega
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Chicago for a recent conference, even though it's the sort of place I normally avoid like the plague. It wasn't awful by any means, and the bed was insanely comfortable, but it could easily have been much better. In a hotel charging these kinds of rates, I expect wireless internet, not being tied to a cable at a desk and paying $12.95 a day for the 'privilege'. And while hotels invariably gouge on phone call costs, I really feel $18.95 for a 90 second (not international) call is stretching things somewhat. Room service food ranged from adequate to vaguely unpleasant. Fortunately it wasn't all bad, the staff were largely very pleasant and helpful, particularly the reception desk clerks and the housekeepers. And the hotel is very well located in walking distance to the city centre. But then so are lots of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: pickyphillyfamily
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location, and if you can book a deal through hotwire (as we did), this hotel is also a terrific value. Our 12th floor room facing north was nicely updated, very clean, and perfectly quiet. We were advised that rooms near the elevators can be noisy, so I'd avoid those. We're very picky and had no complaints. The self-park option at $35 a night is relatively affordable, for Chicago. There's free internet and a couple printers at the lower-level coffee shop, serving Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent value for money...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. Great location. Right on the river bank and with easy walking distance to all the famous landmarks. The rooms were great and public areas of the hotel were very modern. My only annoyance is the hotel hosts lots of conferences so was very busy all the time. I did already know this after Reading other peoples reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SusanYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and other public areas are impressive, however the corridors and rooms are in need of refurbishment. The rooms are a good size and I found the bed and pillows wonderfully comfortable. The colour scheme in the rooms and corridors is various shades of brown which gives the place a grubby appearance. The hotel is overpriced for the condition of the rooms and bathrooms, but it is in a great location. I had a room on the 28th floor and had great views of the river and lake. The hotel is a very short walk to Michigan avenue and the main city centre but is far enough away to be quiet at night. There is a supermarket within 3 minutes walk and they sell pizza pieces and sandwiches which is great if you donâ€™t want to eat out in restaurants every evening. I found the staff to be very helpful and very customer focused, a real credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average & Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSlim
Reviews.Content: While the common areas are nice, the rooms are rather small and haven't been updated recently. The water pressure in the shower was low, and the shower head was moldy.....ugh. I heard complaints about room service from my colleagues, but I didn't use it myself so I can't comment. The nearby Swissotel, Farimont and Hyatt are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average for Cost”
Reviews.Author: langland12
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend for my girlfriends bachlorette. We parked in the self park lot across the street, this hotel advertises a walk way to the hotel, but first of all there are no signs just twisting turning hallways so you have no idea where to go. Also you have to walk through all these doors with that the employees use which by the way were all rude they couldnt even hold the door for 4 girls with suitcases and bags. Also upon checking in the put a $50 "hold" on my credit card that they did not infom me there were doing, which a week later I still have not gotten refunded! I will say the lobby was very nice but the rooms are very small and not what you would expect for a 4 star hotel. Not only can you hear everything in the hallways but there are acutally cracks in between the door and frame where u can see into the room! Upon checking out we asked several people for carts to haul our bags out and we were given attitude that we could just carry them since we parked in the self park lot and we couldnt bring the cart out of the hotel. I would not recommend this place to anyone. The Embassy Suites a block away is nicer and you even get a free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay except for one thing”
Reviews.Author: Smalsae01
Reviews.Content: The beds were awful. This was a family re-union and every single one hated the mattresses, we could adjust the firmness of the mattress by a hand-held controller, yet the mattresses were VERY uncomforable, I will still DIFINITELEY reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bike friendly”
Reviews.Author: joyluv
Reviews.Content: We rented bicycles during our stay in Chicago. The Sheraton Hotel would not accommodate us by storing the bicycles in the storage room or garage. The Bell Stand Manager advised us to take the bicycles to our room. Could you imagine walking through a busy hotel lobby and riding the elevators everyday with large dirty bicycles. Not a very safe suggestion. Location! Location! Location! The location of this hotel is great. However, the rooms especially the bathrooms could use updating.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ValCat5
Reviews.Content: An elegant, comfortable hotel in a great location. You can easily walk to Grant Park, Millenium Park, Navy Pier, shopping on Michigan Ave as well as an endless supply of restaurants... The staff was very prompt, helpful & courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: MalamaPono2010
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Chicago is in a wonderful location within walking distance of so many downtown attractions including Michigan Ave. and the Chicago River. The staff was efficient and helpful and I MUST absolutely recommend the Deep Dish Pizza from Room Service. Who would have guessed it would be one of the best meals we had in Chicago?! (We added spinach and bacon as our toppings). And use of "The Link" internet lounge made staying in touch, checking in for our flight, etc. a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottingCouple
Reviews.Content: Considering a lot of choices in Chicago were upwards in the $200-300 range, this hotel cost us around $170 per night and was the perfect choice for location, value, and amenities. Self parking was $35 a day, the room was your average hotel room, and the hotel features were lovely. The best thing about this hotel, IMO, is the location. Perfect middle spot between north and south areas of the Chicago River. Everything seemed to be in walking distance. At the time of travel, I was 7 1/2 months pregnant and even that didn't deter me from walking everywhere. We always had a "homebase" nearby if I had to put up my feet for 10 minutes. We didn't pay for any other extras like pool or room service, but we really, really, enjoyed our stay in the GORGEOUS City of Chicago. LOVED our little vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Overly Priced”
Reviews.Author: Ditzycowgurl
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here first thing that was never mentioned was that there was a 50 dollar parking fee per night. When we booked that was never mentioned, so to start out we where not happy. When we got to our room it had a very small bathroom with 2 towels. Then we tried to order out no local businesses will deliver here. If you look at there menu they want 10 dollars for a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Are you kidding? This place is over priced with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: travelinglady62
Reviews.Content: First, the Sheraton in Chicago (Riverside) was not up to most of the Sheraton's I've stayed in before. The lighting in the room was horrible. The bed felt like I was sleeping on wooden boards. The maid service was always late, they didn't refill the coffee service a couple of times. The bath tub was very slippery, if you come here, bring your own bath mat. The room was a lot smaller than other Sheratons I've stayed at. The halls were very noisy, you could hear your neighbors door opening and closing. This hotel was a big disappointment for me. I won't stay here again. There is a charge for the fitness club, but not the pool. Valet parking was a joke. I called to have my car brought up...you have to go down into the basement to get your car. It also took about 20 mins. for my car to come.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Runningtraveller
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just completed a six night stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel. Our stay was fantastic! We were provided with a complimentary upgraded room upon arrival, which looked south and east over the river and towards the lake. All hotel staff members we encountered were kind, courteous, knowledgeable and professional. The room was extremely clean (including the bathroom) quiet and the beds amazingly comfortable. The hotel is a 10 minute walk (at most) to everything, including a Red Line subway station, Navy Pier, the lakefront trail system, restaraunts, Michigan Ave. We did not have a car in Chicago and did not require one! We purchased a seven day subway/bus pass. The hotel does charge a daily fee for internet access in your room, but they also provide free internet access in a Cafe one floor below the lobby. There are PC's provided by the hotel for guests to use at the cafe or you can use your own laptop to access the internet. There is also a charge for use of the finess facility. The facility is very large with all new state of the art equipment. We did not use the fitness facility but instead headed out for several early morning runs along the lakefront trail system, which is amazing! The use of the pool is free for all guests. There are several restaurants within the hotel and many more within easy walking distance of the hotel. You can have breakfast within one of the hotel restaurants or save a few dollars and purchase some yogurt and bread at Dominicks Supermarket, which is just a block away from the hotel. There is also a fabulous breakfast restaurant (Yolk) located two blocks away from the hotel, on E Ohio. The food was great and the portions large! We noted that on the day of departure, our floor was being closed off for renovations to be done to the bathrooms. We felt that our room did not even require this renovation but it will certainly make the hotel that much better! I would highly recommend this hotel to either business travellers or vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Bunny1985
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Chicago for a business trip and really enjoyed the city and the hotel. The hotel was well maintained and very clean. The location was great because we could walk to many attractions, including Navy Pier. The service was great and we couldn't have been more pleased with the accommdations. We would definitely stay here again if we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night on August 19th. We were...”
Reviews.Author: trippinmama
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on August 19th. We were upgraded to a higher floor room with a beautiful view of navy pier/ water. The room however needs some upgrades. The bathroom is old, old tub, moldy counter, old faucets and chipped/scuffed paint. The rooms are tiny. The only plus to the room was the Starbucks coffee with real creamer, no powdered crap, and the view. Valet parking was also a pain, they said to call ahead of time to get your car, but no one answered. So then we had to schlep our baggage/ two kids down a service elevator to the garage where they retrieved our car for us. For over $40 a night for parking you would at least expect some decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kwgkyle
Reviews.Content: Great and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Close to Navy Pier. Nice bar and resturant on site or a short walk to many other resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: MHochstatter
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago as a family and the location of the Sheraton was prefect. Right down by the lake and it seemed close to everything we wanted to do. The lobby is expansive and even though the hotel has many rooms we didn't have to wait long for service or an elevator and the staff was always ready to help. Shula's Steakhouse was great and the hamburger joint was perfect for a quick bite. Try and get a room as high in the tower as possible because the views are spectacular, especially at night. Way to go guys, we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This a nice hotel with all the facilities you might want. Its a little dated. I did have an issue about lounge access as a Gold SPG member, which they addressed by giving me access. The bus for our conference at McCormick place had a direct route there and back, this was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: cs7sisters
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, really great location, especially in the summer where it's centrally located between the Navy Pier, Loop, and Michigan Ave. No complaints, except the pool is not good for smaller children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice rooms, helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: scottielockhart
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was very nice. We would like to highlight the work of the Concierge desk in helping us find restaurants, make reservations and get around town. They were fantastic. One really big improvement to ask is to turn the air conditioning down a bit. While nice to have a chill to knock the heat off when you enter, the lobby was absolutely freezing. Our rooms were kept so cold that when we returned we started turning the a/c off altogether so that we did not get more sick as both my girlfriend and I both came down with headcolds in August at night. Not a hard thing to fix or a huge complaint, but something we noticed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: LakeMaryMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a busy August weekend. All the staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was clean and fine with a nice view of the river and Lake Michigan. The location is good for walking to Navy Pier and the Mag Mile shopping and several good eating places. I found the directions for self-parking a bit confusing but we did OK and had no other problems. If staying a couple days I would recommend a bus pass of which there are several options...I think you can purchase them at several locations, one being a grocery store just across the street from this hotel. I did not like the extra charges for the pool and workout center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, could use some updating the rooms and better housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: niktopnotch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton towers this past weekend (big mistake). Even after reading negative reviews I went ahead with the hotel due to the positive reviews and the pictures and reputation of the hotel. I was impressed by all that the hotel had to offer and the size of the hotel. The staff was generous, BUT the problem came when I went into my room and checked out the bathroom to find dried up urine on the toilet, also one of the pillows had brown stains on it (the actual pillow, not case). The rooms were just average and I paid an extremely large amount of money on the room because it was suppose to be a "water view" which I was NOT impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hotel and Towers in Chicago did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Lori3151
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the City of Chicago and to the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. The location was perfect and our accommodations overlooked the river as it meandered below the flower clad streets and bridges providing a landscape of varied architectural styled buildings and skyscrapers-beautiful views- day and night! From check-in to check-out, our stay was comfortable and easy. Well appointed rooms and wonderful beds, attentive staff, and concierge staff that acted on every request made in a timely fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little old”
Reviews.Author: Lucatia22
Reviews.Content: very nice reception, nice hotel, big space, excellent service, they provided a coffe machine with all...a little bit messy the room service, we left a used cup and they didnÂ´t clean it...and there was a used towels when we arrived.... Our friend stayed in other room that leaked with the rain trough the windows.... Location: very good

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bleccy
Reviews.Content: We loved the Sheraton Chicago! The location is ideal. It is within walking distance to many places, including Navy Pier. Our room had a spectacular view. We were able to see the river, the lake in the distance, and a beautiful section of the Chicago skyline in both directions. The room was clean, and the beds are incredibly comfortable. The staff was helpful with recommendations for getting around town and places to eat. We had a great stay and if we return to Chicago, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Twice and Will Return Again - A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfr0mWI
Reviews.Content: I routinely stay at the Westin or W City Center when traveling to Chicago for business. I thought I would give this hotel a shot based on its great location, and excellent price.
