I had not stayed at a Sheraton in over 5 years and I was so suprised by what a great property this is. I've stayed at this hotel twice during the month of July. The hotel is clean, and has great location. Just a few blocks to great shopping, restaurants, and attractions in the city of Chicago. I was increadibly impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel - many things slip at facilities this size but cleanliness has impressed me on both trips. The price point at the Sheraton is a great value, however valet parking and internet charges can add up. I did find service somewhat inconsistent at this hotel. Housekeeping was delightful each trip, while the valet was slow and inattentive. When I ordered room service, although the food arrived quickly, the food was dreadful. When I called to speak with someone about it, they were less than considerate. As a frequent traveler and SPG Platinum member, I was most suprised by how things were handled at Check in. The first stay I was greeted warmly, and kindly offered access to the club lounge, altough they could not upgrade me to the club floor. My most recent stay, I was told they wanted to charge me $50 for an upgraded room (should be standard and no charge for SPG platinum) and that if I wanted access to the club lounge that would also come at a price. Not only did the front desk person clearly not understand what should be provided to frequent guests, but also he was quite rude and brash in his demands for extra fees. A little extra polish on service and front desk training will go a far way in this hotel being a better property for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon008
Reviews.Content: Right by the river, easy walk to Navy pier and the mile, when we arrived we were immediately upgraded to a larger room because we had young children, no extra charge, room cleaning and service was really great. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: zuleikall
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all about this hotel...it was great because I shared it with four other friends, so less expensive..:))

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers Is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Traveler10035805
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that our stay (family~ children ages 8 & 9) was FABULOUS this summer!! The staff was very helpful and courteous~not only with hotel issues but as we explored Chicago! All of our future visits to Chicago will involve staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MagnoliaMa
Reviews.Content: My husband, young daughter and I just got back from 3 nights at the Sheraton Towers. We were very happy with the hotel's location. It's a short walk to Navy Pier and the Mag Mile and there are many grocery stores and parks nearby. The pool was very nice as well. We had mixed opinions about the staff. I went in and out with a stroller about 15 times and only had the door held for me once by door men (it's a busy hotel, but we've stayed at other busy Chicago hotels like the Hilton and always had the doors opened for us). The room was dirty. There were small blood spots on the sheets and they were never changed in the three days that we were there. I regret not being more forward and demanding a cleaner room. There was hair on the bathroom as well. Considering how much the hotel cost, this was a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: arcadia925
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Chicago, this is the place to stay. The hotel is located right in the heart of Chicago, the center of all the attractions. It is right on the river with great views of the city. An added attraction is Marisa, the concierge! She is so helpful and always has a sweet and pleasant dispositon. She made all the difference for our stay in Chicago. You will not be disappointed with your stay at this hotel! Enjoy Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gardengal50
Reviews.Content: Just spent several nights at this hotel, while in town for a business trip. Very disappointed with quality of service in several departments! Valet parking department scored a big ZERO! Terrible, slow service and not with the program! Food & bev, also needs some help with customer service. And, housekeeping...yes, even though we are a stay-over, we still like the bed made! No Wi Fi in the rooms either. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location”
Reviews.Author: RebaS83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the night for a birthday celebration downtown. Check in was quick and the room was very nice that looked over the river. Room size was a little small, but still okay I was having problems connecting my laptop to the internet in the room but the tech service was helpful.. however the high speed internet isnt free. Ordered room service...quick delivery, but average over priced food. I was able to get a rate of $95 on priceline.com....average room rate is over $200

Reviews.Title: “IMPROVED”
Reviews.Author: lchaddo2
Reviews.Content: I had a very negative experience at the Sheraton a few months ago (i.e., room cleanliness). I expressed my concerns, and Danita Harth provided a complimentary evening at the hotel for me. It was WONDERFUL. The room was beautiful and clean, and I am very very impressed! Thank you, Danita!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Markus186
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel early at a very good rate, so I was a little scared they but me into a little closet like some hotels may do. But not this hotel. Spacious room with a sitting area, big flat screen and a big, comfortable bed. The noise of the aircondition was very low, it will not disturb a good nightÂ´s sleep. The rooms are very calm. The location half way between Michigan Ave and Navy Pier on the Chciago River is another plus. It is the perfect location for getting around in Chicago. I can only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Exceptional Stay and Staff”
Reviews.Author: tammyrb
Reviews.Content: The Sheraoton Chicago Hotel and Toweres has an awesome location in Downtown Chicago. It is great for people that go out alone to walk Michigan Avenue for shopping and dining and Navy Pier to eat or watch the fireworks. At this location there is no need for a taxi to get to wonderful places to eat. There are so many great restaurants within walking distance that i have not been able to eat at all the ones that i have wanted to try. At the Sheraton each guest is treated well. The concierge on Sunday when I arrived helped me find the way to my Chocolate Tour in Lakeview. She was very helpful in getting the bus route I needed to take. She found out the price and the schedule. i have stayed the past 5 years at this hotel for the National Pampered Chef Conference and have loved it. The whole staff from the baggage claim people to the desk to the restaurant workers and cleaning, the person that puts out the receipts are truly exceptional. Each of those people touched my stay in a good way. May The Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers continue with such great customer service. A grateful and impressed guest, Tammy The mattresses are truly wonderful this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Iggyhawk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers recently as part of a large group. The hotel's location is in the heart of Chicago within walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping, Millenium Park, Navy Pier, etc. It is very convenient for many local tours. While the view from the room was great, the interior is in need of an update. In particular, the bathroom is dated. I ended up staying in 2 rooms over my 4 night stay as reception could not find me a room that was available for all 4 nights. They handled this quite well with a one night upgrade to the club floor, but as someone who likes to fully unpack upon arrival who had booked 2 months in advance and arrived by 6 p.m., I have to admit this was not a great first impression. My first room was on the club floor and had a river view. The room was quiet and a decent size. The negatives were a shower that did not drain, a worn shower curtain, air conditioning that did not work well, and tired looking carpets and bedding. The second room was also on a high floor with a river view with many of the same negatives. All in all, I would recommend staying at a different downtown Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.....if you get a great price.”
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Towers, Chicago, IL. I have always had mixed feelings about this hotel, and this trip was no different. The location is great, 2 blocks off Michigan Avenue. Nearby Walgreens, Domenic's Grocery store, restaurants, bars, river, etc, etc, etc. Location: Ideal. Parking/Valet: Promptly greeted by valet when I pulled in the circle drive. I had no intention of using valet, but was dropping off my fellow passengers. I was greeted by a gentleman with an Irish accent...his name escapes me. Very professional, and courteous. Helpful and friendly. A+. Used the self-park- $35 per day. Not the worst I've heard of in downtown Chicago....considering parking comes at a huge premium in big cities! Front Desk- although couldn't upgrade me to anything, did provide me with a decent room facing the front entrance/Hancock building. Fast, efficient, friendly. Room- Small. Outdated lights. 2 of which didn't work. Bathroom was borderline embarassing. Small amount of mold noticed on calking around bathtub. Gross. Stained (redish pink) hand towels. Very Gross. Could hear doors slamming all morning starting around 7am and went until I decided to get up. So much for sleeping in. Internet- expensive. Oh, and I made 1 local telephone call and it cost me $2. This hotel seems to nickel and dime you where they can, well, most Sheraton seem to. Although I don't expect free calls, wi-fi, parking, healthclub, it bothers me when they charge steep rates for all or most of them. ie 2 drinks in Chi Bar coming to nealy 30 dollars. C'mon.........really? Yes, I like this hotel's location. Most of it's staff. Definitely the beds. Not the slamming doors, bloody hand cloths, or 15 dollar drinks. In closing I would reluctantly recommend this hotel, if money isn't an issue for you. If you are on a budget, I would look elsewhere....you may be able to afford the room, but that's about all.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: savdm
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the willingness of the staff to provide us with a pleasant stay. The facility is extremely clean and well maintained. People remember your name and always greet you with a smile. I was taken with the efficient Elevators ! No matter what floor I was on or time of the day, when I pushed the call button "bing" the doors opened. It's the little things that make your day. I will recommend this Hotel to anyone who asks. Thanks again for a wonderful place to stay. Steve & Gerri Van Der Meer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel--great location--wonderful staff and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: KStraveler382
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back to the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers! Luxury accommodations and helpful staff. My room was immaculate, the front desk was so friendly, and the location was perfect...close to everything I needed. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I am in LOVE with those BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: nphummel
Reviews.Content: Best night's sleep EVER. I cannot say enough about those beds. They have these Sweet Sleepers (I think that's what they're called) and they completely blew our minds. We didn't want to leave the next day. We even researched purchasing our own Sheraton bed (waaaay too expensive, by the way). Not only did this hotel provide EXCELLENT sleep quality, but it was ultra modern, in a great location, and it was downright awesome. My only gripe was they have total morons working in the waaaaay overpriced parking garage. We waited 40 minutes for them to retrieve our car. Park elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “For a rewarding, pleasurable stay choose the Sheraton Hotel & Towers.”
Reviews.Author: jl62257
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel & Towers was wonderful. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. The room had a great view and was very comfortable. I was impressed with the fitness center, most places have a small room with a couple of machines, this had so much more to offer. I look forward to future visits to Chicago and the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't sleep in your own bed, sleep at a Sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: soupyease
Reviews.Content: We met for some shopping but spent so much time at night laughing and drinking a bit of wine outside along the river walk we didn't get too much shopping time in. All I can say is that the beds are soooooo comfy. I would choose this hotel over anything else ... and I live in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very kid-unfriendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan329_10
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our daughter's birthday and spent 1 night at this hotel. After a fun-filled day of shopping and museums, my kids were excited to get back to the hotel and go swimming. I asked the person at the front desk what time the pool was open until and he said 10:00 pm. We hurried back to the room to get our swimsuits on and was down there by 9:15. We were then told that my kids were not welcome in the pool area from 9:00 pm - 10:00 pm. The pool is for adults only! How many adults go swimming on a Saturday night at 9:00 in Chicago. No one! There was another family also wanting to swim with their kids. So we were all turned away because of this "new rule". I spoke with the manager on duty and he offered me a free breakfast instead. Do they really think the kids care about a "free breakfast" when they are looking so forward to going swimming. He could not even give me a discount on my bill because he said I booked it through Expedia. All in all, our trip to Chicago was great but I would NEVER EVER stay at this hotel again. Management handles situations poorly. The pool was nothing even to brag about, there was no whirlpool or anything special about it. If you are traveling with children, I strongly recommend you stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail422
Reviews.Content: Quite mediocre hotel. Maybe I am spoiled by elite status with Marriott, but here it goes. Pros: Great view from the room - over the river, towards North Michigan Ave. Room is clean. Location is good, with easy access to the Loop, Navy Pier/Lakeshore and Magnificient Mile. Cons: - Bathroom is in bad need of a plumber. Faucet drains very poorly, toilet upon flushing won't stop running water till you shake the handle a few times, turning shower on almost broke the bathtub faucet out of the wall. - Air conditioning works OK but is quaint: there is no automatic temperature control. The cold air blows straight towards the bed, I almost caught cold while sleeping - Lamp by the bed burnt out and does not work - They charge $12 for fitness per day (I never have this problem with Marriott, non only in the US but even in London where everybody charges for everything). ANyway I went jogging on Lakeshore instead, as the weather was good. - None of the printers in the business area works; one of the two is even physically visibly broken, and nobody cares. I was unable to print the boarding pass. - Hotel reception/concierge are useless: as I came for corporate meetings the hotel staff was unable to direct me to tht proper meeting rooms; they had no clue where our meting is located - Other inquires with the reception weren't helpful either: I arrived around 10pm on Thurs and to my question about the best place to get a late dinner they suggested room service as an only option. Mind you, this is in Chicago, not Des Moines. Also when I asked for a local map (for jogging, since they charge for gym) they gave me some useless piece of paper without the map and with terse description in plain text on how to access Lakeshore trail. I had opportunities in the near past to stay in Marriott-branded hotels within a few blocks from this Sheraton and in the future I would always take that preference. This time it was booked by corporate for the meeting; hope they won't make this mistake again. With the long list of other hotels in Downtown Chicago I wouldn't recommend this Sheraton. For the same price you can get a much better service/value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rikipok
Reviews.Content: I went there for 6 nights in a club room. Very nice room, confortable, good location (in front of a cinema) A bit far from the subway though.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawker_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Towers in Chicago last week into the weekend and had an unbelievable experience. From the moment we pulled into the circle drive until we checked out and pulled away from the curb we were greeted with smiles and friendly hellos all around. Paula at the Concierge desk, worked every day of our stay. She helped us with our numerous outtings and she remembered our kiddos by name when we came and went each day. I thought this was pretty remarkable considering there are 1300 rooms in this hotel and it was booked solid! We made nightly trips to the Executive Club Lounge to get milk and cookies before bed and Rene was like an impromptu uncle to our girls. He spoiled them rotten and they didn't want to come home. Our room was very spacious and extremely clean. We had high expectations and the staff here met every one of them. We would highly recommend this hotel to people traveling as families!

Reviews.Title: “Dated ,poor managment”
Reviews.Author: Raj7122
Reviews.Content: Stay for my business trip,room hot because old a/c ,call front desk no respance.next day morning took shower bathroom fogy beacause fan not work, I have to wait 30 min to fog out from room.coffee machine notmaking hot water. Very disappointed , tips please don't go by name or don't attrect by front lobby , look room first dated hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrible choice......Bed Bugs like it though!”
Reviews.Author: carguy45
Reviews.Content: The staff was awful, very unable to provide service to customers or just didn't care to. The icing on the cake was the bed bugs..........WE'LL BE LEAVING NOW THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!!!! STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE REGARDLESS OF EXPENSE.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: PianaMama
Reviews.Content: I took my husband and 2 kids along on a business trip, and we were extremely pleased with the customer service at this hotel. The staff were so sincere and friendly. From the front desk staff who accommodated our room location request, to the concierge staff who provided outstanding recommendations for restaurants and public transportation, to the room attendant who was so funny, flexible, and attentive...we continued to be impressed throughout our 8 day stay. My kids even said, "Goodbye Sheraton, I'll miss you" as we headed to the airport. Thanks Sheraton Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Unforgetable”
Reviews.Author: kcousineau
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Chicago and my stay at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers was great!The staff was friendly and responsive to my requests and when I had an issue related to my door lock the response was very fast and the problem was corrected. The food and beverage and the atmosphere of the Sheraton Lounge was exceptional. Just tell me one thing - how did the bell captain and the bell staff know I was from Toronto! My entire stay was great and I look forward to my next vist to Chicago and the Sheraton Towers.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip”
Reviews.Author: Claire_EugeneOR
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough hotel in a great location, but... I have NEVER stayed in a place that nickel and dimed me the way this place did. Want internet? That's extra. Health club and swimming pool? Also extra. Upon checking out I discovered that I was charged $2.50 for every toll-free call that I made. They catered portions of our conference, charging $5 for a can of soda. Is this because it's Chicago? Or because it's Sheraton? Other problems were the concierge gave me inaccurate information, and the noise from the street below (my window didn't seem to close quite right). There are a ton of hotels within a few blocks of this place, I would shop around first.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views - Very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: jhs03
Reviews.Content: I was part of a family group, including toddlers. We were all provided upgrades to the club floor and the staff was fantastic. They allowed late check -out for those needing it in our group. Wonderful views of Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. There is a great park within two blocks for small children and you are only three blocks from Navy Pier. Great family dining at reasonable cost in the local neighborhood. You are walking distance to Michigan Avenue - so everything you could want. Again the staff went above and beyond to make our trip an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unprecedented Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RunDLC84
Reviews.Content: They were great! Before my trip, the Sheraton sent an e-mail to me asking for any special requests. I made a few, and they fulfilled them before I got there - making my stay extra enjoyable. The hotel is also in a gorgeous location, and the rooms have views of the lake or the Chicago river. Great all around!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RickTrip1
Reviews.Content: Hello, My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton this past Saturday, May 8th. We are from the suburbs and have never stayed downtown before. It was truly a great experience. We received a very nice rate along with an upgrade to a deluxe room(better view) and access to the club room. The room was beautiful with a great view of the river and lake. Room was a little small but laid out very nice and it was very modern and clean. Flat screen TV was a nice touch. We walked to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue on Saturday with our daughters and had a good time doing 'tourist stuff'. Location was very close to the Hotel. On Saturday night my wife and I ate at Shula's Steakhouse(attached to Hotel) and it was excellent. They allowed us to split a dinner which was nice because we were not super hungry but wanted to try the steakhouse. The Club Lounge was very nice to sit and have cup of coffee and bakery and enjoy the view. Megan(manager) was very nice and gave us her Email address if we had any problems(we had none) and to contact before our next stay. We are signed up for the stay 3 times and get 1 weekend night free and hope to take advantage of the program. On Sunday we took part in the Breast Cancer walk in Grant Park which was also very close to the hotel. Our stay was excellent and hope to visit again! Rick & Laurie

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ZackCanada
Reviews.Content: In advance of our trip the hotel staff was great and during the stay it carried on. We had a club room with a view of the river which was great. The hotel is in the middle of the loop and the mile so it was very convenient. After a full day touring the city the bed was heavenly! Thanks again to the staff for a great visit! Ted and Paula from Canada

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT”
Reviews.Author: juanandonly51
Reviews.Content: Best view of the river available. Great accomodations and comfortable stay. Not so thrilled about the parking situation but well worth it if you are in and out via taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Thinkalot
Reviews.Content: When I received the customary "We're looking forward to your arrival and is there anything we can do to make your stay perfect?" e-mail from the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers it was signed by Danita Harth, CEO, Chief Experience Officer. As a 20 year Platinum SPG member I had never seen that title before. I e-mailed Ms. Harth on a Saturday night to request a junior suite where I could host some former students who were attending a convention and offered to pay extra for the room. When I arrived Sunday, she had pre-blocked the perfect room--no charge. I used in-room dining during my stay and the food was prompt, hot and delicious which is a big deal for an exhausted traveler. The Club Floor lounge is one of the best! Thanks Ms. Harth, CEO, and Sheraton staff for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference location”
Reviews.Author: Jibster
Reviews.Content: We found the Sheraton very comfortable and accommodating. Our conference was located right within the building, and every need was attended to. The guest suite accommodations were excellent. Very comfortable bed. We ate at the burger bar on the ground floor, and that was fabulous... not to be missed. The concierge desk was always staffed with courteous, helpful people. The main lounge was fun, but a bit over the top on pricing ($11 per glass for a house pinot grigio). The only negative was lack of wi-fi (it was only in the lobby). In 2010, I would have expected more wi-fi (at least in the rooms) in a nice place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and a Darn Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: flowrjap
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-day stint in Chicago, one of my favorite cities. This time, I stayed at the Starwood Property, Chicago Hotel & Towers. It was a great trip! Prior to arrival, Danita Harth, the Chief Experience Officer, sent a welcome greeting via email, which I thought was a particularly ingenious way of being proactive about a guest's upcoming visit. Very nice touch! -and she was charming and helpful to boot! Upon arrival, I was pleasantly greeted by bell captain. I arrived before noon and though I could not get into my room at that time, I left my phone number and was pleasantly contacted prior to the usual check-in time, to access my room. [What a delightful service not mentioned in brochures.] I had access to internet from my room, and I made the most of the ammenities in the hotel. The reception desk was staffed with friendly and efficient people, and the concierge was equally as helpful. I had a drink at the bar [one of the best Old Fashions I've had in ages], and enjoyed chatting with colleagues in the spacious and well-decorated lobby. My room was extremely clean and neat and the bed was as always at a Starwood Resort- "Heavenly." Two nites of my stay and two mornings, I was greeted by the friendly staff in the Club Lounge where I had a continental breakfast and evening wine and snack. Connie was particularly kind and helpful. She has been working there for ages, and she really takes pride in her work. It shows. She is cordial and she really made us feel at home. I only wish I could have made it back for coffee and brownies in the evening! Finally, I shipped packages out upon departure, and the Business Center guys were helpful and efficient. All in all, the entire experience was a delight. I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel. It's convenient to just about everything and the hotel really caters to your every need. AND... you can earn Starwood points to return for a leisure trip, which I plan to do this summer! Thanks, folks. It was really all just "Heavenly!"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: DK1153
Reviews.Content: I decided to reward my employees with a night out on the town and an overnight stay at the Sheraton Towers Chicago. I was treated with excellent service from start to finish. The hotel staff that help plan the event, helped with every step along the way and made sure every detail was covered. I hosted a reception in the Chi Bar, which is a great place to have a drink and relax and also has a great view of the river and lake. The rooms were very comfortable and the room service staff went above and beyond what I expected. All my employees had a great time. They are already asking about next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice visit”
Reviews.Author: murray50
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago on business while my wife came to unwind. We found the staff at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers to be attentive and professional in all our interactions. We had a room on the 26th floor with a wonderful view of the lake, the room was very quiet which is important to us. If we're fortunate enough to get back to Chicago in the future this hotel will be high on our list. It's not the least expensive hotel around but a good value for the comfort.

Reviews.Title: “There are just so many better options in...”
Reviews.Author: joemel
Reviews.Content: There are just so many better options in the downtown area. I get woken up every morning by the shower of the room next door. The towels are rough at best. The bell staff is very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - very comfortable and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mlk1380
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel, Chicago Sheraton Towers, was fabulous! From check-in to check-out the employees were so warm and friendly. The Club Lounge was worth the upgrade. The view and service was great. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: evilh0mer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family en route to Flagstaff from New York. Managed to get a good rate from the Manager Rick via a friend so hadnt really looked into the hotel so didnt know what to expect, I need not have worried. All of the staff we met and the hotel itself were first rate. We didnt eat there but the concierge directed us to two fanstatic local resturants (473 Rush was amazing) and the rooms had great views of the city. The hotel is idealy placed for exploring the city being next to the river and oposite a cinema complex, which was handy with teenage kids!. The hotel itself has a spa, and also provides a free internet cafe (about 10 machines) which was great. Nice place and great staff, thanks very much Rick and the Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in Chicago Really!”
Reviews.Author: Boomerlf
Reviews.Content: We live in the Chicago suburbs, so we have stayed at many hotels in the city over the years and this is our new favorite and here is why: Spotlessly clean rooms Great views of the lake Very friendly staff from check-in to cleaning staff We have stayed here two times in the past six months and each visit was perfect. I would recommend the Club Floor. Also the walk along the river is lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge”
Reviews.Author: sexymom6
Reviews.Content: I just want to say a big "THANK YOU" to our concierge Dani M. Butler at this hotel. She made our stay fabulous! She had all the information we needed and more. She always had a great smile and took the time with us to explain everything. She deserves a day off with pay I say! I work retail and know how hard it is to please people. She did a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great people, Great Food, Great Service, large enough for conferences”
Reviews.Author: SunnyJim43
Reviews.Content: I greatly enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton during the Craft Brewing Convention. The staff was knowledgeable, warm, accessible and responsive. On responsiveness: The elevator clocks were the only ones not on DST. When mentioned to the desk clerk it was promptly handled. This was typical. The Link cafe' is a noce place, with computers available. it also had a first rate fresh salad, and pleasant service (as opposed to someone with j"ust a job". I'd go back anytime. Same for the restaurant next door to the Link. The Concierge level is worth choosing. Nice view, a quite place to break out especially with 'the kids'. Beds were very comfortable as well. Heard it has a great exercise center, but did not have time to check it out. But ....it was the people and their attitude toward guests that would bring me back again and again. People remember you, day to day. It counts, and makes you feel like a welcome guest. DPK

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & dime? Try 10 & 20 bucks.”
Reviews.Author: Mutt99
Reviews.Content: I have been to this Sheraton before about 7 years ago and remembered that I was annoyed with the A/C & Heat system because of noise and lack of thermostat. Well, that has not changed. The rooms are big but the TV is so far from the bed that you need to watch only from the sofa. Small inconvenience. Unlike some other reviews, I found the room immaculately clean as well as the hallways. Bed is usual super comfortable Starwood quality. The bathroom had granite counter but definitely could use more of an upgrade. My biggest problem is the price for all the extras. I needed a car for one night and parking is $49/night. Breakfast and lunch were only offered as a buffet and $20 for each meal. A premium Scotch at the Java Bar that should have been $10 was $17. Daily internet access is $14. Jeez, it's $20/day to use the fitness club. I know that I was there on a bargain (sarcasm) $219/night conference rate but all these other add-on charges combined with Chicago's outrageous lodging taxes really jacked things up. I am Starwood Gold and the front desk clerk offered no recognition or upgrade. All in all, a disappointing stay. The location is great, though, within easy walking distance of many restaurants fo you are able to escape for at least, more reasonably priced food.

Reviews.Title: “You are the best supporting concierge staff around!”
Reviews.Author: chicago0310
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say thank you for your great concierge staff. My husband and I got separated @ the pier. We were both tired and by feet were killing me! After spending more than an hour looking (unsuccessfully) for him I returned to the hotel and got all the help that I needed. I found that he was not in his room. He had my purse with my cellphone in it and I did not know his CP# (or my own for that matter!). Your wonderful staff allowed me to call my (2) daughters (& leave messages!) and my daughter-in-law also. Along with a friend who was also with the ACI convention. They also called security at the pier. All's well that ends well. My D-i-law called him and told him where I was and then called me to let me know that. You can be very proud of you staff and everyone I met at your hotel. Thanks for a great job all around! Peace, Elizabeth

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: curlyclown
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this Shearaton. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The amenties that were provided were fantastic! I would definitely recommend this hotel. Very close to many points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan0010
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton exceeded our expectations. From making the reservations to checking out, the staff successfully satisfied every need associated with our stay. We were traveling with 2 children (3 and 1), the Sheraton provided us with a spacious club level room - with a very comfortable king bed, sofa and writing desk (still had enough room for the complimentary crib). The view wowed our kids, especially at night. Was even able to arrange tickets to the Shedd Aquarium through the hotel (avoiding the very long lines at the aquarium ticket office). Walking distance to downtown and Navy Pier, short cab ride to the aquarium, museum and soldier field - the Sheraton has now become my hotel of choice when visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, Great Staff and Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Tquinta
Reviews.Content: I booked a Two Double Beds Room in this hotel at a very good rate for 2 nights arriving on March 24. Because of the mixed reviews I went to the hotel with not so high expectations but it turned to be VERY nice!!. We arrived at 3:00 PM on a Wednesday an we greeted by a friendly bellman called Johnny who was always very helpful during our stay. There was nobody in the qeue for check-in and three people in the desk. We were asked if we wanted high or low floor and were given a room on 23 floor with an excellent view of the river, the beds were sooo comfortable. The hotel a GREAT place called the Club Level Lounge on 33 floor were you can go an have complimentary acces to Wifi, computers with unlimited printing, beverages and some food. At this place there was a guy called Rene that was veeeery nice to us and would always chat and give us cookies to take to the room. Also, my son used the pool which was complimentary. The location is excelent, over the river, two blocks to Michigan Ave and has a taxi stop right on it. There are also shuttles to Ohare running every hour from the hotel. All in all, we had a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay and am planning to come back again and again”
Reviews.Author: mindywhiz
Reviews.Content: When we arrived and checked in, 1115am, everything was as smooth as it could be, check in was perfect, they had the note about the rollaway we had requested already and though our room wasn't available yet, she offered to call us when it was and we stored our luggage. When we did make it back, our luggage was brought up to the room (that was a nice service, wonderful!). We did hit the pool, a beautifully laid out one, very kid friendly. But even the roll-away was super comfortable. The room was as perfect as it could be. Comfortable beds. Big enough bathroom. It was like coming home. I knew what to expect and what would be available, and that was nice to offer to friends that hadn't been to the Windy City. I have stayed here for conferences, and came back for leisure, wonderful restuarants within hotel so that later in the evening you are not wandering the town with little people. Great location distance from shopping and train station. Staff was great, room was great, friends were happy, what more could you ask for? :)

Reviews.Title: “Always Nice to "BELONG" at the Chicago Sheraton Hotel & Towers”
Reviews.Author: 1Chef-Michael
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in Chicago, I always stay at the Sheraton Hotel & Towers...it's almost like coming "home" the way the entire staff makes you feel like you "BELONG!" Great/comfortable rooms with views of the Windy City...excellent restauants/bars...fitness center...internet cafe...executive club...A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: Johnny2032
Reviews.Content: After walking into the lobby (spacious, clean, great views of the river), I had high expecations. I thought I was at the Ritz Carlton for a second. Then I saw the rooms and thought Red Roof Inn. Not to mention that the hallways were dark and dingy. Getting back to the rooms, very small with outdated bathrooms. The flatscreen tv was nice and the beds were comfortable, but the there was peeling wallpaper (in the rooms and the hallway) and mold around the base of the bathtub. It wasn't bad, I was just expecting better. I will say that the view of the river was excellent-along with the location of the hotel. Michigan Avenue is just a short walk away, plus there is a Dominick's grocery store, movie theatre, and bowling alley right next door. Gino's East (great pizza) was an 8 dollar cab ride and solf parking (under the hotel) was 35 bucks. The pool was small and filled with about a hundred kids. I must say that the elevators were very quick and we never had to wait. Again, not bad-if they make a few updates with the rooms (especially the bathroom), this place could be great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, and Treatment”
Reviews.Author: EWRFlyerAL
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers for a one-night stay last week. Prior to arriving at the hotel I noticed that I had been upgraded from a Traditional Room to a Club Floor Room. AS an SPG Platinum, I am given lounge access and free Internet. Both of these perks were provided at check-in. While checking in, I asked if a suite might be available as I had a colleague meeting me the following morning and we'd like to do some work before heading off to a meeting. The clerk upgraded me to the biggest suite that I have ever stayed in. The Three-Bay Suite consisted of a large living room/dining room area with a couch (pulled out to a Queen-size bed), chairs, a table that seated six, a bathroom, and a separate bar/kitchen room. It also had a King-size Murphy bed tucked into the wall. The connecting room was also mine (it had another regular King-size bed and bathroom). This room would work well for a family. The lounge is located on the 33rd floor and is one of the nicest that I have seen. Breakfast was excellent and snacks were provided in the evening. I was also able to print and fax some documents for free and get a quick rub-down from the massage chair in the lounge. The hotel's staff are all very friendly and overall this is a top-notch Starwood property. I plan to return on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: cosmotron
Reviews.Content: The best part of my stay was both hotel and room locations. Like many hotels in downtown, Sheraton was nicely located and near everything - e.g., across the street from NBC Towers (great little cafe in their lobby if you don't feel like dishing out $$ for hotel food), a short block from movie theaters and restaurants. Even in cold March weather, I found myself walking everywhere (Michigan Ave, Art Institute, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, etc.). My room on the 16th floor with an eastern view overlooked the Pier and Lake Michigan as well as the river - very nice! Quiet room, very spacious (king bed room), and clean. Housekeeping was great and accommodated my request for extra coffee and tea daily (I was there for business). Internet was fine but would've appreciated a discounted multiple-night package vs. paying $12.95/day. Since there was no wireless (other than public areas), I had to use a cable for the internet in my room. I'd recommend that the hotel invest in LONGER cables as one does not always work at the desk. It was a stretch to bring my laptop to the bed closest to the desk/cable. Food was expensive but good. I only ate at their cafe two times (for breakfast and for lunch) due to time constraints. There are so many other options nearby so I found wonderful restaurants during my 6-day stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “got a room at a great price, however renovations are needed to keep up with competition”
Reviews.Author: caricature
Reviews.Content: The Good Awesome location, near shopping, movie theatre and a few restaurants. Price- we got a good deal online, second night was 50% off. So averaging out, it cost us under 100$ a night (excluding taxes) during a weekend. The Bad We arrived on a Friday night and service was slow during check in. Every time we had a question, we just didn't bother going to the front desk anymore because there was always a line and only one person working there at any given time. So if there are 5 people in front of you trying to check in, 5 people times at least 5-7 minutes each, you do the math. Ya, I never saw a second person come out to help the person in front. Maybe I just wasn't lucky, but still. The decor of the guestroom and the bathroom needs to be changed. Beds were comfortable but everything else looks tired and needs to be renovated. The hallways were cold and depressing. Internet was spotty. It kept on charging us each time we logged on to surf the net. Talked to guest services and front desk about the problem and they took the extra charges off. If you are in Chicago for a weekend with your family or friends and just need a place to crash (and you are low-maintenance), this is more than adequate, but if you are used to traveling on business and expecting a higher standard of service and product, then I'd think twice. I'm really hoping that they will renovate this property and improve on their level of service- because they do have a lot of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: chingy98
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on priceline -- so I only paid $60 not the normal rate of $190ish. For $60, I have no complaints. But I kept thinking how mad I'd be if I paid the full rate. The room was okay, but the closet stinks -- the door won't stay open so I had to prop it. The mini-bar rattled through the night, so I had to unplug it for some quiet. And, honestly, any "four star" hotel should have more than an el cheapo clock radio. I honestly expect, because I have seen it at other high end hotels, a clock radio that is ipod compatible. Last small complaint, no USA Today was left at my door in the AM. Again, a quick 24 hour stay, no major deficiencies -- but a lot of little complaints that a promoted high end hotel should be doing well -- and they didn't. Because in the end, isn't it the little luxuries that distinguish your stay?

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel made better by an outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: JdubyaMO
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Chicago Auto Show, and this was the "official" hotel for the show. We got a fair rate plus free tickets to the show, so we chose to stay there. From the moment we pulled into the driveway and were greeted by the bellman, our experience with the staff was excellent. Everyone was polite, courteous, and helpful. Although the room seemed clean, the beds were comfortable, it was quite, and the price was nice, it's not a "gotcha" hotel in terms of being out of the ordinary. And that's not a snub, it was a nice place. But the staff is what really makes you want to stay there again, they're that good. A word of caution. Use the valet service if you have a car to park. The self-park is across the street and underground, so it may not be the safest place to park. I didn't have any problems, but I really didn't want to go out to my car after dark when I forgot to get something out of it. And it was $16 a day, so it was no bargain. Use the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: pyw4411
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the host hotels for the "Chicago Style" gymnastics meet. The hotel was easy to find and the location was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The shuttle to the Navy Pier was fast and efficient. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. However, you will be charged a â€œfeeâ€� for use of the computer and use of the workout room. Donâ€™t touch the water bottles in the room unless you want to pay an arm and a leg. Parking costs $50 for overnight. The rooms are poorly insulated and you can hear everyone and everything that goes on in the halls and in the rooms around and above you. The hotel was nice but overall I was not impressed especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DolceMeta
Reviews.Content: One of the better Sheratons I have stayed in. It is tucked away behind Michigan Ave, but close enough. The Club Level rooms were nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Sheraton Club Staff”
Reviews.Author: kbarnhar
Reviews.Content: Evening staff were a delight. Gave great ideas for dinner and evening entertainment. I usual stay at the Marriott, however, after this trip I will definitely recommend the Sheraton Towers to other colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but should include all with the price”
Reviews.Author: ptabby
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay overall, but was upset by having to pay extra for Wifi and to use the workout room! Sure you can swim free, but there's no hot tub. I have never had to pay to use a treadmill at a hotel before. Breakfast cost an arm and a leg as well. It seems that no one will leave the hotel for breakfast because it's quite a walk, so they can charge whatever they want. I feel that the price I paid to stay at the hotel should have covered the rest of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: TheReservationist
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when I booked my room at a seemingly good discount for New Years Eve. When My friend and I arrived we were totally psyched to see our room because the lobby was so gorgeous. Check in went smoothly and we were allowed to check in a few hours early. When we walked to the elevators there were security guys asking to see everyones key card, I'm still not exactly sure what the deal was( they were gone when we got back from the club we went to at about 2 am.). They elevators were a bit small but whatever. When we got out on our floor (18) it was absolutely freezing. We found our room and finally got in after having some difficulty with our key cards. We were so disappointed when we saw how small the room was . We actually thought there was something in bouth the beds at first because the covers were so lumpy. We dropped our stuff and headed out for some pre-party shopping without really checking things out. When we got back a bit later we started exploring. We found the mini bar inside the dresser/tv stand. It was disgusting. I would never have eaten anything that had been in that thing. Then we discovered that once you opened the doors on the dresser, they wouldn't stay shut unless slammed. My friend decided she wanted to take a nice long bath and went into the bathroom. And immediately walked back out. When I went to see what the problem was I saw a filthy tub that had some thing yellow and crusty on the edge. There was hair all over one of the towels and so much mildew gathered in the corners I refused to walk in there barefoot. When it was my turn to shower, I looked up and saw a pube hanging out next to the one and only light in the bathroom( it provided very little actual light. The towels were like sand paper too. The next morning we waited 15 minutes to get an elevator going down that wasn't over crowded. We finally had to take one that was going up (as did several other people). It then took us 15 minutes to get to the lobby. I could feel the floor flexing everytime someone shifted their wait. There were a few other things that bothered me as well but this review (complaint?) is already too long. The beds were really comfy though.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel Experience in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: atlbeachbum81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2009 for a wedding in Chicago. The weekend started off very interestingly. My fiance and I checked into the hotel and were given our key and told our luggage would be up in a few minutes. We got to the elevator and this nice man held the door for us, so we got in and noticed he was going to the same floor as us. We got off the elevator and stopped to look at our room number again. The man walked to the left, what a coincidence our room was to the left also. So we were maybe 10 steps behind him and we noticed he puts his key into what we think is the room we were just given and goes inside. Hmm... no it can't be the same room, the concierge must have written down the wrong number. So we stood for a few minutes in the hallway trying to think what we should do, well let's just try the key to make sure it doesn't work and she did write down the wrong number. Umm, yea it worked and we ran back to the elevator and downstairs to tell them they had checked us into a room that apparently already was being occupied. The concierge was extremely nice and even upgraded our room for the inconvenience which of course made it even better. The rest of the weekend was great. I will say the beds are super soft, you basically sink right in as soon as you lay down. The location was great, especially since we were a 10 minute walk from the park and spent most of the weekend there for Taste of Chicago. Also close to all the stores so if you forget any last minute items (like I did) its a quick walk down to whatever store you could ever want.

Reviews.Title: “If you go in the summer, the rooms are "sticky" and humid”
Reviews.Author: simplechic
Reviews.Content: They need a dehumidifier. My hair looked like awful the whole time. Haha. They need to work on the air quality. On a serious note, the rooms were refurbished and very nice. The amenities are great (nice lounge, excellent concierge service) -- only complaint is the Wifi. I think you should get it free and not get nickeled and dimed so much. Location is great and there is a Domenicks and Walgreens very close by if you forget anything.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: travelingmares
Reviews.Content: Great location. Views from my room were great - could see the Navy Pier, John Hancock, etc. Bar on the lobby level is really nice. The gym is quite nice, but it was an extra charge. I was on the conceirge floor, and the food/drink amenties were a nice touch. Conceirge was helpful The rooms are nothing out of the ordinary, but, all in all, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no free Internet in rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsBee711
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton through Hotwire.com and picked it because it was cheap and it said we'd have free Internet. We thought that meant we'd have it in our room - unfortunately, we did not. You have to use the Link Cafe downstairs below the main level to get free Internet - it was $13 a day to have it in your room. That was a bit disappointing. Otherwise, the location was good (near Navy Pier, not far from Millennium Park, right on the river). The room was clean, although in the bathroom we found it funny that they had cut a hole in the light cover to accommodate a different bulb. The staff was very friendly and we enjoyed our stay there. We'd recommend it, but likely would try a different hotel the next time we're in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, just an okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOTB1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for a personal trip on December 29, for 3 nights. We went for the Chicago Blackhawks New Year's Eve Game vs. the New Jersey Devils, and the Hawks won 5-1. What a game! The Hawks have the most amazing fans, such passion! Most people there that night were in the Hawks colors; jerseys, jackets, shirts, it was definitely a night to remember! The United Centre was full with excitement that night, what a great place! If you are a hockey fan, you should listen to their Goal Horn on You Tube, itâ€™s the best I have ever heard. Their opening videos were awesome too! This is the best game environment I have ever seen, and so far, this was the 5th NHL Arena I have attended. You can tell that the Chicago Blackhawks have been working hard on putting together a team of Staff that are pleasant, friendly and helpful. Hotel We stayed at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers, and although this hotel is located in a great location, it definitely needs some renovations. I would rate this a 3 star hotel, it was clean for the most part, just getting rundown. Parking is below the hotel, it is a big city so parking is expensive, and our $35 a night was actually an okay price. If you have mobility issues or lots of kids/luggage, you might want to consider Valet, as the walk back to the Hotel Lobby is a bit long. We felt safe here in Chicago, there is a lot to see and do, it is up to you just how much walking, shopping, eating and sightseeing you want to do. On New Yearâ€™s Eve night, the hotel was full and I guess security was doing its best but it was lacking, as we had people running up and down the hallways at midnight pounding on the doors and hollering, nice! The next morning, we noticed a lamp on the floor, toppled over and unplugged, it was one of those lamps on the table by the elevators. We mentioned this to the Front Desk Staff and they didnâ€™t seem to care, and an hour later when we left to check out, it was still there. This part is definitely worth mentioning, on our last day at the breakfast buffet, someone threw up at their entrance and on the carpet on the way to the washrooms, not a very appealing sight or smell, and about a hour later, the mess still hadnâ€™t been cleaned up, there towels on the puke at the doorway and there were still chunks of food on the carpet on the way to the washrooms, a line of food about 4 feet long, and the smell, you can just imagine. I donâ€™t understand why it took so long to clean up that mess, you would think that they would be all over that given the location of the restaurant entrance and hallway to the parking garage, the smell was very powerful. I was disappointed with Guest Services too, we order a box of Kleenex and some plastic cups, it took 3 calls to Guest Services, this was very slow service, from my 1st phone call to 3rd phone call, it was probably an hour. Sights We walked down to the Navy Pier, not much happening there this time of the year, mostly limited kids/family activities, I hear it is really busy in the summer. They have dinner cruises going out from here too. We hit the Magnificent Mile, and there is a ton of shopping/window shopping here, lots of great stores, bring your credit cards! The bridges and waterways are really nice, lots of great opportunities for pictures. We were only there for 2 days, and with the cold weather, we werenâ€™t able to sightsee as much as we would of liked to. The AMC Theatre is just across the parking lot of the hotel, I think it has 21 theatres, it was huge and busy, and we went one night and saw a movie, Avatar. The Magnificent Mile is walking distance away, only 3 blocks. We did a ton on walking, we used taxis to and from the United Centre for the game, and we felt safe. The cost of a taxi to the United Centre was about $11 each way. Food We only ate 1 meal at the Hotel; they were a bit pricey for us. We had their breakfast buffet on the last day, $22.95/person, it was good food. Usually for breakfast we ate at the West Egg Cafe, 620 North Fairbanks Court, it was good, busy and reasonably priced, just up the Street from the hotel about 2 blocks. We went to the Dominickâ€™s grocery store a few times across the parking lot, for a few items and for the Starbucks there. Actually there is a Starbucks on every other corner here in Chicago, they are everywhere. We had lunch at the Burrito Beach, 200 East Ohio Street; we loved these burritos, we wish we could get them here in Canada. We ate dinner at the Dao Thai Restaurant, 230 East Ohio Street, Chicago, we enjoyed this restaurant too! On our last night we went to Pizzeria Uno, 29 East Ohio Street, this was a bit of a disappointment. We had their special and it was kind of boring, no real flavor, just pizza with lots of veggies and very little pepperoni or sausage. Their crust was flavorless too, just dough (for me it was a waste of carbs LOL). This place requested us to order our food as soon as we arrived and had us sitting in their lobby until our table is ready, as the pizzas take an hour to cook. We wouldn't go back and I would try another pizza place, in our mind it wasn't the best. We actually preferred the pizza at the Dominickâ€™s Grocery Store. We loved Garrettâ€™s popcorn, there is a location just off the Magnificent Mile and at Navy Pier, yummy! I am sure Chicago is beautiful in the nicer/warmer months being on the water and all. In the winter, they have lights up and the City is well taken care, that is obvious, not a lot of begging or people sleeping in the streets, or even cigarette butts littered around. Yes it is windy and cold, if you are going in the winter and you donâ€™t wear a hat, at least get earmuffs. We will definitely be going back to Chicago in nicer/warmer weather. I really like the walkways along the waterways both the lake and the river. There is a lot history here and the buildings are been taken care of. My biggest surprise was on how clean Chicago is and how friendly the people in Chicago are.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted sleek romantic room...”
Reviews.Author: misstamimichelle
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I decided to take a short trip to Chicago last week.. and after doing some research on Trip Advisor we booked the Sheraton Hotel & Towers. I was concerned about the rate being so low, $76.50 per night, but I booked anyway. I always love a good deal!.. Check-in was less than organized. Long lines & no one seemed to be in control. Bar didn't open until 3pm.. some of us like to have a drink around 11am. sorry! When the bar was open it was super lame. Not really a fun or hip vibe. The only place to get coffee was located down on a different level - which no one told us about. I went 4 days thinking the hotel had no coffee.. Rooms had ZERO light. There were about 3 lamps - which did nothing! I couldn't believe how dark our room was! Aside from that - the rooms are SUPER dated. Clean.. but dated. $35.00 per night for parking with no in/out's. THIRTY-FIVE dollars. Kinda expensive for a room that was only $76.50.. Also.. our room did not get cleaned one night of our stay.. rude. Positive. VERY well located. 2 blocks from Michigan Ave!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Value for average rooms”
Reviews.Author: ZP83
Reviews.Content: Being a loyal SPG member, I decided to give the Sheraton a try. I was deeply disappointed in the lack of service and the very dated rooms. This huge hotel has a great location to michigan avenue and that was about the extent of my stay. The rooms were small and beaten to death by previous guests and a lack of up keep by the hotel staff. really over paid per night to stay there and really regret spending the money. This was supposed to be a bit of a romantic get away and it was far from it. Now granted this was over a year ago and there may have been improvements but I did not enjoy my stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but computers suck in "Link"”
Reviews.Author: Geno58
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated the work of the housekeeping staff; our rooms were immaculate daily. However, the computers in the "Link" cafe were atrocious. Many guests, including myself, had difficulty logging on frequently. Half of the 6 or so computers didn't work at times. Staff told me I could use the Business Center instead, for a fee, of course. No free breakfast plus parking fees. The fitness center was minimal; not too many weight machines and no current upgraded ellipticals. The 'refreshing' towels offered were wet and refrigerated! Go figure; do I want a cold wet towel on me when I'm sweating? Think not.

Reviews.Title: “first rate”
Reviews.Author: beaveMoline_IL
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and beautiful. The view was magnificent. Housekeeping staff was attentive, friendly, courteous and efficient. The bed was luxurious. Front desk was welcoming and friendly. The management takes a personal touch in making the guest feel at home and demonstrates a direct interest in making each guest feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: omabluebird
Reviews.Content: I am no great fan of big city hotels. I prefer a nice comfort inn with free parking and breakfast. But each year I go to Chicago during Midwest music clinic with my kids to baby sit and help out. This year we stayed at the Sheraton and I really enjoyed it. The staff was friendly and the room was beautiful, with a nice view. I made friends with the housekeeper on our floor the first day and never lacked for plenty of whatever I needed. The pool is free, although I had been confused when I read that the fitness center charged. Corporate messed up my sons reservations just about every way they could, including charging for days not reserved. It was a mess, but when we arrived everything was fine. I did not eat in the hotel or use room service. On the nights I stayed in to babysit, I grabbed food from Dominicks and Fox and Obels. This hotel is close to lots of things. A great location.

Reviews.Title: “Super close to Michigan Ave....without paying Michigan ave prices!”
Reviews.Author: mickeynorm
Reviews.Content: The great thing about this hotel is that it is very very close to Michigan avenue, but you don't have to pay michigan avenue hotel prices! Seriously -- almost 60 dollars cheaper for one block over!!! Our room was small, but clean. We had the view of the river/lake, which was wonderful!!! Great restaurants in walking distance as well as in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: SunFlight
Reviews.Content: I generally like Sheratons. They're usually solid hotels with decent amenities. We stayed at the Chicago downtown Sheraton and were disappointed. The room was tired, the walls were very thin, the self-park is outrageous even though you have to walk almost a block to actually get to it. The club lounge breakfast staff didn't bring or fill up coffee, it was complete buffet. The front staff wouldn't even look to see if there was an opportunity for an upgrade. Our hallway in the morning was filled with room service trays. Overall I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good; Management on the ball”
Reviews.Author: JATB
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is clean and decent with good size rooms - some have excellent views, others without. It could use some TLC on the remodeling front in the rooms, but otherwise is good. All of the bathroom sinks are made of this composite, faux-marble that breaks and chips. I stayed here earlier in the year with no issues and knew what to expect. On the morning we checked out, we got stuck in the elevator for over 30 minutes. The management was all over this. They were extremely apologetic, they comped breakfast for our group and were extremely concerned. Management was totally on the ball. Despite this hiccup, we'd stay here again. Love the location and staff are very attentive. More on our Chicago Trip: http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2009/12/thanksgiving-in-chicago.html

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & Centre of it all”
Reviews.Author: DublinCheerie
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for a week with my family this hotel is huge so clean has comfy beds foods great staff couldn,t of being any nicer. stayed here for thanksgiving it was fabulous second time in chicago and still want to go back again ... the hotel is within walkin distance to both state street and michicgan avenue.There,s taxis right outside the hotel and the concierge can also ring for mini buses if your travelling with a big crowd.there,s also a cinema 2 mins away opposite the hotel . Perfect Hotel for a great get away ...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: payanaToronto
Reviews.Content: The lobby / interiors was great and nice, but the amenties within the room were not so good. We travelled with a baby and wanted to use the mini fridge in the room, but it was filled with snacks which were on a pay per snack bases. We had no space to keep baby milk/bottles in there. The staff in the conceirges were not very friendly either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and friendly, professional courteous staff in Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: craigelachie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I truly enjoyed our recent stay at this Sheraton Hotel. The value for money was outstanding - I know the price we paid is a reflection of the current difficult economic conditions but it really was worth much more money. The room and facilities were very comfortable and became our home during a week of constant activity. We looked forward to coming back to our room every evening, our "island of tranquility", which overlooked the river and was very quiet. The front desk and housekeeping staff made us feel like special guests every day. We really liked the free internet access in the link cafÃ©; the complimentary Starbuck's coffee and Tazo Teas are a generous and welcome amenity. Every hotel employee we met was helpful and pleasant. We loved the central location for our stay during Thanksgiving Week and will not hesitate to return to this hotel when the next opportunity presents itself. There is much we could say about the little things that make a stay enjoyable, and it is obvious that staff training and attention to detail as well as the intangibles, "positive attitude, pride and willingness to please the customer" are very evident throughout your facility.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby room. Nickel and dime pricing.”
Reviews.Author: phinicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a very busy conference, so it would not be fair to rate some of the services. The room we were given can best be described as shabby. The alarm clock radio did not work and had to be replaced. The heating system was antiquated and did not work adequately. The toilet leaked onto the floor during the entire stay. The doors for the closet and cabinets did not stay open as they were hung incorrectly. There was no free internet or wifi available on the property and they charged $12 to use the fitness center. The public rooms, staff and the facilities were nice and there were restaurant choices. Location is great and I would advise that you check out the room first to see if it has been updated in the last 20 years before unpacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a weekend Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: OutandAboutwithU
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stay with my husband at the Sheraton. I just love it. First of all, it is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Michigan Avenue but very close to walk to. It is just minutes walk from Navy Pier and is directly across the street from AMC East 21 Movie theater and Lizzy McNeils Pub. You really dont need to leave your block if you just want to relax for a weekend get away, stroll Navy Pier, catch a movie or grab a pint. The rooms are very clean and the beds are great!!! We had a corner room so it had 3 windows and was bigger than most. One thing I noticed is that you never wait for an elevator. One came instantly and the hotel was very busy with conventions and weddings. The valet parking does kinda stink. It does cost 50.00 but directly across the street is a parking garage. It may still cost but at least you dont have to wait so long to get your car. The staff however was very friendly and willing to help. It also helps when you tip. People who work in hotels dont make tons of money. So leave your housekeeper afew dollars on a pillow and tip the man hailing you a cab or bartender making you a drink. Definatley would recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vin004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Navy Pier. Nice Lobby. The room was clean, but small. My only complaint is the bed was very uncomfortable. I would recommend the hotel because of the location but hopefully they will get some new beds!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: burberryloverMidwest
Reviews.Content: Hotel is much nicer this visit than we had in the summer. We were glad because we have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 10 years and always liked to stay here. The new mattresses are very comfortable and the rooms very clean.. Hotel was very accomodating and upgraded us to the Club Level when we checked in early. Had a nice view of the lake and the Chicago River. Breakfast on the Club Level was very good, especially the bakery items. We will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TarahSchraff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for my cousin's wedding in October. The room was very nice with a fantastic view! There were also a lot of bars within walking distance for my sister and I. The wedding and reception were held at the hotel and they were beautiful! The hotel even offered a mini reception outside before the main event began. We got to enjoy drinks and hor' dorves right next to the river!! After the wedding the group all went to a little karaoke bar right next to the hotel. It was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service all around”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: We bring a group once a year to eat and party and thank our clients. This was our first stay at this property. We got a special pre-paid internet rate of $109/night. WHAT a bargain! The location is fabulous. We joined the Starwood club upon check-in and were given corner rooms on the top floors. There was free water and Starbucks coffee in the rooms. The room had GREAT views and was quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The reason I give it four stars is because we had terrible reception on CBS; couldn't get it at all. Also, the free wireless in the room never worked after many attempts. We had to pay to access the internet. Also, there's a $12 fee to use the exercise facility and pool. I think that's high, although they did have very good machines and an excellent facility. We found the staff to be over the top friendly and helpful. Though the decor is a bit dated, it is warm and spacious with beautiful views from the lobby and bar areas. The ceilings are lower than some hotels, so the noise level never bothered us. I hope to stay here in the future- we were very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “great location-shame about the Bank of America Protest outside”
Reviews.Author: superman_lover
Reviews.Content: we hae just got back and want to start off with a Thank You to Alex and Alex (on the reception)for making our stay very pleasant. The Hotel has great views of Lake Michigan from our 34th Floor Room. Staying on the 34th Floor means we also had Complimentary Breakfast. The Hotel is well Maintained and looks like it has been kitted out for Business travellers, this means that the lobby has all the latest gadgets and gizmos. For example, there ae touchscreen tables that act as a eletronic chessboard/tour guide/GPS Map and much more things. Whilst you are there, check out the apple pie in the Chicago Burger Co.it's on the bottom floor and the pies are wonderful. Lastly, it would be remiss of me to not mention the BOA Protest. Basically they breached security in the Lobby, but were Kicked out by the police. They then carried on outsde for 30mins or so.The General Manager wrote all the guests an apology letter

Reviews.Title: “Good, large, convenient hotel in the loop”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers for 3 nights. The hotel is large and well run. The location is excellent for any activities in the loop. High floors have good views of the river, the lake or the city. Rooms were well appointed and clean. I paid about $180 per night (before taxes), which seemed OK for the location, but not a super value. One quirk was that the room service was not available for lunch - you had to go to one of the restaurants in the lobby or the lower levels. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly, which is not always the case in big city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Property in decline--my 2nd stay one year later”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 year prior for 3 nights and property was much better managed then. Returned this year for 4 nights (2 for a conference in hotel, 2 additional for pleasure). Can't say I'd choose to return here, even if the conference ends up being here once again next year. Once again, I stayed in an upper floor "corner" king club floor room. My list of complaints: 1. Poor lighting in room--room was very dark at night. CFL bulbs were not of a high enough wattage/luminence. 2. General service throughout hotel was lacking. Received a fax delivered to my door 24 hours late--and was still charged nearly $15 for it. Never did a doorman open a door for me, even though they were always around and plentiful. 3. Hotel dining options were pathetic for such a huge hotel. Two nights we were forced out of the hotel to dine because the only dinner option in the hotel was Shula's Steakhouse (very expensive) or room service (expensive and limited options). Totally unacceptable for a hotel this size. 4. Club lounge has practically become a joke. Soft drinks are not readily available anymore except upon request from club room staff--who aren't always present. Continental breakfast pastry selection is good, but they don't even offer any eggs, hardboiled or otherwise, anymore. Evening cocktails has also become rather lame--food selections were rather limited and not very interesting. Massage chair in lounge was out of order. Lounge wasn't often very clean/presentable especially during peak hours. 5. Daily newspapers no longer delivered to room door in morning. Papers were available at/near the Club Lounge entrance by the elevators. 6. In-room high-speed internet access is not necessarily included on the Club Floor. I was booked under two different rates during my stay--conference rate (the more expensive rate) didn't include free internet while a promotional (less expensive) rate did include it. Ridiculous, especially for a Club Floor room. The positives I'd care to mention are few. Like the other 2 Sheraton's I've stayed at in the past 18 months, beds were very comfortable (although they lacked an ample number of pillows!). Housekeeping was generally good--room was kept clean. Overall, an overpriced, overrated hotel that is slipping in quality fast. Unless you get a great deal on the room rate, or need to stay here for a conference, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent for the price and the location is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: blauerMond
Reviews.Content: Since we got an incredible cheap price for the trip, I was not sure if it was going to be good. It was. The rooms are average, bed unbelievable comfortable and awesome view to the Navy Pier. When we arrived there was a confusion about our trip having breakfast or not: they solved it without hesitation by saying we had, but also gave us 1 breakfast buffet (which was really, REALLY good) for the 5 of us, plus the afternoon snacks (which I'm sure we didn't have access to). So, just to point out: excellent service basically everywhere: at the check in, solving our little breakfast problem, at the restaurant. The location is perfect, it is walking distance to Michigan Ave., the Millennium Park, it was really convenient for us. I think I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and upmarket changin facilities”
Reviews.Author: joychild
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Virgin Holidays but as a member of the hotelâ€™s loyalty scheme I contacted the hotel with our preferences before checking in. We had spent the previous night at the Hyatt across the road as due to flight cancellations by Virgin we arrived in Chicago a day early, but couldnâ€™t get an extra night at the Sheraton. We strolled across the river to see if we could leave our bags at the hotel before checking in that afternoon and they checked us in there and then (08:15), with a king bedded room overlooking the river, though on the 8th floor (Room 855) but not a high floor as we had hoped. But we were pleased that we could get into our room and went straight back to get our cases and settle ourselves in for 4 nights. The room was reasonably sized as we were on the corner and so had a bit more room than in the hotelâ€™s website pictures. There was a small safe but it was only big enough to store a small travel wallet, and couldnâ€™t store valuables such as cameras. There was also a key that you had to carry around with you rather than a combination. The room should have been relatively quiet but there was some noise from the road across the river as well as a small amount of river traffic. It was also in an alcove at the end of the corridor but unfortunately for us we had some inconsiderate neighbours who despite them putting a sign out asking for quiet didnâ€™t reciprocate this as they came and went at all hours slamming doors etc. We did use the pool and were quite impressed by the size for a city hotel.
